story:
Short Summary / Korte Samenvatting

Hi! My name is Lotta Rasva and I'm a singer-songwriter from the Netherlands.  I write popsongs about many different subjects and while doing that I try to avoid clichés. Through singing and playing guitar I share my thoughts about stupid problems,  love hassle and things I just like very much.
Now it's time to put those songs on an EP and your help is very welcome!
Hallo! Mijn naam is Lotta Rasva en ik ben een singer-songwriter uit Almelo. Ik schrijf popliedjes over veel verschillende onderwerpen en probeer daarbij clichés te vermijden. Door middel van zang en gitaar deel ik mijn gedachtes over stomme problemen, gedoe in de liefde en dingen die ik gewoon heel leuk vind.
Nu is het tijd om die liedjes op een EP te zetten, en jouw hulp is heel erg welkom!

What I Need & What You Get / Wat Ik Nodig Heb & Wat Jij Krijgt

To be able to make my EP I need money for the following things:

  • Recording. I'm going to record my EP at Buildadyke Studio in Antwerp.
  • Artwork/Photoshoot. to make my EP look good I need professional pictures and help with designing the cover.
  • Printing. I need to get those professional pictures printed on the cd's + covers.
  • Promotion. When my EP is ready to be sold, I need people to know about it!

When you donate something you will not only make me happy, but you can get a lot of Perks too! Check them out!

Om mijn EP te kunnen maken heb ik geld nodig voor de volgende dingen:

  • Opnemen. Ik ga mijn EP opnemen bij Buildadyke Studio in Antwerpen.
  • Artwork/fotoshoot. Om mijn EP er mooi uit te laten zien heb ik professionele foto's nodig en hulp bij het ontwerpen van de cover.
  • Drukwerk. Die professionele foto's moeten natuurlijk ook op de cd's + covers worden gedrukt.
  • Promotie. Wanneer mijn EP klaar is om verkocht te worden, moeten mensen dit te weten komen!

Wanneer je iets  doneert maak je me niet alleen heel blij, maar kun je ook Perks krijgen. Check them out!


How Do I Pay? / Hoe Kan Ik Betalen?

You can pay via Paypal, with a paypal account or a credit card (Guest Checkout). If you can't pay with one of those options, but still really want to support me, you can also transfer money straight to my bankaccount: NL37ABNA0596719256 (in the name of Lotta Rasva). Just mention the perk you want and add your adress and zip code so I can send it to you!

Je kunt betalen via paypal, met een paypal acount of een credit card (Guest Checkout). Als je niet met één van deze opties kan betalen maar me wel heel graag wil steunen, kun je het geld direct overmaken naar mijn bankrekening:  NL37ABNA0596719256 (op naam van Lotta Rasva). Vermeld de perk die je wilt en je adresgegevens zodat ik het naar je op kan sturen!

E-mail: lottarasva@live.com

Thank you! Dankje!

story:
Short Summary

The Gesualdo Chamber Choir was founded in 2000 by conductor András Stimecz with the aim to popularize Hungarian culture worldwide and introduce foreign choral traditions to Hungary. The choir is made up of 25 members from a variety of professional backgrounds, including teachers, scientists, clerics, accountants, carpenters, and engineers. The choir's repertoire consists mainly of choral works from the renaissance and 20th century, as well as contemporary pieces in Hungarian, English, Latin, Italian, French, and German.

The Gesualdo Choir has earned several national and international awards, winning top ratings in Hungary as well as 2nd and 3rd place prizes at the prestigious Tonen choir competition in the Netherlands. The Choir performs 15 times each year within Hungary, and continually seeks opportunities to spread the beauty of the Hungarian choral tradition abroad.  

What We Need & What You Get

This year, the Gesualdo Choir has the opportunity to participate in one of the most renowned choir events in the world, the Llangollen competition in Wales. In early July, 2015, some of the best choral groups from around the globe will gather in Wales. However, to participate in this prestigious once-in-a-lifetime competition, it is up to choir members to raise the necessary funds. 

The Choir must raise $10,000 to cover transportation and accommodation expenses for all 25 members and the conductor. 

In exchange for your help, we have a number of wonderful gifts to send you as tokens of our appreciation, including CDs and DVDs of choir performances. The most generous donors will also have the chance to meet the choir via a live online streaming event and performance! 

The Impact 

Hungarian culture is rich with musical traditions, yet many of the country's most talented composers remain relatively unknown to the outside world. By supporting the Gesualdo Choir you are helping spread the edifying sounds of truly great Hungarian choral music. In addition, you are providing a talented choir with a chance to compete internationally at the highest level in the world of traditional music. 

Thank you!

story:
Hello ladies, gentlefolk, music lovers & chiptunerds across the world. My name is Richard 'Jay' Lewis, founder of the passionate chiptune music blog, ‘Chip! Bit! Sid!’

Before I start mouthing off about the project let me give you some context about Chip Bit Sid.

The History

I started Chip Bit Sid back in April 2015, a couple months after leaving Futurecop’s record label, We Are The Future! Whilst running the label, I found myself listening to chiptune music, often playing the likes of ‘PROTODOME’,'Sabrepulse' &‘Anamanaguchi’. Through that time chiptune quickly became my number 1 music genre. However as I started to listen more frequently, I found that the community had very limited promotion, with many fantastic songs often going unheard. From realising this, I wanted to give the genre a push & further help the community.

So after getting myself organised, I set up Chip! Bit! Sid! and started off reviewing chiptune music every week. From there the blog began to grow and only got bigger when I joined GameFace.

The Birthday

2015 has been amazing for not just the blog, but chiptune in general with artists everywhere releasing epic material, and even getting on Forbes! So obviously I wanted to aim on making 2016 even better!

Recently it occurred to me that Chip Bit Sid’s 1st birthday was coming up and after realising it, I had an idea: to set up a kickass chiptune night!

The Event

The event will be held on April 23rd (Saturday) at the Kings Arms, Salford from 6pm-11pm.
We have a number of confirmed artists artists lined up such as:
  • Auracle 
  • .Mpegasus
  • Euan Lynn
  • JELLYATRIX
  • gwEm
  • 2xAA
  • Rituals (Visuals)
However we'd like to get some potential artists such as:
  • J3WEL
  • HARLEYLIKESMUSIC
From that lineup it sounds AWESOME! Artists will be given a 30-45 minute slot, with 10 minutes between for drinks and to change sets. The Kings Arms is a fantastic venue, with a maximum capacity of 120 people, close to Bus routes & Salford Central train station.
Both GameFace & µcollective will helping out in promotion & collaboration.
This is a great opportunity to support the chiptune community and a great way to meet like-minded people. If you want to back this project and got involved in something great, here's what's on offer (if people outside of the UK would like to be involved, we also have perks for you too)!

• The Ticket

We have various stages which include the ticket to Chip Bit Day. Just pledge to be entitled to a ticket, and when the date comes, just bring your pledge information as confirmation.

• The exclusive 'Chip Bit Sid' cartridge lanyard

This is getting made exclusively for just Chip Bit Day! The Cartridge will be made to order out of moulded plastic by fellow geek enthusiast, Jimmy Clarke. Artwork done by yours truly. See below for the prototype:

• Exclusive Backer A4 Poster

For those who more than just the cart, I've recruited illustrator Luke Farley to do the exclusive backer A3 poster. Each poster will be rolled up & shipped along, with lanyard to ensure quality. Below are pieces of what Luke has created.
We decided to scrap the old poster and instead use the poster that we're using for CHIP BIT DAY. The poster will be lithographically printed , to show off an amazing quality! Check it out below:


• Auracle's red Gameboy

Auracle has kindly given one of his modded gameboys & a smart cartridge to the chiptune cause. Comes with ticket & lanyard. Check out Auracle's Facebook page for more!

• Black, white & blue Gameboys
After Auracle's gameboy was sold pretty quickly, I decided that I'd give away a couple of mine. A 10 dollar gift certificate for Kitch Benns will also be included to help you obtain a flash cart.
Tech specs: 

• Black & white shell with stock buttons and battery cover
• 3mm volume-adjustable prosound output (bottom left)
• Blue backlit screen


Risks

Of course with crowd funding there are risks. The hire of the venue however is not one of them, as this has already been paid. However, if we exceed the capacity of 120, the event will be moved to a bigger location.
All money received will go to paying for the artists playing as well as the crowd funding rewards & advertisements across manchester.

Questions & Information

Any questions about the event, you can reach me via:
facebook / twitter / Soundcloud / Blog

story:
Intro

My name is Sergio Barer. I am a composer that started as a concert pianist but drifted toward composition in the 90s. A notable landmark for me was the release of a CD with my 2 piano concertos recorded in Europe in 2014. (You can see more details at www.sergiobarer.net) In 2013 I met Terry and Theresa Danne and I started to work with the San Fernando Valley Master Chorale (www.sfvmc.org) in the creation of "Moses, an Oratorio".  Terry retired in 2015 but the SFVMC continued to work with me on this project and now we are less than 2 months away from the premiere.

My late mentor, Mario Feninger, told me a couple of years ago that all that has come before in my musical career was really leading to this project. And I think he was right. This project takes my musical talent and hard-won knowledge and channels it toward something bigger than myself, the story of the prophet that gave us the Torah and set the basis for Judaism and eventually for Christianity.  

Keeping my Judaism alive has always been important to me, and I think this work will have a role in keeping alive the Judaism of others, but while working with the SFVMC, I realized that the details of the Old Testament are not as well known to many Christians as they are to Jews and so this work helps inform them about their history and background. Let me give you an example. When Moses is at Mount Sinai, God reveals to him his 13 attributes. Jewish people repeat these attributes every Yom Kippur, but I haven't found many Christians that know them. And it is the same God we worship. So I think this is an important cultural work. It also aims to put you in Moses' shoes and to make you feel the story through its music, keeping it alive inside of you.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • The premiere will cost a minimum of $25,000. This includes 3,000 for soloists and choral preparation (does not include paying every choral singer or its conductor, which will only happen if we go beyond  this amount) $3,500 for the expenses incurred by Wilshire Blvd. Temple, $12,000 for the 23 instrumentalists in the San Fernando Valley Master Chorale Orchestra, which includes  three rehearsals, $1,000 for a piano rental,  $2,500 for fundraising expenses, $1,000 for programs and props, $2,000 for publicity.
  • There are additional expenses like the writing of the orchestral parts and future expenses of the choir which must be covered, like the rehearsal pianist fee, the rehearsal space, future publicity and future concerts. The campaign aims to raise $20,000. Ticket sales should cover the rest and put the San Fernando Valley Master Chorale with its new artistic director, Charlie Kim, on the road to serving the community with other interesting projects like this one.
  • What you can get, besides tickets for the event, is a signed copy of the program,   to be in a reception with the artists before the performance and some will get a pocket copy of the score and  priority seating for the premiere.

The Impact

The potential impact of the work is large because it can be a tool for the Jewish Community to keep its history, its traditions and its faith alive while it can bring, in the broader community, when performed in different venues, a greater understanding of the Jewish people and  of Christianty's Old Testament. The emphasis of this work in life affirming values will serve well anybody watching it and will be a positive influence in our culture.

 

Risks and Challenges

The challenge we face with this production is that it is written in a classical music idiom and there might be some difficulty in filling the hall because some people are not familiar with this type of work.   That's why we are asking some people to give more than others. There is also the factor that in order to give access to the premiere to as many people as possible in Los Angeles  we have  kept ticket prices low. $18 a ticket is barely more than what it takes to go to a movie these days, but it will not cover all expenses, 

Other Ways to Help

If you want to help in other ways you can definitely help making this premiere a success by spreading the word in social media and using the Indigogo share tools to bring people to this campaign and to Wilshire Blvd. Temple on April 2nd into what promises to be a memorable experience. If you just want to get tickets, go to mosesanoratorio.brownpapertickets.com. This link will take you out of this page but you will be able to get your tickets there, 



Moses, an Oratorio is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a nonprofit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Moses, an Oratorio will be made payable to Fractured Atlas and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

story:
Short Summary

  • Mustapio's Magical Murder Music is Darrell McBride (Friendly Fire), Phillip Mathon, Dominic Berube (Ploz), and Nathaniel Preston (Hemi Loco).With over 10 years of professional experience M.M.M.M are starting to receive the fruits of their labor, working with 3 giants of the music industry on the debut album titled "Mugwump" produced by Jordon Zadorozny (Sam Roberts, Kill Cheerleader, Chris Cornel) and Francois Lalonde (Lhasa De Sela, Dobacaracol,Tomas Jensen) and 2 tracks have been mixed and mastered by Nick Blagona (Cat Stevens, Tom Jones, Protest The Hero) 
  • Mustapio's Magical Murder Music have been lucky enough to complete 75% of the album but unfortunately we need two more days in the studio to complete Guitars, Vocals and mix. 
  • With your contribution or advanced  sale we will be able to complete and launch our album! Along with the help of Musique Nomad and all of the press we have met in the last 2 years of shows, art exhibits and festivals it is sure to reach the biggest audience any of us have ever reached. This debut album is a document of the contemporary cultures of our Lake Timiskaming! 


What We Need      

We need studio fees for two days 2 x $500 = $1000

  • We also need art work and photography by Christian Leduc also a Temiskaming District artist!  $300
  • $1300 total for the completion of this album


What You Get

 
Contribution of $1300 (The Filmmaker's package)
Production assistant package
  •  a private Mustapio show for you and your friends (within 400km)  and we will also wash your dishes, take out your kitty litter and clean your toilets
  • your name in the credits of the album 
  • MMMM limited Door poster, Stickers, Digital and hard copy of Mugwump

Director's package
  • You will have music rights for all songs on the album for any of your productions. Rights are not exclusive but royalty free for use in your productions.
  • or/ Scoring for your next three projects
  • MMMM limited Door poster, Stickers, Digital and hard copy of Mugwump

Contribution of $500 (the voyeur package) 
  • A Mysterious piece of Murder evidence (one of our instruments value of at least $250)
  • Private video tour of The TImiskaming District power spots that the band use for create music. 
  • Private video tour into the lives of each member
  • Private studio archive of us working in the studio
  • your name in the credits of the album
  • First T-shirt print 
  •  MMMM limited Door poster, Stickers, Digital and hard copy of Mugwump


Contribution of $100 (The Philanthropist package)

  • Crime scene evidence (a mystery gift package consisting of stuff exclusively from the Timiskaming District)
  • Private studio archive of us working in the studio
  • your name in the credits of the album
  • First T-shirt print 
  •  MMMM limited Door poster, Stickers, Digital and hard copy of Mugwump


Contribution of $20 (The Art Appreciation Package) 
  • Stickers, Digital and hard copy of Mugwump

Pre Sale of Mugwump $10 
  • Digital copy of Mugwump at 12 midnight of the night its mixed Aug 4th

The Impact

Friendly Fire was a band that came from nowhere and blasted an echo that went all across the world. Much media and Fans from all over the world have been waiting for a follow up to The Savage Raids of Friendly Fire.

Ploz was on a Quebec record label and number one on the National Experimental category of Reverberation  but unfortunately disbanded and a follow up record was not made.

Hemi-Loco was a bright star on The Hull/Gatineau bar scene securing a stage at the prestigious Rockfest Musical Festival in Montebello Canada.

All members of M.M.M.M accumulated lots of contacts and many professionals in the industry are waiting to help once "Mugwump " is launched. We have been very passionate in the creation of these songs and the album sounds amazing thus far! We are not asking for a hand out but a hand up to take a shot at the big show and jump into the National Market with producers who have had International success.

With your help the future can be around the corner for a bunch of guys who gave their lives too music!  

Risks & Challenges

MMMM are all men with family's and all of our budgets are stretched so thin that we could not afford to invest anymore money into this project. Alone Phil and Darrell have contributed almost $3000 into the project with earlier studio fees and Nick Blagonas fee for Mixing and Mastering "Kill The Mosquitoes" and "Big Brother"

Without this campaign we are slightly concerned that the record will not come out. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to contribute than please share our indiegogo project and our cdbaby single link http://www.cdbaby.com/cd/mustapiosmagicalmurdermu
story_txt:
Short Summary 
Mustapio's Magical Murder Music is Darrell McBride (Friendly Fire), Phillip Mathon, Dominic Berube (Ploz), and Nathaniel Preston (Hemi Loco).With over 10 years of professional experience M.M.M.M are starting to receive the fruits of their labor, working with 3 giants of the music industry on the debut album titled "Mugwump" produced by Jordon Zadorozny (Sam Roberts, Kill Cheerleader, Chris Cornel) and Francois Lalonde (Lhasa De Sela, Dobacaracol,Tomas Jensen) and 2 tracks have been mixed and mastered by Nick Blagona (Cat Stevens, Tom Jones, Protest The Hero) 
Mustapio's Magical Murder Music have been lucky enough to complete 75% of the album but unfortunately we need two more days in the studio to complete Guitars, Vocals and mix. 

 With your contribution or advanced  sale we will be able to complete and launch our album! Along with the help of Musique Nomad and all of the press we have met in the last 2 years of shows, art exhibits and festivals it is sure to reach the biggest audience any of us have ever reached. This debut album is a document of the contemporary cultures of our Lake Timiskaming!      What We Need      

We need studio fees for two days 2 x $500 = $1000

We also need art work and photography by Christian Leduc also a Temiskaming District artist!  $300
$1300 total for the completion of this album 


What You Get
 
Contribution of $1300 (The Filmmaker's package)
Production assistant package


 a private Mustapio show for you and your friends (within 400km)  and we will also wash your dishes, take out your kitty litter and clean your toilets
your name in the credits of the album 
MMMM limited Door poster, Stickers, Digital and hard copy of Mugwump


Director's package

You will have music rights for all songs on the album for any of your productions. Rights are not exclusive but royalty free for use in your productions.

or/ Scoring for your next three projects




MMMM limited Door poster, Stickers, Digital and hard copy of Mugwump

Contribution of $500 (the voyeur package) 

A Mysterious piece of Murder evidence (one of our instruments value of at least $250)
Private video tour of The TImiskaming District power spots that the band use for create music. 

Private video tour into the lives of each member

Private studio archive of us working in the studio
your name in the credits of the album
First T-shirt print 

 MMMM limited Door poster, Stickers, Digital and hard copy of Mugwump




Contribution of $100 (The Philanthropist package)




Crime scene evidence (a mystery gift package consisting of stuff exclusively from the Timiskaming District)
Private studio archive of us working in the studio
your name in the credits of the album
First T-shirt print 
 MMMM limited Door poster, Stickers, Digital and hard copy of Mugwump



Contribution of $20 (The Art Appreciation Package) 

Stickers, Digital and hard copy of Mugwump

Pre Sale of Mugwump $10 

Digital copy of Mugwump at 12 midnight of the night its mixed Aug 4th


The Impact


 Friendly Fire was a band that came from nowhere and blasted an echo that went all across the world. Much media and Fans from all over the world have been waiting for a follow up to The Savage Raids of Friendly Fire.
Ploz was on a Quebec record label and number one on the National Experimental category of Reverberation  but unfortunately disbanded and a follow up record was not made.
Hemi-Loco was a bright star on The Hull/Gatineau bar scene securing a stage at the prestigious Rockfest Musical Festival in Montebello Canada.
All members of M.M.M.M accumulated lots of contacts and many professionals in the industry are waiting to help once "Mugwump " is launched. We have been very passionate in the creation of these songs and the album sounds amazing thus far! We are not asking for a hand out but a hand up to take a shot at the big show and jump into the National Market with producers who have had International success.
With your help the future can be around the corner for a bunch of guys who gave their lives too music!  
    Risks & Challenges MMMM are all men with family's and all of our budgets are stretched so thin that we could not afford to invest anymore money into this project. Alone Phil and Darrell have contributed almost $3000 into the project with earlier studio fees and Nick Blagonas fee for Mixing and Mastering "Kill The Mosquitoes" and "Big Brother"
Without this campaign we are slightly concerned that the record will not come out. 
    Other Ways You Can Help If you can't afford to contribute than please share our indiegogo project and our cdbaby single link http://www.cdbaby.com/cd/mustapiosmagicalmurdermu

story:
Who We Are

We are a reggae rock band from Marin County in Northern California called Fighting Smokey Joe. Our music is all about the love, great friends and good times! Our sound is a blend of laid back grooves, heavy hooks, catchy pop melodies and rocking guitar solos. We are inspired by artists such as Sublime, Dirty Heads, No Doubt, Jimi Hendrix, The Police, Red Hot Chili Peppers and many others. We are on a mission to spread the love of music through our reggae-rocking sound!

Our Project 

Record our first full-length album! 

We have spent this past year writing and are ready to step into the studio to record our first full-length album!! This record will feature 10 new original songs of some of our best songwriting efforts yet! To help us make this happen, we have lined up an amazing Producer from Southern California named Lewis Richards of 17th Street Records. Lewis has worked with famous reggae rock artists including the Dirty Heads, Slightly Stoopid and members of Sublime. The opportunity to work with Lewis and his team would truly be a dream come true for us!! 

Where the Money Goes

As you can imagine, recording an album can be very expensive for independent artists like ourselves. There are a ton of costs involved. Your contribution will go directly to creating a professionally recorded full-length album from start to finish. Expenses include: 

Funding Needed: $15,000

  • Pre-Production
  • 10 Days of Studio Time Rental
  • Producer 
  • Engineer 
  • Mixing and Mastering 
  • Session Players
  • Album Artwork Design
  • Pressing Physical Copies of the CD 
  • Distribution through CD Baby
  • FSJ Merchandise for Perk Fulfillment
  • Travel from San Francisco to Los Angeles
  • Indiegogo Fees (4% for Goal Met or 9% for Not Met)

How You Can Help

Donate an amount and Choose a perk!

Your donation will allow us to create our first full-length album and continue to share our music with the world! You will be supporting the arts and the independent musician! Every penny from your contribution will go directly to recording and production expenses as outlined above. We are reaching out to our fans, family, friends and community to help us reach our goal. 

Perks

Fun stuff for you!

In exchange for your contribution, we have some fun perks to offer including copies of the new album, FSJ T-shirts, private house parties for you and your friends, and guitar lessons. You can even come hang with us in the studio and be part of the recording process! Check out the side bar for all our perks (located on the right hand side of this page). *Perks will be mailed out upon completion of the album (Target Release date: September 2015). 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share with friends!

  • Help us spread the word and share this campaign with your friends on       Social Media.
  • Help us grow our fan base and Like us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/fightingsmokeyjoe
  • Check out our website at www.fightingsmokeyjoe.com

Thank You!!!

Thank you so very much for taking the time to check out our campaign. We are so incredibly grateful for your support.   

All our love and gratitude, 

Fighting Smokey Joe

story:
Qui sommes-nous et que ferons-nous?

L'Ensemble Vocal Via Voce de Chambly, fondé en 2008, regroupe présentement près de 50 chanteurs et chanteuses de tous les horizons.  Unis dans notre plaisir de chanter ensemble et ayant atteint une certaine maturité vocale, après avoir participé au Mondial des Chorales de Laval en 2013, nous avons eu envie d'aller "exporter" ce plaisir au-delà des frontières de la Seigneurie et, pourquoi pas, chez nos cousins de France ! D'autant plus que notre chef de chœur est Française d'origine, une belle occasion donc d'aller présenter chez elle son travail et sa technique si particulière.


La tournée !

Nous débuterons notre série de concerts le 26 juin en partageant la scène à Saint-Chamond avec les Cantouramiauds, suivi d'un 2e concert le 27 juin, à Taluyers,  Par la suite, l'occasion faisant le larron, nous participerons à la 20e édition du festival international choral de Provence.  Ainsi, nous chanterons le 3 juillet à Marseille et le 4 juillet à Le Muy, au nord-est de Saint-Raphaël.  Notre répertoire sera constitué de pièces traditionnelles réarrangées et de compositions de grands auteurs canadiens et québécois tels que Léonard Cohen, Gilles Vigneault et Félix Leclerc. Nous serons le seul ensemble vocal canadien cette année et seulement le 2e chœur québécois à y participer en 20 ans. C'est donc une occasion unique pour vous de nous soutenir dans notre œuvre de diffusion de la culture canadienne et québécoise outre-Atlantique!


Une approche gagnante pour vous et pour nous !

Notre objectif de financement est de 2 000$. Cette somme servira à débourser les billets d'avion de Cécile, notre chef de chœur et de Valérie, notre pianiste. En effet, bien que chaque choriste finance soi-même sa tournée et que Cécile et Valérie aient accepté d'y participer gracieusement, nous avons décidé, d'un commun accord, de financer cette partie de leurs frais de voyage, en reconnaissance de leur dévouement l'année durant.

Cécile en action !

Votre contribution est donc très importante pour nous car, sans chef de chœur et sans pianiste, point de salut ! Mais le plus intéressant, c'est que votre contribution ne vous laissera pas les mains vides ! Toujours dans notre philosophie de partager notre plaisir de chanter pour vous, nous avons imaginé plusieurs niveaux de récompenses:

  • Tous les contributeurs recevront un mot de remerciement personnalisé, signé de tous les choristes participants !
  • Pour une contribution de 20$, nous glisserons votre nom dans le programme lors de notre prochain concert (prévu le 6 juin 2015) !
  • Pour une contribution de 50$, nous vous ferons parvenir un CD du concert du 6 juin prochain, comme si vous y étiez !
  • Pour une contribution de 100$, nous vous inviterons gratuitement à notre concert du 6 juin prochain, dans la rangée des VIP !
  • Pour une contribution de 150$ et plus, invitez un(e) ami(e) avec vous à notre concert du 6 juin prochain !


Vous n'êtes pas seuls !

Nous avons organisé d'autres activités de financement pour réduire les frais inhérents à l'organisation d'un tel événement. D'autres personnes comme vous ont cru en notre projet et nous soutiennent déjà mais, pour cet effort particulier, qui cible deux piliers essentiels de notre ensemble vocal, nous avons eu envie de faire appel à votre générosité. Joignez vous à tous ceux qui ont décidé de nous envoyer chanter le Québec outre-Atlantique !

De tout cœur, merci à vous! Et faites circuler la bonne nouvelle !

story:
The Palmdale High School Chamber Singers

   For the past 17 years, under the direction of Mr. Mike McCullough, the Palmdale High School Chamber Singers have earned a reputation for excellence throughout the state, the nation and even internationally. This year the Chamber Singers have earned the right to compete in the International Eisteddfod in Llangollen, Wales in July 2012.  This invitation comes to the group after their 3rd place finish in the same competition in the summer of 2004, their Gold Cup ranking in the Verona International Choral Competition in April 2006, as well as their 2nd Place finish in the Choir of the World Championship in 2008.

  The opportunity to compete and share music in the home of choral music is beyond description. As the 2012 PHS Chamber Singers, we are incredibly honored to be invited to the 2012 International Eisteddfod! Knowing that we will have the opportunity to be among some of the greatest choral groups of the world and having a chance to share and celebrate music with others is an excitement we cannot contain! This trip is not only our opportunity to travel beyond the Antelope Valley towards a world of new foods, languages, and cultures but also our chance to represent our own nation, the United States of America, and our community as we compete on an international scale. We are scheduled to perform not only in the Eisteddfod, but also in Holy Trinity, which is Shakespeare’s church in Stratford Upon Avon, and in the 1,000 year old Chester Cathedral.

   Just as we prepare musically everyday, we have also been preparing finically for our trip. In order to take on this journey each student must raise $3,000 towards travel, room and board and competition fees. With 28 students, this means we are set on raising $84,000! Together, we have raised a significant amount of money towards this goal by performing paid gigs, organizing on campus fundraisers, writing sponsorship letters to local businesses, and even taking on part-time jobs. But we still need YOUR help!

  Now, if the world operated on heart, soul and enthusiasm alone, we would be set, cups running over, with funds to spare! But, of course, getting to Wales and participating in this competition will take some monetary support from you: Our friends, families, community and sponsors. And here is how you can help:

Every Dollar Counts!

   Even if you can only spare a dollar, your sponsorship will be going towards making our dreams a reality! By donating to our campaign you are not only helping us get to Europe, but also earing some pretty cool SWAG for yourselves. Sponsors will be receiving gifts from us including:

  • Personalized thank you notes for the one and only 2012 PHS Chamber Singers! 
  • A group photo of the Chamber Singers, perfect for spicing up any living room wall!
  • A CD full of our music for your listening pleasure!
  • A postcard sent from Europe so you can keep up with our crazy adventures!
  • A photo album so you can remember all of the magical moments we have on this trip! (It will be like you were there with us!)
  • A DVD of our performance in Wales, so you can cheer us on from your very own living room (the one with our group photo in it, of course.)
  • A FREE PEFROMACE by the internationally known PHS CHMABER SINGERS

Honestly, we wish we could get half of these things! :)

Become a Supporter of the Arts

  As you may know, the demographic make up of our student population all but eliminates the possibility of the majority of the chamber singer’s families to be able to provide the necessary funding required to experience such an incredible life-changing experience such as this. Even with our work so far we could still use your sponsorship to make this trip possible for all 28 of us. This is a trip we want to make together, as a family. We are not only representing Palmdale High School and our community, but our country as well. 

  As a sponsor of the PHS Chamber Singers you are not only helping us as a group but also as individuals; students who love music, yearn to share it with the world and hope to grow in our art. 

Beyond the $$$

  Even if you are unable to support our campaign finically you can also become a sponsor by spreading the word. Your support, love and encouragement is one of the greatest gifts we can ask for! 

Sincerely,

The Palmdale High School 2012 Chamber Singers

story:
Our band is strongly bound together by friendship, community, and a common goal of bringing our music to a larger audience.  Caldecott has progressed over the past four years into a band with serious passion, well-crafted songs, an avid local fan base, and a substantial potential for long-term success.  Achieving our goals and dreams in music is challenging and competitive, but we will thrive with your help.  This fundraiser in particular is a means to ask for financial support from the fans, friends, and family who have helped us tremendously in our success so far to finish the mixing and mastering of our first-ever full length album. To listen to some of our music visit www.caldecott.bandcamp.com.  

What we've accomplished in the studio so far:

Fourteen tracks for the upcoming album have been recorded at Shipwreck Studio (www.shipwreckoakland.com) with engineer Jonah Strauss.  Jonah offers equipment and a level of recording knowledge and professionalism on par with any seasoned engineer.  So far we have spent over 90 hours in the studio working hard and efficient to track a full album featuring an array of instrumentation. 

The help we need from here:

Based on our projections, mixing the album will take at least another 6.5 days in the studio, with some extra time for mastering.   

Our goals, and how your donation will help:

            Our ultimate goal is to get signed to a record label, tour, and gain the necessary professional support to bring our music to a larger audience and bigger stages.  Our approach is to be best prepared when these opportunities arrive, and having a complete quality album when we talk with industry professionals will help us immensely.

story:
Music is the universal language

 

It is my vision to open a place of worship in the inner city based in music and the arts where all are welcome. Rather than just those that are saved, I want to go to the highways and byways and invite EVERYONE to come in. I believe that music, genuine fellowship and parable based teaching are the keys to making this a reality.

 

 

I have found the perfect building in a depressed neighborhood in Chicago. It is a commercial mixed-use property with a storefront venue and a residential living space. I will have to pay to live somewhere, and it is my plan to pay the bills of this building as my living space and provide the church space for community use without requiring outside support. I have applied for and received tax exempt status from the state of Illinois.

 

The building is a foreclosure owned by a bank and for sale for $77,000. The building is in exceptional shape and is likely worth much more than this asking price. I have a down payment of $25,000 and a regular income of nearly $2,000 a month from which I can make payments.

 

**** UPDATE: i met with commercial loan people at my bank today and applied for and obtained a tax payer ID (EIN). i am now officially a business and so can apply for a business mortgage. tomorrow we meet again and i will apply for the mortgage...the person working with me thinks she can make it happen.  praise the lord! ****

 

***UPDATE: the above  mortgage was turned down without consideration because it was too small for thier minimum.***

 

***UPDATE: god's great provision has contributed without obligation. this will allow a low ball offer on the property. i have spoken with the realtor and our bid for $55,000 goes in on president's day. thank you lord***

 

***UPDATE: i found another bank with no minimum amount that is willing to consider a small mortgage. this, coupled with god's providence will likely make this vision a reality.! thank you lord!***

 

***UPDATE: THE BANK ACCEPTED MY OFFER. THIS IS HAPPENING!!

PRAISE THE LORD AND THANK YOU TO ALL OF YOU GUARDIAN ANGELS!!

  

Thank you
story_txt:
Music is the universal language It is my vision to open a place of worship in the inner city based in music and the arts where all are welcome. Rather than just those that are saved, I want to go to the highways and byways and invite EVERYONE to come in. I believe that music, genuine fellowship and parable based teaching are the keys to making this a reality.
  I have found the perfect building in a depressed neighborhood in Chicago. It is a commercial mixed-use property with a storefront venue and a residential living space. I will have to pay to live somewhere, and it is my plan to pay the bills of this building as my living space and provide the church space for community use without requiring outside support. story:
Hi There! 

We’re Son Ark and we’ve been in the studio recording our 1st full-length album. Son Ark is a folk rock band formed in Los Angeles lead by Robin Harris. Last year we put out our first EP, Much Obliged. We launched SonArk.com. We did our first tour of the west coast and made our first music video. None of these milestones were possible without a little help from our friends and with your help we can release our 1st album, The Land of Smoke. 

Hear the single from The Land of Smoke:

Clementine - Son Ark

Press for Son Ark Makes a Record: 

RADIO FREE SILVERLAKE on Feb. 27th

Daily Titan CSUF on Feb. 20th

From the Hip LA on Feb. 5th  

RestlessCities.com on Feb. 1st

Here’s what we need your help funding:

  • Recording
  • Mixing & Mastering
  • Pressing the album on vinyl and C.D.
  • Spreading the word and promoting it. 

 

Here’s what you’ll get for helping us:

  • Our gratitude.
  • 2 live acoustic demos that are only available here
  • The album on vinyl, C.D. and digital download
  • Limited edition Poster
  • Shirts, drink koozies, and totes bags
  • Special Thanks in the liner notes
  • Private performances for you and your friends.

 

We appreciate every donation no matter how small. If you can’t donate but you still want to help, spread the word about our music and fund to your friends.

 

Thank You!

Robin, Sherman, Adrian, Matt, Chris, Patrick. 

 

p.s. Please excuse our neighbors. They were rehearsing while we were trying to take a nap. We left them a note.

story:
Follow along as Sharon and Winter pit their wits against the rigors of the road! Become a sponsor a la Hunger Games in this engaging behind-the-scenes video log.

Who We Are

Hi there! We are Sharon Knight and Winter, nationally touring musicians in the Mythic-Celtic vein. We've been full-time musicians for about 6 years now, performing  as a duet or trio under the name Sharon Knight or Sharon Knight Trio, and are also the founding members of 6-piece rock band Pandemonaeon. We strive to bring community together here in the Bay Area by creating events that celebrate music, dance, the arts, myth, and imaginative costumery. If you are not yet familiar with us and you'd like to check out our music, you can do so at www.sharonknight.net and www.pandemonaeon.net. 

What We Are Doing

We are thrilled to have been invited to perform at the New Orleans Witch's Ball on October 27th. New Orleans is a fantastic music town, and one that we'd like to get known in. So of course we said yes. We've set up a few more shows while we're in town, and are planning to tour our way across the country. 

The catch is - we don't yet have a following in the South. 

So we've decided to document our travels and see if we can generate some tour support by creating our own "Hunger Games" style reality show of life on the road.

We are going to make it as fun and engaging as we possibly can!

We will post daily reports on our blog, with video updates 2-3 times a week. In these videos and blog reports, we will endeavor to share the challenges, joys, and magic of life as a touring musician. We chose Hunger Games as our theme, somewhat tongue-in-cheek, because it seemed fitting. 14 hour drives, gas station food, leaky air mattresses - trying to stay alive as an independent musician really does feel like an epic battle at times! Might as well have fun with it!

As in the Hunger Games story, you can support our tour in the form of sponsorships, thus giving us an edge in the game. We intend for this to be a playful fun time for us all, as well as a way to keep us touring. And since the fundraiser will be going on while we are on tour, there is no concern that the project won't happen - it already is happening! 

Why We Need Your Help

In better times, we have floated our outreach to new areas with credit cards, and have always been able to pay them off pretty quickly. However, our summer 2012 tour, while successful in terms of reaching new folks and playing some prestigious festivals, didn’t meet our financial expectations. So we are looking to new business models that will allow us to continue creating and performing our music.  And we need your help to make it happen.

Here’s a quick behind-the-scenes look at the budget for our upcoming month-long tour:

EXPENSES:
 

GAS   $1200    My, has this cost gone up since we started touring! We'll be logging about 6300 miles round trip this time out. Our little Yaris gets about 38 miles to the gallon. But still.

FOOD $1800   $60 per day for 30 days, to cover both of us. We try to be frugal, but we don’t do fast food.

HOTELS - $600  6 nights at $100 each. The rest of our lodging is either covered by the venue, provided by friends, or secured for free via www.couchsurfing.org.  (Which is awesome, if you like to travel you really need to check it out). 

THE UNEXPECTED - $500 It happens. You get a flat. You need to change your oil. You need to pay ridiculous tolls, like on the Ohio turnpike. We find it wise just to have an emergency fund.

CAMPAIGN-RELATED EXPENSES - $750 Indiegogo fees, shipping the posters, internet access, etc.

EQUIPMENT - $500  We got ourselves a little GoPRo Hero to film our adventures on the road, which will not only serve us for this campaign but for filming future performances and creating music videos. We also have other equipment expenses, like power cables, batteries, etc.

MUSICIAN SALARIES - $2500  This is what Winter and I pay ourselves for this work for the month. We use this money to do crazy stuff like pay our rent at home and cover our general living expenses.

TOTAL EXPENSE: $7850

INCOME

PERFORMANCE FEES & CD SALES - $4000  
Show guarantees - $3000
Estimated Cd sales $1000

THIS INDIGOGO CAMPAIGN - $4000

So what if we come in over $4000?

$4000 keeps us in the black as we fulfill the year's final obligations. Anything beyond $4000 will go into a much needed equipment upgrade. New amps made in this century. A printer that prints. That sort of thing. Beyond that? My goodness - we could even pay to have some guest artists on our next recording! 

 

How You Can Join The Tour!

Start following along on our blog at www.sharonknight.net/blog/ and make a donation if you can. It's going to be fun - like a big, month long slumber party! We hope the game will be fun enough in itself to warrant your support - however, in true Indiegogo fashion, we are also offering some fun perks. Most of them are pretty self-explanatory, but I did want to show you a pic of the 11x17 Star of the Sea poster you'll be getting at the $75-$100 level. This is it.  Except bigger. And signed. :+)

We Love You!!

As is the case with most independent art projects, your support will make the difference between whether this tour is a success or not. And success means we can keep doing it! You are quite literally keeping us on the road by playing this game with us. As such, you are very much a part of our creative process, and we love you for it!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can you help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign? Not only does this help our immediate cause, but it exposes more folks to our music!

You can use the nifty indiegogo "share" tools, above!

You can also follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and the like. Here are the links:

Sharon's blog - where the videolog will be - http://www.sharonknight.net/blog/

Sharon Knight on Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/SharonKnightMusic

Pandemonaeon on Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/PandemonaeonMusic

Sharon on Twitter - https://twitter.com/sharonknight777

We are also looking for one or two outstanding music patrons who can help us by hosting a dinner party fundraiser in their home. If you are on our tour route or in the greater Bay Area, we can perform for you and your VIP guests, show tour documentary clips, and talk about what it’s like to be an independent musician. You let your friends know it’s a fundraiser, and that they should bring their checkbooks. We hope to generate 3 to 5  VIP sponsorships in the $250 - $500 range at each house party. Please contact Sharon for details. (NOTE: This is different than the house concert perk level to the right, although they can be combined if you like).

Also you might be interested in our members-only-secret-society-clubhouse for artistic dreamers that we are launching called the Ring of Enchantment. You can be kept in the loop as this develops (Slated to accept membership Jan. 1st) by signing our mailing list, where you will also get free improv mini-songs every month, called "Mermaid Kisses".

Thanks my dears! And may the odds be ever in our favor! (ALL of our favor!)

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 FAQ

What is tour support?
it is - or was - an investment in artists by record labels to help them bridge the gap between the real costs of the being on the road vs. the income from the 6 people that showed up at their first show in New Town, USA. It doesn't happen much anymore, and for indie artists it never happened. 

That’s why campaigns like this one are so important.

If you guys only make $4000 on tour for a whole month, how is that a viable business plan?
This is a very conservative estimate, based on lower-than-usual income from our summer 2012 tour. As we move forward, we will consider raising our performance rates to be more in line with industry standards, and to more accurately reflect rising costs. 

What if you don't make your $4000 goal?
Too bad for us. We'll lick our wounds and take solace in the knowledge that we fulfilled our commitments. And we won't head out on tour again until we have upgraded our strategy. Remember - since we are fundraising AS the event is happening, there is no chance that we won't go through with it. One of the things we prefer about Indiegogo is that, even if you don't reach your goal, you still get what money was raised, and every bit will help.

story:
Kolorful's Story. & what is "Sterling" all about?

Sterling "Kolorful" Kalosky has only been creating music for a couple years now but throughout his entire process has kept confident in achieving his goals. Kolorful "feels like hip hop is losing it's "Kolor" or art"  & is taking it upon himself to return those elements to the artform. He has done various projects under the sparkhop imprint in the last two years as well performed across various venues in the Detroit metropolitan area. With his newest project "Sterling" he attempts to bring fans closer to who he really is so that they may understand just who he is. A more personal but deep reaching album that may have a darker tone than his previous fun filled records. Kolorful has previously recorded the large majority of his music in home studio setups & wants to bring his music to next level sonically with a studio recording, mixing, & mastering process alongside his perfected raps. 

Kolorful has kept himself busy from a Sparkfest '11 performance last year in Pontiac, MI to opening for DEF JAM artist WAX, multiple local shows, & co-starring in the youtube sensation "Songs In Real Life" series by Steve Kardynal Kolorful has been on his grind attempting to bring his message & music to as many fans as possible. With indiegogo he hopes he can truly reach the next level & continue his mission to bring quality music to the fans well involving them as much as possible! 

"Sterling" will be released shortly after the campaign has ended & an exact release date will be released before the campaign ends. 

Updates along the journey via vlogs, blogs, indiegogo updates, twitter, etc. will be popping up constantly along the way!

IMPACT?

"Sterling" is an album that well it touches on a deeper more personal tone is oriented to be full of hope as well. Kolorful hopes to impact the listener to enjoy the music & inspires them to do bigger & better things in their life.  Kolorful looks to spread a message to ignore the hate & keep doing what you believe in.

It will directly impact Koloful who will get to fulfill a dream of being able to bring his fans an album of the highest possible quality well impacting those same fans by truly putting all he has into creating & developing it.

All contributors will be impacted by getting to interact & help out & receive something for the greatly appreciated help.

What We Need & What You Get.

All monies received from campaign will go towards funding the various costs associated with recording & promoting the album "Sterling". Those cost include (1) Studio Time - This is the most expensive cost coming in at around $50 an hour. Kolorful is hard at work preparing his songs to be ready for a smooth & faster studio experience but also doesn't want to rush the project.  (2) Perks!!!  We are going be ordering all the T-shirts/Crewnecks/Posters etc. just for our indiegogo supporters!  Any funds raised after studio time will go towards the costs of clothing perks & the physical copies of the album. (3). Digital distribution & promotion. We expect ideally studio time including mixing/mastering + cost of all the perks to bring us right around the $4,000 mark. If any month above & beyond that is raised we will still be using it towards digital distribution costs & promotions such as hip hop blog ad's, press releases, magazine, or if achievable radio. All of these things would help Kolorful spread his music to as  many people as possible for his message to be heard! #TEAMKOLOR! 


Perk Prizes: Album artwork will be released soon! Updates will be coming throughout the journey  of "Sterling" from ideas to release.  Audio samples, vlogs, & more will be updated here as the album process is ongoing and finished.



























Other Ways You Can Help.

There are a million other ways you can help Kolorful achieve his goal in bringing you his brand new album. 

 

You can pick up his current releases (home recordings) pictured below here: javascript:nicTemp();


Also check Kolorful out on the sites listed below such as Facebook, Twitter, & Sparkhop & share his music as much as you would like. Every share helps!


Let's all spread the word & show people what #TEAMKOLOR is capable of!

Also check Kolorful out on the sites listed below such as Facebook, Twitter, & Sparkhop & share his music as much as you would like. Every share helps!

Let's all spread the word & show people what #TEAMKOLOR is capable of!

story:
We are Victoria, Madison, and Cameron, identical twins and our little sister.  Madison and I are 12 years old, we act, sing, and play both the piano and guitar.  Cameron is 7 and acts and sings.  We competed in the Undiscovered Talent event in Omaha, Nebraska, and were selected out of an initial field of over 400 candidates to attend the International Presentation of Performers (IPOP)in Los Angeles.  Only a very small percentage of performers across the United States are invited to IPOP, and here are three in one family.  Singing and acting professionally are any kids dream, and this is the chance to attain ours.

  We are trying to raise funds to get from Omaha to Los Angeles (and back, never forget your roots), room and board, and expenses for a week of meeting with talent agents, scouts, and industry professionals.  Naturally with three of us going, it's not going to be cheap. 

  We are reaching out to our extended family, friends, our church, neighbors, and YOU in an effort to defray the costs of our adventure.

story:
What is this all about?

Above: Me on stage at Montreal Drum Fest 2013

Hi, I'm Sean Lang. I am a freelance drummer, educator, and composer.
I've been lucky enough to enjoy a small amount of online success thanks to instructional videos that I have been a part of through Drumeo and Freedrumlessons.com.
(Here is the video that started it all)

I also had the honor last year of representing Western Canada for the Canadian Roland V-drums Contest at the 2013 Montreal Drum Fest.
I am seriously passionate about drums. Even more so, about music. I have been writing music ever since I learned how to sequence MIDI on a computer. Over the past few years, I have written literally hundreds of songs without any real plan to do anything with them.
For fun, I played along to a few of these songs on some of my video lessons....and then requests like "When is this coming out?" started pouring in. My stock answer was always "Its not. Its just music I wrote for fun." But after years of the same conversation, I finally got the hint, and have recorded MOST of what I need to release my music on two EP's.
It has taken two years to get to this point, and its clear that this project will need a little boost to get it released while we're all still alive.

Who else is involved?

above: Dean Lamb, of Canadian technical death metal band Archspire

I'm lucky enough to be surrounded by talented and inspiring musicians that have enabled me to explore new avenues and grow as a player. My good friend (since childhood!) Dean Lamb from the craziest technical death metal band you will ever hearARCHSPIRE is handling all of the crazy lead guitars for me. My good friend Jason Campbell (Obsidian, ex-Mortification) engineered the majority of the recording for me, and my friend Brent Mackenzie (ex-Gross Misconduct) played all of the crazy bass patterns.

What I Need & What You Get

I'm hoping to raise at least $5000 to pay for the following:

  • Mastering 
  • Artwork
  • Promotional playthrough videos
  • Printing of CD's (but only if the full amount is reached)
  • If my goal is not met, I will be paying for each item on this list in order. If I make it to CD's, awesome! If not, I'll hopefully still have some music to send your way!
  • Perks include: digital copy of one EP, both EPs, your name in the thank you's, memberships to Drumeo, a signed copy of my dvd set Bass Drum Secrets 2.0, Skype Lessons, Personal lessons, and drum sessions for your album!


You can make this happen

I don't believe in asking for handouts. As a professional musician, I know that the only true thing that gets you where you need to be is HARD WORK. But...this is not a handout. I wouldn't be doing this campaign if I wasn't being asked many times each week by people all over the globe exactly for what I'm trying to accomplish. This campaign is a way for you to be a part of the music I write. You can have a hand in making this music. The best part is that any amount helps. And every penny takes this project one step closer to being a reality.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to get involved, but you aren't able to claim a perk, no worries! Any form of support is greatly appreciated! Share it around, tell your friends, however you feel like contributing!

BONUS

For every $1000 raised, I will post a new clip of my work in progress.


****UPDATE!!! NEW MASSIVE PERK!!****

story:
Hi, my name is David Parke, father, film technician, recreation student and outdoor enthusiast. I also volunteer for Vancouver Coastal Health and Interfit adaptive hiking for the disabled. As the result of a tragic mountain bike accident in June 2010, I am an incomplete quadriplegic.

Years of rehabilitation helped me realize the need to support organizations like Spinal Cord Injury BC. The need for support and improve the lives of people with spinal cord injuries continues to grow. 

Through Indiegogo, and the last campaign, "Ride for Spine", we were able to raise $2700 thanks to you. We are closer to the $13,000 goal. 

Funds raised on Indiegogo will enable my bicycle fundraiser from Whitehorse, Yukon to Vancouver, B.C. this June 2014. The goal for fundraising for Spinal Cord injury BC on the bike ride is to raise $50,000. 

If we don't achieve the funds to facilitate the bicycle ride, all funds will go to Spinal Cord Injury BC. It's a win-win situation. All contributions are helpful,  by sharing this link with friends and family if money isn't an option.

Help me to help others build accessible communities and achieve their goals. 

Let's share this experience and make a difference. 


The difference is you. 

Thank-you for your support.

story:
We are a Pop/Country band from California. The five of us have been together for about a year and have released one full-length self-titled album that you can check out at: Leaving Austin Music!

We have created this Indiegogo with the goal of $10,000 to fund a reliable source of transportation. This transportation will be used to travel outside of the Central Valley and California. We have opportunities arising in Los Angeles and in Nashville that we can't pursue unless we have a way to transport ourselves and our equipment. Anything over the $10,000 goal will be used towards new recordings of songs we have been writing, new merchandise, possible music videos, and helping us survive on the road.

Here's a little more background about us:

Leaving Austin is the new generation of country music. Don't let their tattoos, piercings, and skinny jeans fool you. These 5 young guys have the cutting edge to where country music is headed. The band was formed in November of 2012. Leaving Austin consists of members: Austin Machado on lead vocals, Davis Forney on guitar and harmonies, Michael Stevens on bass, Terry Ashford on Lead Guitar and Keys, and Ryan Chin on drums. Born and raised in the central valley of California, growing up on country, pop, and rock n' roll, they decided it was time to get back to their roots and sing country their way, "Cali Style".

Living in the small towns of the Central Valley, everyone just seems to know everyone. Michael, Terry, and Davis grew up playing music at church together in Visalia, CA. One night Davis went to a local venue to watch one of his friends' band. When he walked in the room to check out the opening band, he heard Austin sing for the first time. Austin was then introduced to Davis that night through mutual friends and they hit it off immediately. They started writing music and became best friends within days. As they pursued music, Davis brought Michael and Terry onboard. As they played local shows, the guys heard Ryan's flawless drumming in their friends' pop punk band. It was a no-brainer to call him about their new endeavor in pop country. They all decided to get together for a practice session and it was immediately apparent that when Ryan started playing along with them, this was the dream team.

In their first year, Leaving Austin has had the privilege of sharing the stage with some amazing musicians such as Joe Nichols, Randy Houser, Chris Cagle, James Otto, Parmalee, Love and Theft, Kelleigh Bannen and also doing pre-parties for Florida Georgia Line, Carrie Underwood, Hunter Hayes, Kenny Chesney, Eli Young Band, Kasey Musgraves, Jason Aldean, Jake Owen, Thomas Rhett, and George Strait, to name a few. After being an emerging artist at Nashville's CMA festival in the summer of 2013 and being a part of 3 weeks of the television series America's Got Talent season 8, the guys have hit the ground running.

With the help and generosity of KISS Country radio station, their community, family, friends, local bars, venues, and their quickly rising fan base, Leaving Austin is headed towards success and nothing is going to slow them down. Check out Leaving Austin on Facebook!

story:
Short Summary

We, as Turned To Stone, have been incredibly passionate about making music and sharing it with anyone we can. We have gotten to the point of having great support for what we love to do in our local scene, and would love to branch that out to some of the surrounding states.  

What We Need & What You Get

Being a musician is an incredibly expensive hobby to have, especially when you're looking to hit the road and broaden your fan base. With your generous contributions and support, we will be able to utilize those funds to go towards a reliable rental van, trailer, and stocking up our merch items.

In return for helping us out, we have some great perks that we are sure you'll enjoy!
If we do not quite reach our goal of $2,500, any contributions will still go towards the travel expenses and merch. Anything helps!

The Impact

Touring is a dream that we have all wanted to come true for a very long time and we are right at the doorstep! 

We literally cannot do this without fans, and especially without people like YOU. 

If you've taken time to listen to our music and have enjoyed it, this campaign can help others around the country do the same. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you feel that you can’t contribute, that doesn't mean you can’t help:

  • Ask friends, family, coworkers, etc to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Please keep enjoying our music, sharing our music, and believing in us.

story:
Short Summary

 Hey guys, we're Without A Doubt. We're an Alternative-Rock band out of Amherst, MA. We all love making music together, and this EP is our way to get the music we make out to whoever wants to listen to it. We formed in March of 2014, and we've been writing our own music since then. Breaking the Ice is our selection of six of our favorite songs we've written, the songs we'd like to share the most. Sadly, however, we don't have the money to fund the costs of the recording, mastering, and distributing of the release. That's why we need your help.
Track Listing
  1. What Are We Waiting For?
  2. Breaking Her
  3. Mirror Mirror
  4. The Easy Thing
  5. Tumbling
  6. My Own Eyes
 

What We Need and What You Get

 In order to meet all the requirements needed to get the release out to everybody, we need approximately $1750. This money will go towards the costs of recording our music, mixing it, making physical copies, and the distributing of the EP. However, if you do help us out, you have more than just the great feeling of helping somebody out, but you can get rewards as well! Some of our perks include our physical CD, a Skype lesson on one of our songs, and even a personal concert if you're applicable. If we don't reach our complete goal, we'll still try our hardest to release the EP at the best of our ability, but the $1750 is our approximate target in order to make it at the highest quality we can. 
Where We Want To Go 
By contributing to this project you are helping us create our EP. An EP could really help us start our career in music by helping us get our music out there and show it to the world. We will follow through with this project because it been our dream for a long time and creating this EP has been a goal since we started as a band. It would be beyond our wildest dreams to share the music with all of you. This project is valuable to us because all of our emotions and characteristics as a band are in this one EP. We believe that music is one of the easiest ways to cope with struggles you're facing in life. Our lyrics and melodies speak true to some of the issues somebody may face emotionally, physically, and mentally in today's society, it can applying to listeners of any age. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot help by donating money you can contribute by sharing this link on your Facebook page, or emailing the link to your friends. Any way that you could help would mean the world to us, as our goal is to share our music with as many people as we can. Thanks so much for your help!

xx - Without A Doubt (Carolyn, Hunter, Lucien, and Ben)

story:
Short Summary

Further Info on our statistics @ - http://www.xrpradio.co.uk/sponsor-advertise

An app for mobile devices containing functions of our website. Stream, Chat, Vote, News and Links supporting unsigned & independent art to extend and engage our already extensive reach. 

We are XRPRadio, Home of Unsigned & Independent music, art, business and creativity worldwide. The global local radio station, one of the few truly 100% independent radio services, promotions and creative media unit, we play, endorse and promote only Unsigned and Independent music, labels, business, promotions...everything!

We are aiming to further our radio platforms reach via the creation of an app that features all the functions of our website and more. With the demise of the use of internet pages and more focus on apps, plus the falling statistics of FM radio, we feel we need to branch out into the apps market to keep up with the times and ensure our listeners can use the most comfortable platform they can to listen on, whist lessening their expenses on internet data usage by removing page loading times, bandwidth and data with the incorporation of all things XRP in an app, loaded once onto your phone stopping the re-loading of images, background and more.

As a contribute you will be helping us with the above project, furthering our reach tenfold and therefor supporting, promoting, engaging and exposing independent creativity and raising the unsigned and independent platform closer to the level we can really compete with mainstream and corporate controlled media platforms.

What We Need & What You Get

Funding will cover the following expenses:

App Design - The physical look of the app and its user interface

App Creation - The background coding of the app regarding functionality to ensure that it will work on all devices without bugs.

Submission to apps stores - The ability to host and make available the application via the relevant stores so you can download onto your devices.

Features - Some features such as push notifications require a monthly subscription cost your contribution will ensure we have the most functional app we can have.

Also thrown into the mix, the developers we intend to use, have offered to re-skin the whole of our website for free to fit with the apps new features!

Unique Perks:

XRPRadio will be the first 100% unsigned & independent streaming, social community app on the market to our knowledge.

It will be one of the few apps you can LIVE network with promoters, producers and other professionals in the independent movement.

It will allow you to listen, vote and request to name a few things, from anywhere, at anytime.

The eventual aim is to incorporate an XRP store into the platform, so artists can submit their music and within minutes it be available for not only airplay, but also sale on our store with the majority of the profits going to the artists with the only costs taken from XRP to be the overheads of running the project, This store will create the worlds first unsigned downloads chart.

Once created, after the first year, projections imply that the app will be 100% self supported via advert services and sponsors.

Unlike most, the eventual aim is to use 100% unsigned & independent ads support.

The Impact

The current XRP project hits in excess of 50'000 people world wide via our live streams, promotional platforms and social networks and marketing. This is a fact provable by analytics and statistics available in photos on our social networks, via our open and #RealLikes #RealFans #RealStats campaign and upon request.

We work, and thousands of artists will agree with us, artists that have worked with XRPRadio have gone on to play BBC Introducing sets, been picked up by independent AND mainstream labels, sold more merchandise and music and generally noticed an upturn in their reach via analytics.

This app will not only extend that reach dramatically, but make the whole experience not only OURS (due to the heavy current use of third party services), but entirely more user friendly.

Risks & Challenges

There will be 2 main possible set backs to this project:

1: Continued Funding - Once the app is on the app store, it will need updates, bug fixes and to have subscriptions running to keep the app in stores and all its features accessible. We expect many pledgers to renew their sponsorships, however this has been looked at and aside from those we can see being able to deliver this app for the foreseeable future.

2: Technology Updates - Apps my not always be the way to go, and other mobile systems may come to use, we will need to evolve with the trends and keep the app on the most up to date systems. That being said it will be designed for the 2 main markets of the minute and will be for the foreseeable future with enough time to raise funds in the mean time for a future update.

Other Ways You Can Help


The app will be available for free, however, think of this as any other app, what would you be willing to pay for a subscription, or one off fee to download it?

If you wish to help support our project, but can't contribute in a financial manor, you can make as much noise about our campaign as possible.

As an artist you can ask your fans and friends to support you by helping XRP expose your music to a larger audience.

As a fan and listener you can spread the word about the station, get more people listening, and spread the buzz that an XRP App would make it easier for you to listen, As friends to gi'us a quid/dollar whatever.

Below are some recent stats to support some of the marketing perks we're offering, and to show you what you are supporting:

FACEBOOK STATS: Post Reaches in extent of 19K - 100+ Likes a Week, 1300 Engagement a week.
Further Info on our statistics @ -  http://www.xrpradio.co.uk/sponsor-advertise

Listener Stats: Over 21'000 Sessions with 9000 Unique listeners a month listening on average 25.5 Minutes.


Previous Page Statistics from a month previous to back up the earlier facebook insights.



We also go out on twitter, googleplus, TSU, Videscape, Ustream, JTV, and LOADS of other social markets and promotional outlets. The projected marketing reach for XRPRadio is 50K+ Unique identified targets with a daily listenership of 1-3K Unique Identified Listeners

Every one of them guaranteed to be a musician, promoter, manager, music lover, supporter, label or business.

Welcome to the home of the Unsigned & Independent.
