Stream, Chat, Vote, News and Links supporting unsigned & independent art to extend and engage our already extensive reach. We are XRPRadio, Home of Unsigned & Independent music, art, business and creativity worldwide. The global local radio station, one of the few truly 100% independent radio services, promotions and creative media unit, we play, endorse and promote only Unsigned and Independent music, labels, business, promotions...everything!We are aiming to further our radio platforms reach via the creation of an app that features all the functions of our website and more. With the demise of the use of internet pages and more focus on apps, plus the falling statistics of FM radio, we feel we need to branch out into the apps market to keep up with the times and ensure our listeners can use the most comfortable platform they can to listen on, whist lessening their expenses on internet data usage by removing page loading times, bandwidth and data with the incorporation of all things XRP in an app, loaded once onto your phone stopping the re-loading of images, background and more.As a contribute you will be helping us with the above project, furthering our reach tenfold and therefor supporting, promoting, engaging and exposing independent creativity and raising the unsigned and independent platform closer to the level we can really compete with mainstream and corporate controlled media platforms.   What We Need & What You Get
 Funding will cover the following expenses:App Design - The physical look of the app and its user interface
App Creation - The background coding of the app regarding functionality to ensure that it will work on all devices without bugs.Submission to apps stores - The ability to host and make available the application via the relevant stores so you can download onto your devices.Features - Some features such as push notifications require a monthly subscription cost your contribution will ensure we have the most functional app we can have.Also thrown into the mix, the developers we intend to use, have offered to re-skin the whole of our website for free to fit with the apps new features!Unique Perks:XRPRadio will be the first 100% unsigned & independent streaming, social community app on the market to our knowledge.It will be one of the few apps you can LIVE network with promoters, producers and other professionals in the independent movement.It will allow you to listen, vote and request to name a few things, from anywhere, at anytime.The eventual aim is to incorporate an XRP store into the platform, so artists can submit their music and within minutes it be available for not only airplay, but also sale on our store with the majority of the profits going to the artists with the only costs taken from XRP to be the overheads of running the project, This store will create the worlds first unsigned downloads chart.Once created, after the first year, projections imply that the app will be 100% self supported via advert services and sponsors.
Unlike most, the eventual aim is to use 100% unsigned & independent ads support.   The Impact The current XRP project hits in excess of 50'000 people world wide via our live streams, promotional platforms and social networks and marketing. This is a fact provable by analytics and statistics available in photos on our social networks, via our open and #RealLikes #RealFans #RealStats campaign and upon request.We work, and thousands of artists will agree with us, artists that have worked with XRPRadio have gone on to play BBC Introducing sets, been picked up by independent AND mainstream labels, sold more merchandise and music and generally noticed an upturn in their reach via analytics.
This app will not only extend that reach dramatically, but make the whole experience not only OURS (due to the heavy current use of third party services), but entirely more user friendly.
    Risks & Challenges 
There will be 2 main possible set backs to this project:
1: Continued Funding - Once the app is on the app store, it will need updates, bug fixes and to have subscriptions running to keep the app in stores and all its features accessible. We expect many pledgers to renew their sponsorships, however this has been looked at and aside from those we can see being able to deliver this app for the foreseeable future.
2: Technology Updates - Apps my not always be the way to go, and other mobile systems may come to use, we will need to evolve with the trends and keep the app on the most up to date systems. That being said it will be designed for the 2 main markets of the minute and will be for the foreseeable future with enough time to raise funds in the mean time for a future update.
    Other Ways You Can Help


The app will be available for free, however, think of this as any other app, what would you be willing to pay for a subscription, or one off fee to download it?
If you wish to help support our project, but can't contribute in a financial manor, you can make as much noise about our campaign as possible.As an artist you can ask your fans and friends to support you by helping XRP expose your music to a larger audience.As a fan and listener you can spread the word about the station, get more people listening, and spread the buzz that an XRP App would make it easier for you to listen, As friends to gi'us a quid/dollar whatever.Below are some recent stats to support some of the marketing perks we're offering, and to show you what you are supporting:FACEBOOK STATS: Post Reaches in extent of 19K - 100+ Likes a Week, 1300 Engagement a week.Further Info on our statistics @ -  http://www.xrpradio.co.uk/sponsor-advertise

Listener Stats: Over 21'000 Sessions with 9000 Unique listeners a month listening on average 25.5 Minutes.

Previous Page Statistics from a month previous to back up the earlier facebook insights.
We also go out on twitter, googleplus, TSU, Videscape, Ustream, JTV, and LOADS of other social markets and promotional outlets. The projected marketing reach for XRPRadio is 50K+ Unique identified targets with a daily listenership of 1-3K Unique Identified ListenersEvery one of them guaranteed to be a musician, promoter, manager, music lover, supporter, label or business.Welcome to the home of the Unsigned & Independent.

story:
The musical ensemble, Advent Now!, has been assembled this fall 2014 to serve the Church and spread the gospel by performing Christmas music and sing-a-long Christmas carols in Japanese from December 9-24, 2014. The ensemble, a select group from the Lee University's School of Music, consists of a vocal sextet, two violinists, a clarinetist, a saxophonist, a cellist, a pianist, a bassist, and a percussionist. Although many Japanese seem to be fascinated with the trappings of Christmas (Santa, carols, Christmas trees, and so on), less than one percent of Japanese call themselves Christians. Through music, testimonies, and a spoken message, the group will present the good news of Jesus’ birth in Japan this December.

Goal: Raise $2,600 to cover trip expenses by Dec. 1

  • Pay for my entire expenses      $2,600
  • Pay for my roundtrip airfare      $1,320
  • Pay for one day’s average expense    $167
  • Pay for my hotel room for a day    $45
  • Pay for my meals for a day      $35

Risks & Challenges

If someone were to have told me two weeks ago that I would be spending much of November preparing for a trip to the other side of the globe in December, I probably would have laughed.

Advent Now! began rehearsals and fudraising at the beginning of this semester back in August. It was not until October 27th that a missions trip to Japan was anywhere on my radar, but after Dr. Patty, our faculty sponsor, asked me to consider joining the team singing bass and playing saxophone, I felt a calling to accept this offer. This meant learning music in a very short amount of time, raising $2,600 to cover trip expenses, and not being able to work during Christmas break.

With most of my money going toward school expenses, a missions trip to Japan is absolutely not something I could afford and still attend Lee next semester. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Prayers are always appreciated! I am asking God

  1. that if it is His will for the other students and I to go, He will help provide a way for each of us.
  2. that our journey will be fruitful for God's kingdom.
  3. He will open the hearts of those we come in contact with so that they may come to know Him.
  4. for wisdom, guidance, and blessings upon Dr. Patty and Dr. Jensen, our faculty sponsors.
  5. for blessings on those that are willing to help, financially or through prayer.
Thank you for taking the time to read my story! God bless!
-Josiah Sytsma

story:
Short Summary

Home Body is on the cusp of releasing our second full length album, Spiritus, and plan to embark on a national tour in support of the album. We're seeking the support of our fans to help kick start this new chapter! 

Ruminating on darkness, the light, and all the tiny intangible shifts that add up to transformation and change, Spiritus is our most personal and expansive album yet. Three years in the making and totally self-produced, Spiritus captures the energy of our live performances paired with the emotional depth of our 13 year relationship. In the wake of so many cultural, social, environmental and political shifts over the past three years, as well as personal encounters with death, heartache, and magic, we used the recording process to really focus and channel our energy, tangles and all. Through slowing down the recording process we were able to dig deeper than ever before, questioning our assumptions and following our curiosity and delight as far as possible. In that creative spaciousness we've crafted eight dynamic songs lush with character and detail, displaying moments of ecstatic high energy melting into soft expansion, coaxed along by ghostly textured synths, momentum mounting, spirit settling. 

We recorded a bulk of the instruments and backing vocals at home in our 'sparkle room', and worked with a handful of wonderful engineers on tracking lead vocals, mixing, and mastering - James Zaner (Sound Shuttle Studio), Justin Pizzoferrato (Sonelab), Andrew Oedel (Ghost Hit Recoding), and Sarah Register. We're so dang proud of how it turned out! We're honored to be working with two labels - Peace+Rhythm and Feeding Tube Records - to make Spiritus available on vinyl record, CD, cassette, and digitally. It will be available everywhere April 26, 2019. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $8,000. These funds will greatly help sustain and amplify our creative efforts through offsetting production and publicity costs, as well as helping with equipment repair and upgrades before we embark on a rigorous tour in support of the album's release. Though this album's expenses actually exceed $8,000, we hope to supplement it's cost with income from our performances, album pre-sales, and funds from our part-time jobs. 

  • $5,000 (tracking, mixing, and mastering costs)
  • $3,000 (hiring a publicist to maximize press, digital traction, and exposure)
  • $1,500 (equipment repair and upgrading our cables, flight cases, stands, and lighting)
  • $1,000+ (miscellaneous, ie. music videos, new merchandise, in-ear monitors, AAA membership, performance organization and subscription service fees, stage outfits, rent while we're on tour, etc)
  • $400 (indie go go's cut is 5% of whatever we raise)

After careful consideration of all our financial options (ie. loan from bank, credit card, taking on more shifts at our day jobs), we decided to go with a model of fundraising that was most in line with our vision of success. This fan-to-band model of direct social capital isn't just a way for us to buy new supplies, but it can also be an opportunity to deepen our connections with those around us and continue the energetic cycle of exchange. Mutually beneficial, this capital campaign is a way to get more from Home Body, sooner, and more meaningfully. We feel extremely privileged to be artists, and we take our craft seriously.  We truly believe in the power of our music, and in the face of so many shitty things happening in the world, we feel even more compelled to give this next chapter of Home Body all we've got! 

If we don't reach our goal, it'll affect the scope & scale of Spiritus' release - we may not be able to tour as widely, Spiritus might not reach as many ears, and we'll be in a more vulnerable financial position. We're extremely grateful for any contributions we receive, however, and recognize that not everyone who supports us has money to spare! We love you anyway! 

We have many unique perks to offer to contributors, both physical (like advance copies of the new album, signed posters, postcard packs, art prints, and new merchandise) and experiential options (like customized phone greetings, personal performances, guest list privileges, mail from the road, or an afternoon of treasure hunting & thrifting with Haley!). 

The Impact

Over the past 8 years, we have performed close to 400 shows across North America, and have released our debut full length In Real Life (Feeding Tube Records, 2013), a 7" called Traps (Tiny Radars, 2013), an EP Guts (self release, 2014), and an improvisational art project called FORMS (digital self release, 2018). We've also scored fashion shows and dance performances, made music for film & commercial, and have led performance workshops for youth and differently-abled adults. In addition to writing and performing all our own material, we also handle all our own booking, graphic design, merchandising, and even control our own light show. Dedicated to our vision and employing a strong work ethic, we are grateful for the opportunities and lessons Home Body has manifested so far. We feel extremely optimistic about our next chapter, emboldened by the support of our vast network of friends, family, and fans. 

In many ways, "making it" in the music industry feels like a myth, because we are constantly making "It!" We both live and breathe Home Body. We love creating music together and don't expect to stop, ever. Already feeling successful and satiated by this project and the opportunities and connections we've made through it, we are excited by the mystery of what could come next. We're humbled and grateful for the support of our fans over the past eight years and feel honored and privileged to do what we do. 

Now more than ever, we believe in the power of music to bring people together. We've witnessed first hand how playfulness and presence can foster empathy, animate intuition, offer possibility, and spark transformation. In response to this quickly changing and often harsh world we share, we offer Spiritus as an auditory balm.

Thanks for your time and attention and would be honored for your support in this next chapter with Spiritus!

story:
About the "Where We Find Ourselves" Virtual Choir

 

Hello! I’m composer Michael Bussewitz-Quarm. I write choral music that engages singers and audiences with the leading social issues of our time. I’d love for you to join me in a virtual choir for my latest piece, Where We Find Ourselves.

Where We Find Ourselves is inspired by an exhibit and book of the same name, which feature the portraits of Hugh Mangum, a photographer who lived in Durham, North Carolina during the Jim Crow era. He is unique in that he photographed people of diverse racial and economic backgrounds and was incredibly sensitive to the details in the portraits: the clothing, hair, expression, and physicality he captured truly represent humanity’s richness. It is significant that his work reflects racial diversity during a time of violent segregation. As Margaret Sartor, on of the curators and authors of the book, Where We Find Ourselves, observes, his portraits “indicate that an unbiased and open-door policy existed in his studio.”

These portraits are from a set of glass plate negatives that were found years after Mangum’s death in a family barn. Over time, these negatives were damaged and so the photographs developed signs of wear and some distortions—all of which add to the richness of experiencing them as we consider the passage of time and the gaps between what we think we know about a person based on their appearance and who they truly are.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This project begins this fall with a series of video “journeys” that explore the themes in the portraits, the history of this era, and the music and lyrics as they are being written. These journeys will be hosted by me, lyricist Chantal Sellers, photographers, curators, and authors of the book Where We Find Ourselves, Margaret Sartor and Alex Harris, as well as Dr. Sherry Boyd, Humanities Coordinator for Dallas College, and Tina Sayers, Executive Director of Maple Seed Creative Consulting.

All virtual choir members will be invited to join a private Facebook group hosted by me so that you can meet one another, share your thoughts and observations, and build community with your fellow singers. In this way, we begin our artistic journey with introspection and discussion, to deepen our understanding and open our minds and hearts to the topics we will be singing about.

Where We Find Ourselves will be 20-22 minutes long, in five movements, for SATB choir.  The work will be of medium difficulty, with original lyrics written by Chantal Sellers. The music will be released in January, 2021, along with rehearsal tracks for you to use to practice and record your part. I will host recorded virtual “rehearsals” with each section to share my vision for phrasing, shaping, and overall musical ideas. These rehearsals will be recorded for those who will be preparing their part on their own. 

In addition, you may join at the Premium Virtual Choir Member level and receive a one-on-one musical coaching with me. The final video will be edited together in the spring of 2021 and delivered to you and shared online so that the message can spread and grow!

 

The Impact

 

The message of these photographs, that we must look and listen deeper to one another, and that while much time has passed, our country still has so much work to do to overcome racism, is timely and urgent. As we look around at our country and our world, it is easy to get overwhelmed by the many challenges we see. It’s important to know that we can make a difference by educating ourselves and using our talents to inform and inspire others.

 

In addition, many of us who have found a home in choral music are missing our usual outlet for singing during the pandemic. Our weekly rehearsal routine has been disrupted to keep our communities safe. But we still need community, we still need purpose and a way to channel our artistic talents for our own happiness and to serve others. This project will have an immense impact on our lives and on the world as we come together in the journeys this fall and in song in the spring.

 

I truly believe we can change the world through the power of music. Choral music is the perfect medium to raise awareness, engage ourselves and our community in dialogue, inspire compassion, and incite meaningful change. I hope you will open your hearts and raise your voice with me to create this new piece of music.

 

Risks & Challenges

 

I am committed to writing this piece, hosting the video journeys, and creating the virtual choir video. I am an experienced composer and conductor with an extensive background in writing music, running rehearsals, and bringing a performance project to fruition. 

One of the great things about a virtual choir is that it can work with a large, medium, or small group of singers. Because everyone will have access to the rehearsal tracks, I expect a high quality performance no matter the number of singers. I would love to have a large four-part chorus for this project, but the piece will work beautifully with a smaller ensemble if necessary. 

If my financial goal is not reached, all commitments listed in the “perks” will be honored, the video journeys will go live, and the virtual choir video will still be created. In this way, I and my business are absorbing the risk of this project. There is no risk to donors. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

I would love for you to raise your voice and sing with us, but I understand this may not be possible for everyone who supports the mission of this project.

You can help amplify the message of this piece by sharing this project with choral singers who do not have the opportunity to sing this season, or with choirs who are working to program their season.

Use the Indiegogo Share Tools to share this project on social media: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.

Visit my website and subscribe to my newsletter to be the first to know about future projects, and to be notified when the virtual choir video for this project goes live.

 

Hugh Mangum photographs courtesy of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

Use the Indiegogo Share Tools to share this project on social media: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.
Visit my website and subscribe to my newsletter to be the first to know about future projects, and to be notified when the virtual choir video for this project goes live.
 
Hugh Mangum photographs courtesy of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

story:
Johnny Cash built a cabin in Hendersonville, TN in 1978. It was then, as it is now, a place to find solace and make music. The Cash Cabin Studio hosts an astounding history. Not only did Johnny and June Carter Cash record most all of their later music here, but many other talented musicians and famous entertainers have made music within the cabin. It is a dream come true to humbly join the ranks of my heroes who have recorded between these legendary walls.

To have John Jackson (The Jayhawks, Ray Davies) producing this collection of songs is beyond exciting for me. He is an invaluable piece of this puzzle, and I can’t wait to work with him in the studio. I’m also thrilled to have Chuck Turner (Johnny Cash, Loretta Lynn, Alison Krauss) engineering the album.

We have enlisted an all-star band of backing musicians to help realize my vision, including some very special surprise guests I will announce in the coming weeks. All I can say for now is how honored I am to have the incredible bassist Dennis Crouch (Elton John, Leon Russell, Gregg Allman) and the insanely talented Fred Eltringham (Willie Nelson, Sheryl Crow, 2017 ACM Drummer of the Year) laying down the rhythm. 

I’m forever grateful for each and every one of you. Thank you for passionately supporting the art you love, time and time again. I couldn’t do any of this without your generosity. Every album preordered, every dollar donated, every invitation to stay in your home, every meal and Topo Chico provided, every ticket to every show has carried me here, now let’s see how far we can take this thing. We’re all in this together.

-C

 

2018 Recap:

Crushed Coins was released on February 23rd, 2018 to wide critical acclaim. It reached #35 on the US Americana Charts and #1 in Amsterdam. It was played on Sirius XM’s Outlaw Country, Whispering Bob Harris’ BBC 2 Radio show, and Another Country with Ricky Ross on BBC Scotland. The title track Crushed Coins was featured on Netflix’s The Ranch with Sam Elliot and Ashton Kutcher. 

With over 150 dates on the calendar, 2018 started with the Cayamo cruise where Caleb played alongside John Prine, Buddy Miller, Jim Lauderdale, Brandi Carlile, Margo Price and many more. Since then, Caleb has toured relentlessly, sharing the stage with John Paul White, Lera Lynn, Ray Wylie Hubbard, Elizabeth Cook, Drivin’ N Cryin’, Aaron Lee Tasjan, Paul Thorn, ShinyRibs, JD McPherson, and The War & Treaty. He was asked to play at Willie Nelson's ranch for Luck Reunion where he swapped songs in the round with Courtney Marie Andrews and Kevn Kinney. After Wildwood Revival, and headlining his six-week full band US tour this summer, he showcased to a packed house at AmericanaFest in Nashville, and played NPR’s World Cafe Live. He's starting 2019 supporting Corb Lund, then headed overseas for his UK Tour, including his official showcase at AmericanaFest UK in January, followed by a month long Scandinavian tour.

"Caleb Caudle's sound encompasses the wide expanse of America, as the best country rock always will." -NPR

"The musical equivalent of high-proof bourbon - rich in flavor, with a subtle, satisfying bite." -Rolling Stone Country

"This is music to be listened to on a porch swing. A lot of it might have been written on one." -The Washington Post

"A worthy new voice in a long tradition of musical storytelling." -American Songwriter 

"A Quiet Classic"-No Depression

"Cinematic Elegance" -Garden & Gun

"Caudle has a knack for simple melodies as much as he does unusual arrangements.” -The Bluegrass Situation

story:
Short Summary

Melbourne Welsh Male Choir has been running the Singer of the Year competition every year for 27 years.  It is an opportunity for aspiring singers (under 35 years old) to showcase their talents in a live competitive performance.

Normally the competition is performed live in front of an audience of 350 and the full choir of 60, with ticket sales funding the prizemoney and event costs.

Given the coronavirus restrictions the Melbourne Welsh Male Choir, along with all other live performers, are having to cancel and postpone live audience events.

But at this time, more than ever, we are determined to provide our aspiring singers with a meaningful opportunity to competitively showcase their performing talents.

In a year where live performances are cancelled and the future of the stage industry is in doubt, our next generation of performers need our support and encouragement. It is up to us all to show that we care and that we will not lie down.

The choir is totally self-funded, by ticket sales and memberships.  While we have a small cash reserve, we will not generate revenue to fund the Singer of the Year competition this year.

There are many ways you can support us with this campaign:

  • Make a contribution on this page
    • Any amount is very welcome, large or small
  • Select a 'perk' and you will receive one of these gifts in appreciation of your generosity
    • Supporter - $50 - Melbourne Welsh water bottle
    • Box Seat - $80 - CD of your choice and a water bottle
    • Virtuoso - $150 - Melbourne Welsh cap, CD of choice and water bottle
    • Blue Riband - $1200 - All of the above, plus a personalised version of either the "He ain't heavy", or the "I Believe" videos
  • Share this campaign with your email contacts, or on your Facebook page (free)
  • Go to our Facebook page and ‘share’ our posts about the campaign (free)
  • If you know an aspiring singer… let them know about the competition (free)
  • Visit our website and consider a sponsorship package instead (business or individual)

 

What We Need

We are seeking to raise $4000 from our friends and supporters.  The full cost of running the Singer of the Year competition is $7000, and we have already received a generous grant of $3000 from the Robert Salzer Foundation:

  • $5000   prizemoney ($3000 for the winner and $1000 for each of the two other finalists)
  • $2000  for the other event running costs
    • judging panel (we pay for 2 independent and external judges)
    • venue hire, accompanist, flowers and gifts for finalists, and other staging costs
    • costs of cameras, lights, post-production and any technical costs
    • promotional costs and crowd-funding ‘perks’

The final will be run as a ‘full dress’ compered live performance. This means that performers, judging panel, accompanist, compere and camera operators will be formally dressed and will run the event as if it was the normal high calibre live stage performance.

The competition is normally run with an audience of 350 in a high quality performance auditorium. This year we will have no audience or choir present at the live performance. However, we do not expect the quality of performance or competition to be impacted in any way.

What Will You Get?

Most importantly you will have the personal satisfaction of supporting our next generation of professional performance artists during these challenging coronavirus times.

But you will also receive:

  • Full (free) access to an online recording of the live event.

In addition, if you purchase a fixed price ‘perk’ you will receive the following gifts of appreciation from us:

  • Supporter - $50 - Melbourne Welsh water bottle
  • Box Seat - $80 - CD of your choice and a water bottle
  • Virtuoso - $150 - Melbourne Welsh cap, CD of choice and water bottle
  • Blue Riband - $1200 - All of the above, plus a personalised version of either the "He ain't heavy", or the "I Believe" videos

 

What happens if we do not reach our funding goal?

If we do not reach our funding goal, then we will use the Choir’s cash reserves to make up the difference. There will be no impact on competitor prizemoney.

If we exceed our funding goal, then the Committee will choose from the following and will communicate this clearly:

  • Adjust the prize pool for SOTY 2020.
  • Move any remaining funds to the Choir’s general fund, with at least some portion being used for future SOTY competitions.

 

More about the Singer of the Year 2020 competition (SOTY 2020)

We are inviting singers to complete an entry form, then submit a video recording online by 27th August. 

The recordings will all be reviewed and assessed by our judging panel.  (This is normally done in two live ‘Heats’ performances, in front of a small audience).

Based on the recordings the judging panel will choose three finalists to perform live in front of the judging panel on Saturday 19th September.  This ‘full dress’ live performance will be compered and recorded, with recordings made available online to the public at no charge.

We are pleased to offer a prize of $3000 to the winner and $1000 to each other finalist.

 

More about the Melbourne Welsh Male Choir

The Melbourne Welsh Male Voice Choir was formed in 1984 and since then it has grown into one of Australia’s acclaimed male choirs, led by David Ashton-Smith, OAM (Musical Director) and accompanied by Simon Walters (pianist extraordinaire).

While maintaining the Welsh choral singing tradition the Melbourne Welsh Male Choir has created its own unique “Australian” sound and style and continues to do so. Our patron, Alwyn Humphreys, has said of the choir “it is the best Welsh choir heard outside of Wales”.

The choir is normally busy with 8-10 performances each year, including performing at major venues such as the Melbourne Recital Centre. Given the current restrictions all performances and tours have been postponed or cancelled. However, we continue with our two hour rehearsals each week, via Zoom video. This actually works well and as well as singing known songs, we are also learning new songs and hosting a series of entertaining and interesting interviews with Friends such as Mike Brady, Erfyl Tomos Jones (2019 National Eisteddfod Blue Riband Winner) and Alwyn Humphreys.

There is a warm and welcoming culture within the choir and while we take our singing seriously, we don’t take ourselves seriously at all. In fact, we have a lot of fun!

We recently released our second 'lockdown' video filmed entirely from our home locations of 'I Believe'. This is a beautiful song of hope about the simple things in life that bring us joy.

Back in March we released our first 'lockdown' video, in support of performers who have lost their incomes due to coronavirus.  We received a combined 50,000 views across Facebook and YouTube, with proceeds going to the Melbourne Recital Centre’s Performers Fund.

Not bad for a bunch of blokes of varying musical experience, who simply like to get together each week to have a sing.  If you like the idea of joining the choir, please drop us an email. You can join our rehearsals via Zoom and when things kick off again we would love to have you stand with us.

 

Stronger together

We appreciate that our ‘special edition’ of the Singer of the Year does not provide you ‘the audience’ with as much value as it normally does.  In a normal year our audience of 350 will dress up and attend a live performance of high quality and enthusiasm.

This year our focus is on ‘the performers’. 

  • Together, we must not allow the disruptions of coronavirus to impact on the livelihood, aspirations and opportunities of our most promising young performers.
  • Together, we must adapt and take what enjoyment and satisfaction we can from a recorded performance, that is performed in a live competitive environment.

If you can, please make a contribution, and also help us to promote this funding campaign as widely as possible.  We are stronger together.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can provide financial support, especially during this difficult period.

However, there are many ways you can support us with this campaign:

  • Make a contribution on this page
    • Any amount is very welcome, large or small
  • Select a 'perk' and you will receive one of these gifts in appreciation of your generosity
    • Supporter - $50 - Melbourne Welsh water bottle
    • Box Seat - $80 - CD of your choice and a water bottle
    • Virtuoso - $150 - Melbourne Welsh cap, CD of choice and water bottle
    • Blue Riband - $1200 - All of the above, plus a personalised version of either the "He ain't heavy", or the "I Believe" videos
  • Share this campaign with your email contacts, or on your Facebook page (free)
  • Go to our Facebook page and ‘share’ our posts about the campaign (free)
  • If you know an aspiring singer… let them know about the competition (free)
  • Visit our website and consider a sponsorship package instead (business or individual)

Thankyou so much for your time and generosity.

The Melbourne Welsh Male Choir.

story:
The Project 

Hey everyone! I'm releasing my first EP. I've had the opportunity to collaborate with some incredible musicians and friends, and the process has been an absolute blast. My heart behind the EP is to make something that is simply art, with no agenda. I am deeply moved by blues, jazz, and soul music, and I desire to move and inspire listeners of all types. 

Support

To ensure top notch quality, I am going to professionally record the EP. To do so, I will need your help! 

Budget : $2,000 

What It Will Cover: studio time, mixing, mastering, musicians compensation 

Risks & Challenges

If I do not meet my goal I will not be able to provide perks! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't support me financially, no worries! Just come to a show, follow my Instagram @BlazeLawrimoreMusic, and enjoy the music!

story:
About us

Voyagers of a new musical frontier, the Astronauts galvanise old-school RnB with slick new age funk. Formed in June 2016, the band is a quintet of like-minded musicians brought together by the love of all things funky and soulful. Within the next year, the boys released their debut single “Get Close” along with its accompanying music video.

Following their success, the Astronauts continue to shake up the music scene. Having opened for Tim De Cotta’s “Warrior” album launch in 2017, the band has and is slated to play at various noteworthy local festivals. To date, the band has shared the stage with notable artists such as Charlie Lim, Disco Hue and Stopgap. The Astronauts were also in the 2017 edition of the Noise Music Mentorship Program under the tutelage of Kevin Foo- a veteran of the local scene who has managed artists such as Linying, The Steve McQueens and Charlie Lim.

The Astronauts recently released their debut EP entitled 'ONE'. The second single off their EP, “Kryptonite”, peaked at #4 on Spotify Singapore’s Viral 50 list and is available on all major music streaming platforms.

About the Event: 

Singaporean RnB/Funk band Astronauts celebrates the release of their debut EP, 'ONE', with a party you don't want to miss!

Joined by local acts Subhas and Ffion, Astronauts will take the stage on the 19th of May like you've never seen them before. Also bringing the heat to the dance floor with the Astronauts is a 13-piece band as well as special guests- the  Lion City Lockers. Put on your dancing shoes and make sure your jeans aren't too tight. Get ready for a night of funky, RnB goodness!


*************************** D E T A I L S ***************************


The Astronauts 'ONE' EP Launch will be held at the *SCAPE Ground Theatre

Venue: Level 2, 2 Orchard Link, Singapore 237978
Date: 19 May 2018, Saturday
Time: 7.30PM - 10.30PM

Short Summary

As an indie band, staging productions of this scale requires a lot of funding. We've worked hard to save as much as we can from the shows that we play throughout the year, but we still need your help to make this show a success!

If you are a fan of our music, dance, hip hop, funk and anything in between, this is a fundraiser that will support these movements in Singapore. With this funding, we'll be able to celebrate the best of local street culture and put on an EP launch like never seen before!

What We Need & What You Get

We're aiming to raise $5000 that will go towards the following:

  • Staging and Audio/Visual costs (e.g. speakers & lights)
  • Cost of production personnel
  • Band Merchandise

THE PERKS:

In return for your support, we are offering our merch (images soon) pre-show at discounted rates! Grab a signed launch poster, or our tote bags and enamel pins too!

Every donation goes a long way and we pledge to use the funding to support the aforementioned costs regardless of the amount we eventually raise.

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not need a private acoustic show, but you CAN drop by the actual launch! Grab a ticket from our Peatix page and head down on May 19, Saturday - we'd love to see you there!

Even if you can't make it either, you can still get the word out and share this campaign with your friends and family!

Every donation goes a long way and we pledge to use the funding to support the aforementioned costs regardless of the amount we eventually raise.

Other Ways You Can Help
You may not need a private acoustic show, but you CAN drop by the actual launch! Grab a ticket from our Peatix page and head down on May 19, Saturday - we'd love to see you there!
Even if you can't make it either, you can still get the word out and share this campaign with your friends and family!

story:
About Project 206

A freakout jazz-rock band formed out of the mutual desire to push the boundaries of genre and our own musicianship. Taking influence from a range of music as diverse as Red Fang to Ornette Coleman; the intent of Project 206 is to create a sonic environment where preconceptions are smashed, and goosebumps raised.

The EP: Volatile

A brand new collection of 4 compositions by Galen Bundy, brought to life by Joe Fee, Travis Aukerman, and Peter Formanek.

"We've all put so much work and passion into this EP; 'Volatile' represents times of great change and upheaval in both our personal lives, and the world. This music is a source of catharsis for us, and we hope it can be for you as well."

What your contribution will go towards

  • Recording, mixing, and mastering fees
  • Artwork
  • Publicity campaign
  • Music Video
  • Merch

Final word

Thank you for considering donating to our fundraiser! Please take a look at the perks we can offer, and don't hesitate to send us a message with any questions you might have. We look forward to bringing you this music.

story:
WHAT WE'RE MAKING
In collaboration with producer/multi-instrumentalist John Elliott (of The Little Unsaid) I'm embarking on the making of an ambitious new album of songs inspired by the stories of people at the heart of the global refugee crisis.

We're aiming to produce a dynamic and adventurous record rooted in alt-folk songwriting, layered with field recordings, electronics, spoken word and music composed and recorded in various locations, both around the UK and beyond. It's our hope to play a small part in attempting to humanise the crisis and give voice to the courage, hope and dignity of individual refugees we’re in contact with or have come across on our journey making this music.

WHY ‘REFUGE’?
Many of those in power, buoyed by the media, seek to dehumanise the refugee crisis by stirring xenophobia and trying to depict immigrants as our enemies. We are bombarded with reductive news stories and statistics that often serve to convey refugees as a faceless, threatening mass of incomers. We dont feel the crisis can be ignored nor will it be solved through the kind of financial deals where refugees end up as bargaining chips.

We hope music and songwriting can play an important role in deconstructing and debunking this portrayal of people who are put through hell simply to cross borders in search of a place of peace and safety for their families. By sharing some of the inspiring human stories we’ve encountered, we intend this album to be a kind of love note to the human spirit that keeps burning amidst the struggle of millions of displaced people today.

I've already made some inspiring connections with refugees at the Moria Refugee Camp in Lesbos, who have shared stories of the hellish struggles millions of families undertake on their journeys to find peace and safety. We've also commissioned refugee artists living in the camp to make some beautiful pieces to include in the album artwork. The art on display on this site is by Shukran and the design by Monitor. I first found out about The Wave of Hope For The Future School (WHF) in this BBC feature. The school was founded by Zekria Farzad; a refugee himself who arrived at the Camp with his family in 2018. Started in a few tents in a nearby olive grove to meet the educational needs of the growing vulnerable camp population it is run by fellow refugees and asylum seekers and now has over 1000 pupils of all ages.

HOW IT’LL WORK

We asked WHF School what they need and discovered that as well as offering classes in languages & literacy, arts, crafts and cultural dialogue they also have music classes. Currently they have 150 guitar students and only a handful of guitars.
So we decided with them that our first gesture will be to provide 10 guitars for the school. These will be purchased in Lesbos, supporting the local Greek economy.

 

**UPDATE**  with the help of an NGO architect the school are now constructing classrooms using low cost materials. We will be investing directly in this project.

- After this we will use the funds raised to cover our basic costs in recording and releasing the best album we can make, delivered directly to you as soon as it’s ready.

- Beyond that we will be looking at ways we can continue to support the school and related causes with our album release and tour.

- Incentives we are offering to get this project funded include the album on limited edition CD, handwritten lyrics sheets, a bonus album of alternative versions and remixes of tracks from the album, house concerts and more. Have an explore and do get in touch if you have any questions about any of the offers.


WHY WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT
For me as a songwriter this is my most ambitious project to date and I feel I am writing some of the best material of my career. I have been feeling a growing desire and responsibility to write about more humanitarian themes and want to adopt a more journalistic and immersive approach for this record. Finding resonance in the minutely observed details of human life and the socio- political realities and deeper hidden themes that stand behind it.

During an initial intense creative spell that lasted about 3 days and nights (of not much sleep!) I conceived of the project, reached out to people, wrote half the songs and sketched the forms of several others. The hallmarks of that time were imagination, courage, a lack of fear of failure and an ever present desire for truth. This is the spirit we are carrying into the project.

Having John Elliott on board is incredibly motivating for me. Not only is he a brilliant musician and producer but he is a friend who understands the themes above and who engages deeply with what it means to be an artist in the 2020's.

This is an independent project and we can’t make this record without the support of people like you, people who value and sustain the work of musicians operating outside the commercial music industry. By getting involved and pre-ordering any of the incentives on the right of this page you're making this project possible, and we are so grateful. We'll keep you updated on the process every step of the way, from research to writing and right through the recording sessions.

Thank you so much for considering getting involved with this project and allowing us to share this music and these stories as widely as possible.


THE WAVE OF HOPE SCHOOL
If you’re not interested in the music but want to find out more about the work in the camp or make a direct donation, you can do that here.


Thank you for supporting this project, we can’t wait to share this new music with you!

story:
My Story

Becoming a grandparent last year, brought me full circle as a musician. Evaluating my life through that lens, helped me recognize that while I’m aging, my greatest creative accomplishments were yet unrealized. As a 40-something guitarist/songwriter, I have a myriad of experiences that have inspired me.

I have had the privilege of interacting with people from all walks of life. Their stories have inspired me to share in song about some of their struggles. This is where the concept behind the album Color Wheel developed. We are a collection of people uniquely shaped by personal tragedy and triumph. Representative by different colors across the spectrum of life. 

This album represents my first large scale solo recording effort. In today’s new music business, independent artists have the opportunity to partner with their fans, family and friends to release their creative works on CD and vinyl. That is what this campaign is all about.

 

What I Need & What You Get

I am seeking at least 200 people to partner with me at one of the four levels. Relentless pecking on a calculator, has determined that 200 people participating will satisfy all minimum quantities required by the merchandise vendors.

Some of the standout product offerings of this campaign are:

  • Limited run t-shirts
  • Downloadable hi-res WAV files
  • Digipak CDs
  • Limited Edition Vinyl
    • We are talking a very special 180 gram (audiophile grade)
    • Multicolored vinyl (each one is unique)

When they are gone, they are gone!

To make the above merchandise a reality, I need to raise at least $6,000. In the sad event we cannot make that minimum goal a reality, we may have to eliminate the vinyl as an offering (Having gotten back into vinyl myself, I am hopeful we can avoid this scenario)

Your purchase makes a bold statement! IT SAYS that a small group partnering together can make dreams become a reality! IT SAYS independent creatives like myself can monetize their passions, regardless of age, race, etc. And most of all, it says grandparents can still ROCK!

 

Risks & Challenges

One of the biggest challenges a musician faces is whether people will accept or even like their music. I suffer from it as well. Even though I have shared my music to a small group of friends during the album recording process with favorable feedback, I am still kept awake at night by the fear that this campaign will fall fall on its face and that people will suffer from involuntary vomiting when there hear the music. Unfortunately at the end of the day, sales, streams, and likes still are metrics a musician uses to gauge their success.

My hope is that your involvement in this project becomes the beginning of a beautiful friendship. With that said, feel free to share this campaign with your rock music loving friends.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this campaign with your tribe of people on social media
  • Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools, it will make the above easier.

story:
Keep Kress Independent

I was a work addict for 13 years, like any good American. I was obsessed with my business. The whole time I was secretly writing songs. Private medicine to keep Self alive. Singing back to writers like Ani Difranco and Dar Williams.

The songs: One hundred of them. NObody heard them, at all, ever. Then I shared with friends who made me promise to get on stages, that week. I hit WCS competitions, won 12 times in a row, got rushed to L.A., scored a dance-remix-of-my-songs  type of situation, scored a likely tv placement, intense professional management, encouragement to write a "little dumber" and look "a little younger." Higher heels, bigger hair. Then I lost myself. I started trying to write what the industry monster told me I should.

I love 99% of monsters. The industry monster: Sucks. Artists get screwed. But more critically, art itself gets lost. Songs saved my life at one point. So it with gravity that I say we need artistic control to stay in the artist's hands - because we NEED art.

In July, Dar told me, "The relationship between fan and artist is still pure. Find your fans directly." Dar also cried two times when I played my songs for her (what?!?!). She said, "Kress songs make the ordinary sacred" and told me I was born to do this. She is my absolute writing hero, so there is no greater external validation I can wait for.

When you pre-buy this next album, or please make a bigger contribution, you are DIRECTLY keeping me from seeking a record deal (a.k.a. losing creative control). And like heroes I admire like Ani and Macklemore, the songs go right from my mouth and my red guitar, right to you.

THIS Album is different

Alanis Morisette told me in a dream to take only the very best, mega-fan favorites from my 2015 pre-release "demo" album ("Difficult Life", "Joy", "Jesus Was a Lonely Girl") and produce them BETTER. Add cello, add pauses, take our time, get professional production. Get the songs PERFECT (perfectly raw and emotional). And closer to the live Kress experience which everyone has been asking me how the heck I'll do.

Then, Alanis said, take my 12 brand-new songs, the best songs I feel I've ever written (ala "Little Bitty Mystic") and make Kress' own "Jagged Little Pill" type of artistic statement. That's what I'm asking you to pre-buy and in doing so, fund the making of now.

Alanis' "Jagged Little Pill" is ALL hits. Every song is a zinger. 

She said in the dream, "Do what I did. Release a crafted power album. On this album, only put the songs that are absolutely solid. And give them the production treatment they deserve."

My tender hope, if any of these songs ever make you cry (like they do me), then this album will be ALL and only those. Every. Single. Track. Only the very best 15 songs of the 100 I've written. 

These are songs you've been asking me for, they're ALL going to be on here. 

Including the illustrious crowd-pleaser "Bad Song" (that song that sucks at being a song) and even the risky risky "Ex" (my ex is my ex for a reason). 

And this time - I won't knock it out in one week like 2015's demo. With producer extraordinaire Margrit Eichler, we've got percussion in the works, violins, cello, beats, Regina Spektor-type and Tori Amos-type production inspiration. Quirk with the pauses, strings and space, and poetry you've come to expect from a Kress song.

This will be a first album I can be very very proud of. 

Take time and NAIL it.

What We Need & What You Get

  • It will take $8,000 to record it, get the badass cellist to riff on it, etc. and get it mastered so it sounds like a creamy cream-thing. I am paying $4,000 of my money I will work my butt off to earn and my super dream is that you will help with the other $4,000 by just...buying the album NOW.
  • You get: Duh, Kress' "Jaggged Little Pill" album, to be titled...ALL HITS! Digital AND CD formats available with the fancy lyrics book so you can sing and cry along...because y'all know how I feel about words
  • MORE perks you can buy! You tell me which song you want and I'll sing it in raw form and email it to you, with a custom greeting and thank you, just for you, in a casual honest spontaneous way, delivered right to your inbox. AND/OR Get a copy of the lovely demo I made in 2015! AND/OR Get me to come deliver songs to your face, live. I'll drive to you and bring folding chairs and give you a house concert. I'm very honored that the last concert I did someone said, "Someone told me about the emotional/healing 'Kress Zone' they get in when hearing you live, and it is real! There's nothing like experiencing Kress songs live." 

The Impact

I cannot with words tell you what this means.

How long I sat on songs alone. 

How hard I tumbled in my own personal hells. 

How I am aghast with gratitude that I've arrived to this amount of serenity and how I want to reach out with these words to anyone else having terror or joy.

What it means to share them and communicate with you.

We get so miracle when we get done with I am so alone.

story:
VERSION EN ESPAÑOL >>> 

VERSION EN FRANCAIS >>>


What's the PianoMóvil?

A pianist and a grand piano on a customized truck that transforms into a  concert stage for free concerts around Colombia.

PianoMóvil presents, teaches, learns, transmits and highlights issues it has at heart.

In order to appreciate the value of this project, the sociopolitical context of Colombia should be taken into account, as this country recovers from a long armed conflict.

PianoMóvil creates links between people including those from different social classes. It aspires to sow grains of peace and encourage the recognition of human life value in the spirit and in heart of the youngest.



A crowdfunding to finance the first steps of the PianoMóvil - Goal 2016


Before any major adventure, a first experience is needed. For that, after several concerts in Paris to present the project, we will take an additional step and perform a series of 5 free open air concerts in Bogotá and its surroundings.

This first experience will constitute the encounter of a French-Colombian project, developed in France, with the Colombian soil and its inhabitants. This experience should validate the potential and viability of a bigger National Tour in 2017, and will be at the same time a previously unseen event in Colombia.


THE PILOT EXPERIENCE - AUGUST 2016

The Colombian Team of PianoMóvil has selected 5 pertinent places in Bogotá and its surroundings.



We will install, on an open air stage, a grand piano with sound and lighting system, for a concert followed or preceded by activities around the subject of piano and music.

The concert will perform pieces of a colombian and universal repertory, most of them will surely be heard for the first time by the public.

Children, who have probably never seen a grand piano before in their lifetime, will have the opportunity to listen, play and discover its mechanism.

The whole project aims to offer an experience that invites the public to support and come closer to artistic practices.

Every installation will be concretized thanks to partners, already engaged, with local actors (foundations, associations, etc…). Their support will allow the proposition of 2 concerts, from the 5 considered, in the unprivileged neighborhoods.

Another concert will be proposed in one of the main business centers in Bogotá: a direct invitation to the Colombian society to reinforce their support and interest for artistic initiatives.


BUDGET AND FINANCING

We dream of a collective project, independent, loyal to its values and its engagement to the people. It is for this reason that we wish that its financing be mixed, that it will integrate both the small and big contributions, coming from public or private sources, local and international.

We invite all those who believe in art’s capacity to transform society, to join this adventure and make PianoMóvil a project of their own. We work with all our efforts to offer a project that is transparent, federative, serious and considerate of every detail. The association EUPHONIA's purpose is to translate the resources of our beneficiaries into pertinent and significant actions for Colombia.



WHY AND FOR WHOM A PIANOMOVIL?


Colombia, a magical landscape of « Macondian » stories of the Nobel prize winning author Gabriel García Márquez, is naturally rich in exceptional diversity and is a fresh economic hope of Latin America, but it is also a country that suffered 50 years of armed conflict and confronts the highest inequality index of its region today. For the young generations, the lack of access to education and culture rests among the most important factors of social difference.


A Devoted Committee

The members of EUPHONIA gathered together with the conviction that art is capable of embracing a creative message, being socially constructive and a legitimate change agent.

The association, that functions thanks to donations and volunteering, was created in France in 2014 after the initiative of Diego Franco, a Colombian pianist who has lived in Paris for  6 years, and is constituted by active French and Colombian young professionals, specialized in diverse areas.


Our Mission

Through the transmission of the musical practice:

  • Encourage children, teenagers and the most vulnerable people to become conscious of their own importance and to seek the development of their own potential, despite their difficult life context.
  • Inform and increase general public awareness, as well as that of the actors -public and private-involved, towards cultural and social problems, trying to motivate them to take action.


Our Vision

  • Perform and support artistic projects with social interest in order to open to their own populations enriching cultural experiences.
  • In a post-conflict context, weave the links between populations divided from political tensions, social inequalities or their specific condition (peasants, indigenous, urbans, expatriated…), through a neutral and noble theme, common to all – the musical practice.
  • Put in place a team, a network and a set of analysis and experiences in order to be able to propose pertinent solutions and to influence the decision making of official actors and particulars concerned with the issues hence studied.

Though we focus on the Colombian case, EUPHONIA aspires to develop a message with universal value.


WHAT WOULD BE THE BIG TOUR OF PIANOMÓVIL ?


PianoMóvil’s real tour is an ambitious project. It includes a grand piano, and above all a customized bus that transforms itself in a real stage. It has a sound and audio system for the realization of a documentary.

Such a mobile unit will have the capacity to perform annual tours. Real trips for territorial exploration, moving encounters, the discovery of local music and musicians and dialogues between different traditions … 2.547 kilometers of music !

Discover more by visiting us: www.pianomovil.com
FRANCAIS


Qu'est-ce que le PianoMóvil ? 


Un pianiste et son piano embarqués sur un camion, pour des concerts itinérants à travers la Colombie.

Le PianoMóvil présente, enseigne, apprend, transmet, met en évidence des problématiques qui lui sont chères. 

Pour apprécier la valeur de sa démarche, il faut tenir compte du contexte sociopolitique de la Colombie, qui se remet doucement d'un long conflit armé. 

Le PianoMóvil crée des liens entre populations et classes sociales différentes. Il sème des graines de paix et encourage la valorisation de la vie humaine dans l'esprit et dans le cœur des plus jeunes.



Un crowdfunding pour financer les premiers pas du PianoMóvil - Objectif 2016


Avant toute aventure d'envergure, il faut une première expérience. C'est pourquoi, après plusieurs concerts à Paris pour présenter le projet, nous faisons un pas de plus et proposons une série de 5 concerts gratuits en plein air à Bogotá et sa périphérie. 

Cette première expérience constituera la rencontre d'un projet franco-colombien, développé en France, avec le sol colombien et ses habitants. Elle devra valider le potentiel et la viabilité d’une grande Tournée Nationale en 2017 tout en constituant un événement inédit en Colombie.


L’EXPÉRIENCE PILOTE - AOÛT 2016


L'équipe colombienne du PianoMóvil a sélectionné 5 lieux pertinents à Bogotá et ses environs.



Nous y installerons, sur une estrade en plein air, un grand piano à queue sonorisé et éclairé, pour un concert suivi ou précédé d'activités autour du piano et de la musique.

Le concert proposera des morceaux du répertoire colombien et universel, que la plupart entendra pour la première fois.
Les enfants, qui n’ont probablement jamais vu un piano à queue de leur vie, auront l’occasion de l’écouter, d'en jouer, de découvrir son mécanisme.
L'ensemble du dispositif  vise à offrir une expérience qui invite le public à soutenir et à se rapprocher des pratiques artistiques.

Chaque installation sera concrétisée grâce à des partenariats, d'ores et déjà engagés, avec des acteurs locaux (fondations, associations,..). Leur accompagnement nous permettra de proposer notamment 2 concerts sur les 5, dans des quartiers très défavorisés. Un autre concert sera proposé dans l’un des centres d’affaires de Bogotá, telle une invitation faite à la société colombienne de renforcer son soutien et son intérêt pour les initiatives artistiques.


LE BUDGET ET SON FINANCEMENT


Nous rêvons d'un projet collectif, indépendant, fidèle à ses valeurs et à son engagement envers les gens. C’est pourquoi nous souhaitons que sont financement soit mixte, qu'il intègre les petites comme les grandes contributions, qu'il soit d'origine publique et privée, locale et internationale.

Nous invitons tous ceux qui croient en la capacité de l’art à transformer la société, à rejoindre cette aventure et à faire sien le PianoMóvil. Nous travaillons de toutes nos forces pour proposer un projet fédérateur, transparent, sérieux, pensé dans tous ses détails. L'association Euphonia a pour but de traduire les ressources de nos bienfaiteurs en actions pertinentes et significatives pour la Colombie. 



POURQUOI ET POUR QUI
UN PIANOMÓVIL ?


La Colombie, paysage magique des histoires « macondiennes » du Prix Nobel Gabriel García Márquez, nature à la biodiversité exceptionnelle et nouvel espoir économique d’Amérique Latine, est aussi un pays ayant souffert de plus de 50 ans de conflit armé, qui connait aujourd’hui l’indice d’inégalité le plus élevé de sa région. Pour les nouvelles générations, le manque d’accès à l’éducation et à la culture reste parmi les facteurs de différenciation sociale les plus déterminants.


Un collectif engagé 

Les membres d’EUPHONIA sont réunis par la conviction de la capacité de l’art à porter un message créatif, transformateur et socialement constructif. 

L’association qui fonctionne grâce aux donations et au bénévolat, a été créée en France en 2014 à l’initiative de Diego Franco, pianiste colombien vivant à Paris depuis 6 ans, et se compose de jeunes actifs français et colombiens issus de domaines divers.


Notre Mission

A travers la transmission de la pratique musicale :

  • Encourager les enfants, les adolescents et les personnes les plus vulnérables à prendre conscience de leur propre importance et à s’efforcer de développer leur potentiel malgré un contexte de vie difficile.
  • Informer et sensibiliser le grand public, ainsi que les acteurs publics et privés concernés, à des problématiques culturelles et sociales en les incitant à entreprendre des actions.

Notre Vision

  • Proposer et soutenir des projets artistiques à vocation sociale afin d’offrir à ces mêmes populations des expériences enrichissantes sur le plan culturel.
  • Dans un contexte de post-conflit, tisser des liens entre les populations séparées par les tensions politiques, par les inégalités sociales ou par leur condition (paysans, indigènes, citadins, expatriés…) grâce à une thématique neutre, noble et commune à tous – la pratique musicale.
  • Mettre en place une équipe, un réseau et un ensemble d’analyses et d’expériences afin de pouvoir proposer des solutions pertinentes et d’influencer la prise de décisions des acteurs officiels et particuliers concernés par les problématiques ainsi étudiées.
Même si nous nous focalisons sur le cas particulier de la Colombie,  EUPHONIA aspire à développer un message à valeur universelle.

EN QUOI CONSISTE LA GRANDE TOURNÉE DU PIANOMÓVIL ? - 

Objectif 2017


La vraie tournée PianoMóvil est un projet ambitieux. Il comprend un beau piano à queue, et surtout un camion customisé qui se transforme en une véritable scène. Il est doté d’un équipement audio et vidéo pour la réalisation d’un documentaire.

Une telle unité mobile autonome aurait la capacité de proposer des tournées annuelles. De véritables voyages d’exploration du territoire, des rencontres touchantes, la découverte de musiques et de musiciens locaux, de dialogues entre traditions différentes… 2.547 kilomètres de musique !

Découvrez-en plus sur : www.pianomovil.com



ESPAÑOL


¿QUÉ ES EL PIANOMÓVIL?


Un pianista y un piano que viajan en un camión para realizar conciertos itinerantes a través del territorio colombiano. 
El PianoMóvil presenta, enseña, aprende, transmite y visibiliza algunas problemáticas con las que se identifica. 
Para apreciar el valor del proyecto PianoMóvil hay que tener en cuenta el contexto sociopolítico en Colombia. 
El PianoMóvil crea vínculos entre poblaciones y clases sociales diferentes. Aspira a sembrar granos de paz y de apreciación del valor de la vida humana en el pensamiento y en el corazón de los más jóvenes. 



COLECTA DE FONDOS - Objetivo 2016

Los primeros pasos del PianoMóvil. 


Antes de toda gran aventura es necesaria una primera experiencia. Es por esto que, luego de haber realizado varios conciertos en París para presentar el proyecto, queremos dar un paso más: una serie de 5 conciertos gratuitos y al aire libre en Bogotá y su periferia. 
Esta primera experiencia será el encuentro de un proyecto franco-colombiano, concebido en Francia, con el territorio colombiano y sus habitantes. Nuestra prueba piloto será un evento inédito en Colombia, y demostrará la viabilidad y el potencial del proyecto para una gran gira nacional en 2017. 


 

EXPERIENCIA PILOTO- agosto 2016  
5 conciertos en Bogotá.


El equipo del PianoMóvil seleccionó 5 lugares estratégicos en Bogotá y sus alrededores.



Allí instalaremos sobre una tarima al aire libre un gran piano de cola con sonido e iluminación, para hacer un concierto acompañado por actividades y talleres relacionados con el piano y la música.

Los conciertos propondrán piezas del repertorio colombiano y universal que tal vez muchos escucharán por primera vez. Los niños que quizá en toda su vida no han tenido la oportunidad de ver un piano de cola, tendrán la ocasión de escucharlo, de tocarlo y de descubrir su mecanismo. El conjunto de la propuesta está dirigida a ofrecer una experiencia que invite al público a acercarse y a apoyar las prácticas artísticas.

Cada uno de los conciertos se realizará gracias a alianzas ya establecidas con actores culturales locales (fundaciones y asociaciones). Su acompañamiento nos permitirá especialmente proponer dos de nuestros cinco conciertos en barrios de estratos uno y dos. 

Otro concierto será realizado en uno de los centros de negocios de Bogotá: esta será una invitación hecha a la sociedad colombiana para renovar su apoyo y su interés por las iniciativas artísticas.


FINANCIAMIENTO Y PRESUPUESTO


Soñamos un proyecto colectivo, independiente, fiel a sus propios valores y a su compromiso con las personas. Es por esto que deseamos que su financiamiento sea mixto, que integre los pequeños y los grandes contribuyentes, que tenga un origen público y privado, local e internacional.

Invitamos a todos los que crean en la capacidad del arte para transformar la sociedad a unirse a esta aventura y a apropiarse del PianoMóvil. Todos nuestros esfuerzos buscan proponer un proyecto incluyente, transparente, y serio; cuyos gastos se detallan a continuación. El colectivo EUPHONIA tiene como objetivo traducir los recursos de nuestros donantes en acciones pertinentes y significativas para Colombia.





¿POR QUÉ Y PARA QUIÉN UN PIANOMÓVIL?


Colombia necesita propuestas que dinamicen sus ciudades, iniciativas que promuevan la apropiación del patrimonio artístico y del espacio público como un derecho y una efectiva herramienta de construcción de equidad.

La Unidad Móvil de Conciertos puede ser una manera de “llegar” a los barrios y pueblos marginales, invitándolos a redescubrir y a imaginar de otro modo los espacios públicos de su localidad. También puede ser un modo de crear escenarios de encuentro entre personas con intereses, actividades y niveles de ingresos distintos, propiciando la convivencia y el deseo de compartir.

El PianoMóvil no es un medio de entretenimiento o de producción de sonidos: es un ministerio artístico y social que entiende la música como “el arte de entregar sonidos con generosidad”; la música como una invitación afectuosa a la excelencia.


Un colectivo comprometido

Los miembros de EUPHONIA se reúnen por la convicción de que el arte tiene la capacidad de transmitir un mensaje creativo, transformador y socialmente constructivo.

La asociación, que funciona gracias a donaciones y voluntarios, fue creada en 2014 por iniciativa de Diego Franco, pianista colombiano residente en Francia desde hace 6 años, y se compone de jóvenes parisinos y colombianos con profesiones diversas. 


Nuestra misión

A través la divulgación de la práctica musical:

  • Inspirar a los niños, a los jóvenes y a los más vulnerables a ser conscientes de su propia importancia y a esforzarse por desarrollar su potencial a pesar de un contexto adverso.
  • Informar y sensibilizar al público general y a los actores privados y públicos pertinentes acerca de problemáticas culturales y sociales, incitándolos a embarcarse en la búsqueda de soluciones.


Visión

  • Proponer y respaldar proyectos artísticos con vocación social para ofrecer a niños, jóvenes y poblaciones aisladas, experiencias enriquecedoras en el plano cultural.
  • En un contexto de conflicto, tejer vínculos entre poblaciones alejadas por su ideología, por su situación socioeconómica o por su condición (campesinos, indígenas, citadinos…) gracias a una temática neutra, noble y común a todos: la práctica musical.
  • Consolidar un equipo, una red y un conjunto de análisis y de experiencias con el fin de proponer soluciones pertinentes y de influenciar la toma de decisiones por parte de actores oficiales y particulares.

Al focalizarse en el caso particular de Colombia, EUPHONIA aspira a desarrollar un mensaje de valor universal.


¿EN QUÉ CONSISTE LA GIRA DEL PIANOMÓVIL ? - objetivo 2017


La gira del PianoMóvil es un proyecto ambicioso, consiste en poner a rodar por las carreteras de Colombia un piano de cola en un camión modificado, que se transforma en un verdadero escenario. 

Esta unidad móvil estará dotada de un equipo de audio y video que permitirá la realización de un documental y tendrá la capacidad de proponer giras anuales. También interesantes viajes de exploración del territorio, de encuentros emotivos, de conocimiento de músicas y músicos locales, de diálogos entre tradiciones diferentes… y 2.547 kilómetros de música!


Para conocer la hoja de vida de Diego Franco, haga clic aquí.

Descubra el blog personal de Diego aquí.
Descubra más sobre el proyecto en: www.pianomovil.com
story_txt:
VERSION EN ESPAÑOL >>> 


VERSION EN FRANCAIS >>> 



What's the PianoMóvil?


A pianist and a grand piano on a customized truck that transforms into a  concert stage for free concerts around Colombia.
PianoMóvil presents,
teaches, learns, transmits and highlights issues it has at heart.
In order to appreciate the value of this project, the sociopolitical
context of Colombia should be taken into account, as this country recovers from a
long armed conflict.
PianoMóvil creates links between people including those from different social classes.
It aspires to sow grains of peace and encourage the recognition of human life value in the spirit and in heart of the youngest.


A crowdfunding to finance the first steps of the PianoMóvil - Goal 2016



Before any major adventure, a first experience is needed. For that, after
several concerts in Paris to present the project, we will take an additional
step and perform a series of 5 free open air concerts in Bogotá and its surroundings.
This first experience will constitute the encounter of a French-Colombian
project, developed in France, with the Colombian soil and its inhabitants. This
experience should validate the potential and viability of a bigger National
Tour in 2017, and will be at the same time a previously unseen event in Colombia.

THE PILOT EXPERIENCE - AUGUST
2016


The Colombian Team of PianoMóvil has selected 5 pertinent places in
Bogotá and its surroundings.




We will install, on an open air stage, a grand piano with sound and
lighting system, for a concert followed or preceded by activities around the
subject of piano and music.
The concert will perform pieces of a colombian and universal repertory, most
of them will surely be heard for the first time by the public.
Children, who have probably never seen a grand piano before in their
lifetime, will have the opportunity to listen, play and discover its
mechanism.
The whole project aims to offer an experience that invites the public to
support and come closer to artistic practices. 
Every installation will be concretized thanks to partners, already engaged,
with local actors (foundations, associations, etc…). Their support will allow the
proposition of 2 concerts, from the 5 considered, in the unprivileged
neighborhoods.
Another concert will be proposed in one of the main business centers in Bogotá:
a direct invitation to the Colombian society to reinforce their support and
interest for artistic initiatives.

BUDGET AND FINANCING


We dream of a collective project, independent, loyal to its values and its
engagement to the people. It is for this reason that we wish that its
financing be mixed, that it will integrate both the small and big
contributions, coming from public or private sources, local and international.
We invite all those who believe in art’s capacity to transform society, to
join this adventure and make PianoMóvil a project of their own. We work
with all our efforts to offer a project that is transparent, federative,
serious and considerate of every detail. The association EUPHONIA's purpose is to translate the resources of our beneficiaries into pertinent and
significant actions for Colombia.




WHY AND FOR WHOM A PIANOMOVIL?



Colombia, a magical
landscape of « Macondian » stories of the Nobel prize winning author Gabriel García
Márquez, is naturally rich in exceptional diversity and is a fresh economic hope of
Latin America, but it is also a country that suffered 50 years of armed conflict and confronts the highest inequality index of its region today. For
the young generations, the lack of access to education and culture rests among
the most important factors of social difference.

A Devoted Committee
The members of EUPHONIA gathered together with the conviction that art is capable of embracing a creative message, being socially constructive and a legitimate change agent.
The association, that functions thanks to donations and volunteering, was created in France in 2014 after the initiative of Diego Franco, a Colombian pianist who has lived in Paris for  6 years, and is constituted by active French and Colombian young professionals, specialized in diverse areas.
Our Mission
Through the transmission of
the musical practice:

Encourage children, teenagers
     and the most vulnerable people to become conscious of their own importance
     and to seek the development of their own potential, despite their difficult
     life context.
Inform and increase general
     public awareness, as well as that of the actors -public and private-involved,
     towards cultural and social problems, trying to motivate them to take
     action.


Our Vision

Perform and support artistic
     projects with social interest in order to open to their own populations
     enriching cultural experiences.
In a post-conflict context,
     weave the links between populations divided from political tensions, social
     inequalities or their specific condition (peasants, indigenous, urbans,
     expatriated…), through a neutral and noble theme, common to all – the
     musical practice.
Put in place a team, a network
     and a set of analysis and experiences in order to be able to propose
     pertinent solutions and to influence the decision making of official
     actors and particulars concerned with the issues hence studied.

Though we focus on the Colombian case, EUPHONIA
aspires to develop a message with universal value.

WHAT WOULD BE THE BIG TOUR
OF PIANOMÓVIL ?


PianoMóvil’s real tour is an ambitious
project. It includes a grand piano, and above all a customized bus that
transforms itself in a real stage. It has a sound and audio system for the
realization of a documentary.
Such a mobile unit will have
the capacity to perform annual tours. Real trips for territorial exploration,
moving encounters, the discovery of local music and musicians and dialogues
between different traditions … 2.547 kilometers of music !
Discover more by visiting us: www.pianomovil.com
