El equipo del PianoMóvil seleccionó 5 lugares estratégicos en Bogotá y sus alrededores.



Allí instalaremos sobre una tarima al aire libre un
gran piano de cola con sonido e iluminación, para hacer un concierto acompañado
por actividades y talleres relacionados con el piano y la música.
Los conciertos propondrán piezas del repertorio colombiano y
universal que tal vez muchos escucharán por primera vez. Los niños que quizá en
toda su vida no han tenido la oportunidad de ver un piano de cola, tendrán la
ocasión de escucharlo, de tocarlo y de descubrir su mecanismo. El conjunto de
la propuesta está dirigida a ofrecer una experiencia que invite al público a acercarse
y a apoyar las prácticas artísticas.
Cada
uno de los conciertos se realizará gracias a alianzas ya establecidas con
actores culturales locales (fundaciones y asociaciones). Su acompañamiento
nos permitirá especialmente proponer dos de nuestros cinco conciertos en
barrios de estratos uno y dos. 
Otro concierto será realizado en uno de los
centros de negocios de Bogotá: esta será una invitación hecha a la sociedad
colombiana para renovar su apoyo y su interés por las iniciativas artísticas.



FINANCIAMIENTO Y PRESUPUESTO


Soñamos un proyecto colectivo, independiente, fiel a sus propios valores y a su compromiso con las personas. Es por esto que deseamos que su financiamiento sea mixto, que integre los pequeños y los grandes contribuyentes, que tenga un origen público y privado, local e internacional.
Invitamos a todos los que crean en la capacidad del arte para transformar la sociedad a unirse a esta aventura y a apropiarse del PianoMóvil. Todos nuestros esfuerzos buscan proponer un proyecto incluyente, transparente, y serio; cuyos gastos se detallan a continuación. El colectivo EUPHONIA tiene como objetivo traducir los recursos de nuestros donantes en acciones pertinentes y significativas para Colombia.




¿POR QUÉ Y PARA QUIÉN UN PIANOMÓVIL?





Colombia necesita propuestas que dinamicen sus ciudades, iniciativas que promuevan la apropiación del patrimonio artístico y del espacio público como un derecho y una efectiva herramienta de construcción de equidad.
La Unidad Móvil de Conciertos puede ser una manera de “llegar” a los barrios y pueblos marginales, invitándolos a redescubrir y a imaginar de otro modo los espacios públicos de su localidad. También puede ser un modo de crear escenarios de encuentro entre personas con intereses, actividades y niveles de ingresos distintos, propiciando la convivencia y el deseo de compartir.
El PianoMóvil no es un medio de entretenimiento o de producción de sonidos: es un ministerio artístico y social que entiende la música como “el arte de entregar sonidos con generosidad”; la música como una invitación afectuosa a la excelencia.



Un colectivo comprometido
Los miembros de EUPHONIA se reúnen por la convicción de que el arte tiene la capacidad de transmitir un mensaje creativo, transformador y socialmente constructivo.
La asociación, que funciona gracias a donaciones y voluntarios, fue creada en 2014 por iniciativa de Diego Franco, pianista colombiano residente en Francia desde hace 6 años, y se compone de jóvenes parisinos y colombianos con profesiones diversas. 

Nuestra misión
A través la divulgación de la práctica musical:


Inspirar a los niños, a los jóvenes y a los más vulnerables a ser conscientes de su propia importancia y a esforzarse por desarrollar su potencial a pesar de un contexto adverso.

Informar y sensibilizar al público general y a los actores privados y públicos pertinentes acerca de problemáticas culturales y sociales, incitándolos a embarcarse en la búsqueda de soluciones.



Visión


Proponer y respaldar proyectos artísticos con vocación social para ofrecer a niños, jóvenes y poblaciones aisladas, experiencias enriquecedoras en el plano cultural.

En un contexto de conflicto, tejer vínculos entre poblaciones alejadas por su ideología, por su situación socioeconómica o por su condición (campesinos, indígenas, citadinos…) gracias a una temática neutra, noble y común a todos: la práctica musical.

Consolidar un equipo, una red y un conjunto de análisis y de experiencias con el fin de proponer soluciones pertinentes y de influenciar la toma de decisiones por parte de actores oficiales y particulares.


Al focalizarse en el caso particular de Colombia, EUPHONIA aspira a desarrollar un mensaje de valor universal.

¿EN QUÉ CONSISTE LA GIRA DEL PIANOMÓVIL ? - objetivo 2017

La gira del PianoMóvil es un proyecto ambicioso, consiste
en poner a rodar por las carreteras de Colombia un piano de cola en un camión modificado, que se transforma en un
verdadero escenario. 
Esta unidad móvil estará dotada de un equipo de audio y video que permitirá la
realización de un documental y tendrá la capacidad de
proponer giras anuales. También interesantes viajes de exploración del territorio, de
encuentros emotivos, de conocimiento de músicas y músicos locales, de diálogos
entre tradiciones diferentes… y 2.547 kilómetros de música!
Para conocer la hoja de vida de Diego Franco, haga clic aquí.





Descubra el blog personal de Diego aquí.


Descubra más sobre el proyecto en: www.pianomovil.com

story:
Resumen

 

Hola a todos!!! 

Mi nombre es Fernando Madera, y me estoy dirigiendo a ustedes porque la vida me ha dado la oportunidad de llevar mi música a otro nivel y necesito una mano de parte mis amigos, familiares y seguidores.

Soy cantautor natural de Manatí, Puerto Rico, con sobre 10 años de carrera en la música, y soy agradecido porque no han pasado en vano. En el 2012 tuve el acierto de lanzar mi primer disco, y ahora, 4 años más maduro, me encuentro dando los ajustes finales a lo que va a ser mi segunda producción, que lleva por nombre “Una Perspectiva Azul.” 

Este proyecto es el resultado de varios cambios y vivencias que me han ayudado a crecer mi arte, y consecuentemente mi alegría. Con el apoyo, el cariño, y el talento de varios amigos y colegas músicos, los 10 temas con los que cuenta esta producción encontraron su sonido, que se mueve por entre las texturas sonoras del blues, el jazz, el funk y el bolero.

El disco ya está arreglado y grabado. Ahora me preparo para la próxima etapa, en donde los temas serán mezclados por el reconocido Ingeniero y Productor Fransico “Kiko” Hurtado, y a ser masterizado por el Ingeniero Néstor Salomón, para finalmente imprimir las copias y hacerlo accesible a ustedes. 

Lo que necesito es un voto de confianza de mi gente, que crean en las posibilidades de este proyecto, y que cada uno aporte un poco, ya sea con tan solo difundir este mensaje, para ver este sueño realizado.

 
 
 

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

 

 Para lograr costear la culminación de este proyecto hemos establecido una meta flexible de $6,000 que serán utilizados de la siguiente manera:

  • $2,000 en gastos de mezcla a manos y oídos del ingeniero Francisco "Kiko" Hurtado ($200 c/tema x 10 temas del disco = $2,000).
  • $1,000 en gastos de masterización a manos y oídos del ingeniero Néstor Salomón.
  • $1,800 en gastos de impresión y distribución de copias del disco.
  • $700 en gastos de producción y distribución de intercambios de la campaña(posters, discos, eventos exclusivos y más).
  • $500 para lanzamiento y promoción en los medios. 
De no lograr alcanzar la meta los fondos serán utilizados en el orden en que fueron presentados, según den abasto.
Con su aportación estaremos ofreciendo uno de los siguientes intercambios:
  • $5 - Agradecimiento en la página por tu energía positiva!!!
  • $10- Descarga del disco antes del lanzamiento y el agradecimiento por tus buenas vibras!!!
  • $25-Puedes llevarte un afiche conmemorativo de la campaña firmado!!! Además obtienes la descarga del disco antes del lanzamiento!!!  
  • $40-Recibes la copia física del disco firmada, y la descarga digital del primer disco.
  • $60-Madera te prepara un video personalizado de tu tema favorito, original o de sus "covers"!!! Además la copia física del disco firmada, y la descarga digital del primer disco
  • $75-Exclusivo!!! Puedes tener una copia física de un disco Edición Limitada a 50 En Vivo Desde el Estudio de Madera!!! Además la copia física del disco firmada, y la descarga digital del primer disco.
  • $100-Evento exclusivo en la casa de Fernando Madera!!! Wow!!! Una noche de música íntima en casa del artista, con un afiche conmemorativo de la noche firmado por toda la banda y la copia física del disco firmada, además de la descarga digital antes del lanzamiento!!!
  • $500-Madera te prepara una presentación acústica en la sala de tu casa para ti y tus invitados, además de 4 copias firmadas del disco, 4 afiches conmemorativos firmados por la banda de la noche y la descarga digital pre-lanzamiento!!!
  • $1,000-Madera presenta su perspectiva en tu lugar de preferencia con su banda completa, además de 4 copias firmadas del disco, 4 afiches conmemorativos firmados por la banda de la noche y la descarga digital pre-lanzamiento!!!
Ninguna aportación es pequeña :) 
 

El impacto

 
    Tu aportación es tan solo el comienzo de esta visión. Contando con el apoyo de músicos respetados esta propuesta promete una entrega de sinceridad a través de la música que rompe con los esquemas de la canción de autor en Puerto Rico.
 
 
 

Riesgos y desafíos

 

    Siempre se enfrentan obstáculos cuando se trata de recaudar fondos para construir futuros con nuestros proyectos, pero los que nos destaca es el deseo genuino de generar movimiento, y través de éste el cambio necesario para cumplir metas.
 
 
 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

 

Sabemos que no todos cuentan con los recursos monetarios para apoyar esta campaña, pero con tan solo compartir este enlace con sus amigos y contactos puedes ayudar a llevar este proyecto a los oídos de muchos más. 

Estamos agradecidos por su solidaridad!

Abrazo Sonao'!

story:
Dear friends & supporters,

I have created this campaign to help fund the creation of my new album, Solar. Following on from my previous album, ‘Find Your Love’ released in 2017, Solar is a development of this intimate but epic sound. This is achieved by combining a small orchestral string section with expressionistic electric guitar, as well as drums and percussion.

The money from this campaign will be used to pay for the recording of the string sections. This is split into two sessions; one session of fourteen players (eight violins, three violas, three cellos) and another session with a string quartet (two violins, a viola and a cello). The money will go towards paying for studio time, a recording engineer, and to pay the players themselves. The players who I intend to work with on this album are world class, each bringing their immense expertise and experience to help me create the inspirational sounds on Solar.

Working with a classical string sections is a very important part of my compositional style. I have been composing with strings, guitars and percussion for almost twenty years. I find the sound to be dramatic, cinematic and emotive, as well as being sincere and serious. As a guitar player I have a natural affinity to stringed instruments. They provide a sound which is evocative of space and time, giving my compositions scope and latitude, but never losing sight of the human scale.

Solar, like my previous albums which feature a string section and my distinctive guitar sound, will slowly unfold with sweeping, uplifting melodies and textures. I am very happy to be working on it, and I am looking forward to sharing it with you all.

The album will be released in the first half of 2020, with a launch concert in Melbourne to follow.

Rewards for supporters include:

Every donation will receive a download of a high quality digital audio file of 'Solar', the title track.

Every donation over $35 will receive a high quality digital audio file of the completed album.

Every donation over $55 will receive a limited edition signed cd plus a high quality digital audio file of the completed album. 

All contributions, big or small, are very much appreciated. If you're unable to contribute, please share my campaign with others who can. 

Thank you all very much for your continuing support,

Cam Butler

(Melbourne, October 2019)

http://cambutler.bandcamp.com

story:
Who am I?

I’m Amy Dabalos, also known as Amy D. I’m a jazz/soul/R&B singer and songwriter from San Jose, California. I fell in love with jazz music at age 11, and while I’ve explored other styles- classical, musical theater, and pop, jazz music has always been a key source of inspiration; my happy place. THIS is a campaign build to support the production and release of my first, all original, full-length album!

The Album- Why now?

This project is dedicated to everyone who’s ever asked- “Do you have an album?” or “When is your album coming out?” First, thank you for your patience!

It’s taken years for me to write and fine-tune these songs, develop my sound, and choose a route for producing this album. It has taken a VILLAGE. Your encouragement has fueled my fire and has kept me connected my purpose- to share my voice and connect with listeners/audiences near and far! Releasing this album will be a HUGE step in the process of expanding my reach as an artist.

Your Support Matters

Your contribution will fund:

  • Recording and producing the remaining tracks
  • Mixing and mastering the album
  • Mass duplication of CDs
  • Mass distribution of the album online (iTunes, Amazon, etc.)
  • Album artwork/packaging
  • Marketing and promotion 

Perks!

Please take a look at the perks! There are 7 Tiers with a wide variety of offerings to choose from. You can also click "Back It" and choose an amount outside of the tier system. 

Risks & Challenges

As I mentioned, the music industry in 2018 and beyond is BANANAS. Releasing an album is an act of courage, because the way music is distributed and consumed is ever-shifting. However, I am committed to doing all that I can to gather the proper resources and professionals to support the successful completion and promotion of this project.

Can’t contribute financially right now?

No problem! There are a bunch of other ways you can help. You can share the link to the campaign on social media, PLUS you can share my music with your family and friends. 

More about Amy: 

Visit http://amydabalos.com to keep in touch and to stay updated on upcoming performances! 

xo Amy D. 

 

Credits: 

Video: Nino Fernandez

Photos: Karen Santos 

Photos styled by: Jillian Knox

HMUA: Lindsay Dabalos

May/June 2018

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Nathaniel Earl -- composer, writer, producer, and performer living in Austin, TX. I write music for film and video games, I've been involved in a few bands here in Austin as well -- Manican Dream, The Minutes and the Miles, and The Storms.

I've been compiling music for a solo release for a few years, and I'm really excited to share with you the debut release from this catalogue. "Imaginary Rabbit" is a 2 song EP created specifically for a 7 inch vinyl release.

I asked Jeff Bye to help produce this record. The production on this album is something I can't even begin to describe. It's chaos, it's serenity....intimate and vibrant. It sounds as if the music has given birth a billion musical microbes that move in unison and harmony. Take a listen to side B of the EP, "Bulletproof".

https://nathanielearl.bandcamp.com/album/imaginary-rabbit

This will me my first release as a solo artist, and as such, I am throwing a party to celebrate. I will be playing a 1 hour set of music, including the music from the Imaginary Rabbit EP, and Damase will follow my performance with a set of plush dance music. We will have a lush lighting design filling the space, as well as a powerful sound system. There will be ample adult beverages (all included in the price of admission). The show will be held at Aviator Nation --- 1325 S Congress Ave, Austin, TX 78704.

What we are raising money for

I'm raising money for:

  •  vinyl printing costs
  • lighting deign for the show
  • sound design for the show
  • beverage acquisition for the show
  • the time I've invested in the creation of this music, and in the production of this show

 

What you get for investing

There are a few different items available for you. I have packaged a few of them together at discounted prices. The more you invest, the more you get for your money!

  1. Imaginary Rabbit EP Digital Download. You get the 2-track EP in a 24bit WAV format.
  2. Imaginary Rabbit EP Vinyl. You get a hand-pressed, limited run copy of the 7 inch vinyl. There are only 200 copies in the world,
  3. Ticket to the EP release show in Austin TX on February 22nd, 2019. This ticket includes unlimited free adult beverages provided by local Austin breweries and distilleries.
  4. Ticket + Download. You receive a ticket to the release show in Austin, TX on February 22nd, 2019 (which includes free adult beverages), as well as a digital download of the EP.
  5. Ticket + Vinyl. You receive a ticket to the release show in Austin, TX on February 22nd, 2019 (which includes free adult beverages), as well as a copy of the hand-pressed, limited run Imaginary Rabbit vinyl.
  6. Exclusive performance. You receive an exclusive performance in your home or for your event.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't feel like financial investment is the thing for you, I would love it if you would share this campaign with anyone you know who might be interested. A facebook/instagram/twitter/email/whatever share is overwhelmingly appreciated. You sharing gives the campaign a much broader audience, and it honestly makes a big difference in the potential success of the campaign.

 

In conclusion

I have invested a good deal of money and time into the creation of this music. I have had a lot of contributors along the way as well -- album production from Jeff Bye, original, hand-painted album cover by Marcel Kimble,  photography by Robert Hull/Taylor Catherine, graphic design by Christine Carlin, and so many supportive and inspirational friends along the way. I have made music my life, and it's not always fun or easy. I work full-time, and then I begin my real work. I am giving music a serious push this year in an attempt to create a situation where I can sustainably live by pursuing my passion. The greatest thing a person has to offer the world is to do what they do best, and to love one another in doing so. I would be humbled and honored for your investment into this passion.

I've been compiling music for a solo release for a few years, and I'm really excited to share with you the debut release from this catalogue. "Imaginary Rabbit" is a 2 song EP created specifically for a 7 inch vinyl release.
I asked Jeff Bye to help produce this record. The production on this album is something I can't even begin to describe. It's chaos, it's serenity....intimate and vibrant. It sounds as if the music has given birth a billion musical microbes that move in unison and harmony. Take a listen to side B of the EP, "Bulletproof".
https://nathanielearl.bandcamp.com/album/imaginary-rabbit
This will me my first release as a solo artist, and as such, I am throwing a party to celebrate. I will be playing a 1 hour set of music, including the music from the Imaginary Rabbit EP, and Damase will follow my performance with a set of plush dance music. We will have a lush lighting design filling the space, as well as a powerful sound system. There will be ample adult beverages (all included in the price of admission). The show will be held at Aviator Nation --- 1325 S Congress Ave, Austin, TX 78704.

What we are raising money for
I'm raising money for:

 vinyl printing costs
lighting deign for the show
sound design for the show
beverage acquisition for the show
the time I've invested in the creation of this music, and in the production of this show

 

What you get for investing
There are a few different items available for you. I have packaged a few of them together at discounted prices. The more you invest, the more you get for your money!


Imaginary Rabbit EP Digital Download. You get the 2-track EP in a 24bit WAV format.

Imaginary Rabbit EP Vinyl. You get a hand-pressed, limited run copy of the 7 inch vinyl. There are only 200 copies in the world,

Ticket to the EP release show in Austin TX on February 22nd, 2019. This ticket includes unlimited free adult beverages provided by local Austin breweries and distilleries.

Ticket + Download. You receive a ticket to the release show in Austin, TX on February 22nd, 2019 (which includes free adult beverages), as well as a digital download of the EP.

Ticket + Vinyl. You receive a ticket to the release show in Austin, TX on February 22nd, 2019 (which includes free adult beverages), as well as a copy of the hand-pressed, limited run Imaginary Rabbit vinyl.

Exclusive performance. You receive an exclusive performance in your home or for your event.

 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you don't feel like financial investment is the thing for you, I would love it if you would share this campaign with anyone you know who might be interested. A facebook/instagram/twitter/email/whatever share is overwhelmingly appreciated. You sharing gives the campaign a much broader audience, and it honestly makes a big difference in the potential success of the campaign.
 
In conclusion
I have invested a good deal of money and time into the creation of this music. I have had a lot of contributors along the way as well -- album production from Jeff Bye, original, hand-painted album cover by Marcel Kimble,  photography by Robert Hull/Taylor Catherine, graphic design by Christine Carlin, and so many supportive and inspirational friends along the way. I have made music my life, and it's not always fun or easy. I work full-time, and then I begin my real work. I am giving music a serious push this year in an attempt to create a situation where I can sustainably live by pursuing my passion. The greatest thing a person has to offer the world is to do what they do best, and to love one another in doing so. I would be humbled and honored for your investment into this passion.

story:
Mais qui sommes-nous?

Qu'ont en commun une violoneuse-gigueuse à la double identité Drummondvilloise-Joliettaine, un joueur de bouzouki-tapeux de pieds grano-rocker aux lunettes rondes ainsi qu'une violoncelliste de haut calibre qui un jour se serait égarée un peu trop longtemps dans un jam au Vices & Versa? Un amour passionnel - mais très sain - pour la musique traditionnelle du Québec.

Suite à la sortie de leur premier album en 2017, Élisabeth Moquin, Thierry Clouette et Élisabeth Giroux ont parcouru ensemble les routes québécoises et canadiennes tout en poursuivant la création de nouveaux arrangements du répertoire québécois et de leurs compositions originales.

Cette campagne de sociofinancement coïncide avec l'entrée en studio des trois musicien.nes. Votre précieuse participation nous permettra de mener à terme ce projet de longue haleine!

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

La troisième plus grande dépense d'un groupe de musique qui sillonne le continent pour diffuser sa musique (après l'essence ordinaire sans plomb et les restos de sortie d'aurotoute) est la production d'un nouvel album. Celle-ci comporte plusieurs étapes dont les frais peuvent être assumés, notamment, à travers la vente d'albums et des différentes contreparties que nous vous proposons. Vos contributions serviront à financer:

  • Les deux semaines que nous passerons au Studio du Chemin 4
  • Le travail des sympathiques et très compétents Marc Maziade et Mark Busic qui nous accompagneront tout au long du processus d'enregistrement et de mixage
  • Les invités surprises que vous retrouverez sur l'album
  • Le mastering
  • L'impression
  • Le visuel (photos, graphisme, matériel promo, etc.)
  • Le lancement prévu à l'automne 2019

Votre impact

Différents types de contreparties sont offerts en échange de votre participation au projet, selon vos envies et vos moyens. Toute contribution nous offre une immense aide et nous vous remercions d'avance de nous permettre d'accroître notre descendance discographique tout en favorisant le rayonnement de la scène musicale traditionnelle et indépendante.

Vous pouvez toujours encourager le projet de différentes manières en assistant à nos futurs concerts, en diffusant notre musique dans votre entourage et en partageant cette campagne de sociofinancement sur vos réseaux!

story:
WTSQ is more than a radio station. We are a hub for the talent and creativity in our community. We serve Charleston, West Virginia and the greater Kanawha Valley with independent music and community interest shows, curated and hosted by fifty passionate volunteers.

We've been on the air for almost 3 years. In that time, we've become embedded in the life of the Charleston area. Countless local musicians have played at the station. We regularly interview folks from local non-profits, creative groups, and businesses. You may have seen us at events like Live on the Levee and ArtWalk.

We are here because we love Charleston and want to make it the best place it can be.

Join Us.

From May 4  - 11 we want to raise $30,000. That money goes straight to our operating costs - things like rent, utilities, and web hosting. Microphones, computers, and cables. Funds from this year's drive will continue to support amazing programming in the Kanawha Valley

What do you get when you give?

The biggest satisfaction comes when you are part of something special. WTSQ exists for the community, and it is the community that provides 100% or our support. We don't sell advertising, and we don't get money from federal or state government sources.

This year we are offering many different perks depending on your donation level. As always, we have our fund drive limited edition T Shirt at the $40 level, but there are many other perks that we are able to offer thanks to the support of our local business community.

story:
HI EVERYONE!

We are the KAIA string quartet, a Chicago based ensemble committed to promoting the music of Latin-America. We have been together since 2010 and we are really excited about continuing our growth by bringing to light music from Latino composers that the world would love to hear! 

This campaign is to raise funds to produce a video and the last stages of an audio recording titled Sureño. The album will contain Astor Piazzolla’s 4 Estaciones Porteñas, arranged by Gerardo Moreira, and a beautiful and not so known work by José  Bragato, Tres piezas para cuarteto de cuerdas basadas en ritmos de tango. This music portrays Buenos Aires from all its angles, from two musicians that definitely made an impact in the musical life of Argentina and South America. SERIOUSLY GOOD :-) 

You might ask yourself: why this recording? There is a beautiful connection between these composers. Plus, these pieces and arrangements have not been professionally recorded yet, and we want KAIA to be the first.  The Piazzolla seasons are well known but these arrangements were especially made for us and they have been a big staple of our quartet in concerts. Needless to say, Bragato’s music is simply amazing and we want his pieces to come to life! That’s when the album and video come to place!!!!!!! We have been wanting to do this for a while and starts are aligning for us…. The time is now :-)

What We Need & What You Get

Ok folks, this is where the money will go: 

$1000 video production
$800 mastering 
$1350 mixing 
$1350 cd manufacturing, UPC code purchase (500 cds)
_________
$4500 TOTAL

Let us tell you about our perks! 
We highly value your generosity and willingness to be part of this exciting project! As a thanks you, we are offering a series of perks that include a copy of the finished product “Sureño”, mugs and tote bags with the art work of the album, educational presentations for children, a private concert and concert tickets with dinner from our 2018-19 season! 

The Impact

As members of the KAIA String Quartet, we are very proud of all the work we have been doing. We all graduated from music school with set expectations  on what our professional lives were going to be. However, things were very different in the “real world”. We all came together and realized,  this was a journey, although gratifying,  we did not expect to have. We had to learn sooooooooooo many things on the go and quite honestly, confront multiple obstacles that made things harder. Even though, we know these difficulties will keep coming, we are strong and confident that we work great as a team, and we trust one another. We truly love what we do and we believe it makes an important contribution to the arts and society.
By making this project happen, you will be helping our quartet take one more step to becoming stronger. KAIA will continue the efforts to make this music known and accessible to anyone! 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know some people can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:-)

Help us  get the word out and make some noise about our campaign! You can use the Indiegogo share tools, call friends and anything you can think of!

Thank you very much for helping us make this possible!!!!!!!

Love,
    
KAIA String Quartet

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Making a new EP and starting a company in Medellín... 

My name is Rob LaFond I am a musician, photographer and entrepreneur. I am working on my 3rd EP of a trilogy series I started in Los Angeles in 2014 with "When We Fly." I released the 2nd EP "High and Low" last year with the single "She's Dangerous." The 3rd EP will complete the sentence "When we fly and low..." and finish this series. I would like to record this one hear in Colombia. 

After some soul searching and discovery I left my home of 11 years in Los Angeles and went for a trip to South America. It led me to the city of eternal spring, Medellín. Here I have made lots of friends and business contacts. I have been continuing my music career and have done lots interesting collaborations. Recently I started my own business called LaFond Medellin. It is centered around a logo that I created with the city name and has been growing steadily. My clothing and apparel is available in 5 locations and we just opened our central location inside my friends super cool coffee shop, Café Revolución 2 located in the beautiful neighborhood of Laureles. 

This 3rd edition of my music series is sure to be special and I'm exited to share my experience and story with you all once more in the form of music. These are mostly songs I wrote in Los Angeles and I would like to record them with some of my friends here in Colombia with some possible LA collaborations. These will be mostly acoustic songs with some layered drums and bass that we will do in the studio. It's really important for me to finish this series and share these songs with you as I love to stay creative and express myself through  music, but I don't see myself as a musician alone. I am a creative and I use many different means to express myself. The other ways I do that are through photography, and design with my company LaFond Medellin which I will tell you about next.

So yes it's official I opened a company in Medellín and I have a visa to work here for 3 years. I started a clothing and apparel brand that's centered around one main Medellin design right now that is getting popular around the city and I would like to expand that to new designs and do work based on photography as well. Right now our main item is t-shirts and tank tops, but I am branching out to other merchandise too. We have coffee mugs and I just made the first prototype for an umbrella. I would like to expand to posters, prints, notebooks, scarfs, and magnets. The money you help me raise for this campaign will help me do that. I would also like to build an online store and start shipping internationally. The other goal that I have this year is to get the equipment I need to take the production in house and start printing our own shirts and products. Right now we are working with a manufacturer. I would like for people to be able to come into the store and have me take a photograph or create and graphic and print it for them right there. 

If I go over my goal, which I would like to do. I will use it to purchase that equipment and I would also like to record a live blues album with video (production is not that expensive here:). If you would like to see that happen please keep giving to the campaign. I have the studio, musicians, and songs ready to go. 

Right now I am really happy to be in such a great place with my business and to get to work with so many great people in such a great location, but I would also like to keep taking it to the next level. You can help me do that. There are a lot of people outside of Medellín who are interested in these products and this will be the first step in reaching that audience. 

If you donate to this campaign it will help me a great deal in reaching these goals. Taking this creative path, moving to a foreign country and starting my own business is definitely one of the most challenging things I've ever done, but it has been the most rewarding. To see people wearing the clothes around town, enjoying the designs, taking photos, and representing this great city here and beyond is a joy. Help me keep this project going. 

Thank you so much for being a part of this,

Yours truly, 

Rob

What We Need & What You Get

I set my goal low so it would be reachable at $2,500, but I would really like to reach $3,500-4k. My goal is to record my next EP and finish the series, but I have even more creative ideas so I don't want it to be limited to that. If I go beyond my goal I will record a live blues album with videos that you will be able to watch of each of the songs. I have special plans for that and beyond that I would start purchasing the equipment that I need to start printing the t-shirts in house which is what I would really like to do. I would like for people to be able to come into the shop and have me take a photo and put it on shirt for them right there or make custom one-off Medellín shirts. 

What you will get is cool well designed t-shirts and products made directly in Medellín, Colombia. I will be able to expand online and start printing postcards, prints, custom shirts, the awesome styles I already have and to do the new merchandise like umbrellas, mugs, and notebooks.

The Impact

It means so much to have my community support me. You will make it possible for my business to grow and you will inspire me and help get involved with new ideas. Medellín is great city and I would love to see you all supporting it and representing it in a positive way. There is a lot of beautiful people and culture and I want you to see and be a part of it. If you support me I promise to deliver and make you proud with my best work. 

Risks & Challenges

I've taken a lot of risks and challenges starting my own business in a foreign country. I was afraid that it wouldn't work and that people wound't be interested, but I see people coming in and buying the merchandise and t-shirts then taking photos of how much they love it, it inspires me. You inspire me. Also, there is the fear I could fail and that you guys won't support me and you'll think I'm stupid, but I would like to prove that negative voice in my head wrong and help see this vision though. Why? Because it's awesome and we should all work on things we are truly passionate about. 

Other Ways You Can Help

No donation is too small! Any small donation or even just sharing it with your friends and family is a huge help.

And that's all there is to it.

The Impact
It means so much to have my community support me. You will make it possible for my business to grow and you will inspire me and help get involved with new ideas. Medellín is great city and I would love to see you all supporting it and representing it in a positive way. There is a lot of beautiful people and culture and I want you to see and be a part of it. If you support me I promise to deliver and make you proud with my best work. 

Risks & Challenges
I've taken a lot of risks and challenges starting my own business in a foreign country. I was afraid that it wouldn't work and that people wound't be interested, but I see people coming in and buying the merchandise and t-shirts then taking photos of how much they love it, it inspires me. You inspire me. Also, there is the fear I could fail and that you guys won't support me and you'll think I'm stupid, but I would like to prove that negative voice in my head wrong and help see this vision though. Why? Because it's awesome and we should all work on things we are truly passionate about. 

Other Ways You Can Help
No donation is too small! Any small donation or even just sharing it with your friends and family is a huge help.
And that's all there is to it.

story:
GWEN MATTHEWS
International Recording Artist

From Stevie Wonder, Kenny Rogers, members of Earth Wind and Fire and numerous others, Gwen has recorded with the best. She has performed at the famed “Montreal Jazz Festival” in Canada and the “Fleur de France Festival” in Paris, and, was featured in festivals and concerts throughout Europe with The Denis Colin Trio.  She also toured Russia with “Women Who Cook” and traveled internationally with the Rupert’s Orchestra.  Her career started by singing jingles in Minneapolis, later, in Los Angeles and New York. You can hear her golden voice on many National and local spots for Northwest Airlines, General Mills, Whirlpool and many others. Gwen recorded songs with the Emmy Award winning group “The Music Workshop For Kids” and traveled world-wide for such corporate clients as: Bandag, All-State Insurance, Johnson and Johnson, and the Radisson Hotel Chain.

Her move to Los Angeles lasted eleven years where she worked for many musical giants from nationally acclaimed producers to hit-making songwriters, who sought her for studio background and stage performances. Gwen has recorded with Stevie Wonder, the late Skip Scarborough, Frank Wilson, Phillip Bailey of EWF and Larry Dunn, also of EWF, Lamont Dozier, Susanne DePasse of Motown and Ronnie Laws & Norman Connors. 

This is Gwen Matthews first CD project were she is Executive Producer.  She has teamed up with Savannah Street Music to create a radio friendly pop/ R&B/ neo-soul record.  If there ever was a record to deliver a main stream 'hit’ for Gwen Matthews then, this is it.

The goal is to raise $15,000 to fund all that goes into producing, manufacturing and marketing a record.  Using the Savannah Street Music developed Natural Ambience Acoustics, Gwen Matthews’ record will have that warm analog tone reminiscent of records from back in the day.  The recordings will be available as a digital download, CD and on vinyl.

Thank you so much for your support and contributions.

story:
Hello Family, Friends and Music Lovers!

Helen here from the “Looping Glass” Team.

Thank you so much for taking the time to visit the Indiegogo page for “Lost in the Looping Glass” hits the road!  Read on for more information about the show, the exciting new tour and how you can be a part of the Looping Glass journey…


What is “Lost in the Looping Glass”?

“Lost in the Looping Glass” is an original show for violin and live electronic looping. Moving from one loop pedal to the next and back again I create, explore and fall head first into a multitude of musical worlds.  All of a sudden, the violin becomes so much more than it first appears; a storm at sea, a walk through the forest, the far reaches of the audiences’ imaginations!


Premiering at Melbourne Fringe Festival 2015 to fantastic reviews, “Lost in the Looping Glass” is heading on tour to share its loopy love with the music enthusiasts of Western Australia and New Zealand.  And we want YOU to be involved! 


Why a crowdfunding campaign?

We are really excited to announce that early in 2016 “Lost in the Looping Glass” will feature at FRINGE WORLD Festival in Perth and the NZ Fringe Festival in Wellington.  Registration is complete, the venues are booked, there’s no turning back now!  

The show had a fantastic premiere season at the 2015 Melbourne Fringe Festival to great reviews.  But what was more important to us was the response from the audience.  People really connected to the show and the music gave them the opportunity to leave the real world at the door and get lost in their own worlds for a while. This response was all we needed to make the decision to take the show on tour to share it with many more people.

This campaign is here to help get me to the festivals and then to make sure we get the word out to as many people as possible to fill those venues.  Your contributions will particularly make all the difference to our marketing capabilities, which is so important when touring a show.  When you are performing in places where your networks are smaller, every dollar can make a difference to reaching your audience and letting them know about the show.

So have a look at the perks on the right hand side of the page, to see how you can help this show take the next step in its journey and to support live, independent and original music thrive.


What will your donations go towards?

Touring a show has many costs – travel, accommodation, venue hire, technician fees, insurance and licences, marketing; the list goes on! 

Funds from this campaign will cover my flights to Perth and New Zealand, a roof over my head whilst I’m there and go towards the marketing for each festival.  

We’ve already got everything else covered with the profits from Melbourne Fringe Festival (hooray!)


What do you get?

We’ve put together a great bunch of perks and rewards for you to choose from and there’s something for every budget.  We wanted to make sure all the perks were personal and so each one will be written, packaged and sent direct from us, to you.  

From a heartfelt Thank You email, to a series of “on tour” postcards (a nice surprise in the post is always a win isn’t it?!) or even a violin and loop piece written especially for you, we hope you will find something you like.

And we know that not everyone can contribute – that’s OK! If you’re still keen to get involved then consider sharing this campaign with your friends and family and help us make a ton of noise about the show.  Indiegogo have kindly created some share tools to make it super easy for you!


Thank You!

For those of you that are interested there’s some more information about the “Looping Glass” team and the challenges this project faces below.  But before that we just wanted to say a huge thank you for visiting this campaign and your interest and support for the project! 

So enjoy the rewards, become part of the “Looping Glass” family and THANK YOU!

Helen and the “Looping Glass” Team. xo


Challenges to the project

Touring isn’t easy.  You’re in an unfamiliar city, with a much smaller support network and the costs are higher.  But(!) with careful planning and a project that you’re passionate about, there is no reason these challenges can’t be overcome.

Fortunately we have two key elements up our sleeves to help us…

  1. Experience: We successfully took the original “Through the Looping Glass” on tour to Perth and Adelaide at the start of 2015 to great reception.  Perth loved it so much they nominated us for an award! 
  2. On the ground support: We have been accepted at fantastic venues in both Perth and NZ.  Four5Nine Bar in Perth presents live music all week and has a fantastic music-loving fan base.  BATS Theatre in NZ is THE place to be at the Fringe and has years and years of Fringe Festival experience.  The support, advice and reputation of both venues are a great benefit to the project.

Who’s involved?

There’s a few key players involved in “Lost in the Looping Glass”.

Helen Bower: Producer/Performer

I’m a violinist from the UK, currently living and working in Melbourne, Australia.  I started creating and presenting collaborative projects whilst studying in London and am passionate about presenting new and original work to the wider community.  

Since moving to Australia I have focused on creating work for violin and live electronic looping. New works have been commissioned, learned, developed and performed for wonderful audiences.  “Lost in the Looping Glass” is the result of a fantastic collaboration with Melbourne composer Charles MacInnes and a development of the successful 2015 show “Through the Looping Glass” which features new compositions from Australian and UK composers.

Charles MacInnes: Producer/Sound Design

Melbourne based composer Charles MacInnes combines musical techniques and sounds that bridge the orchestral to the electronic, the scripted to the spontaneous. He has composed music for Melbourne Chamber Choir, Melbourne Symphony Orchestra, violinist Sarah Curro, pianist Michael Kieran Harvey, Australian Brass Quintet, Syzygy Ensemble and Plexus Collective as well as working as a sound designer for animators, short film makers and installation artists. His particular interest in looping is to find imaginative ways of combining layers and multiple parts—how can this give us something in a performance that would otherwise not be possible? 

Myself and Charles began collaborating when he wrote the beautiful ‘Wall Fragments’ for “Through the Looping Glass” and it has been a lot of fun developing “Lost in the Looping Glass” together over the last year. A huge quantity of tea has been consumed :)

Gina Somfleth: Sound engineer/Video editor

The ever cheerful Gina has been on board right from the start, as sound engineer for both “Looping Glass” shows.  She has also recorded the shows and edited all the footage into the promo videos, sound bites and this campaign video!  We absolutely love having her in the Looping Glass family and I can't thank her enough for all her talent and support!

Jen Pomphrey: Graphic Design

Also hailing from the UK is graphic designer Jen.  She is responsible for almost all of the wonderful artwork for both the “Looping Glass” shows and is 100% responsible for designing all the show posters and flyers.  She has also resized so many images for me I’ve lost count (Thank You Jen)! Her beautiful image for the Melbourne “Lost in the Looping Glass” artwork can be found in several of the rewards on your right.

story:
I've got the show, now help me go!

So, here it is, guys: I've been accepted to play a showcase at Canadian Music Week http://cmw.net which is a huge music industry symposium, and festival, full of amazing opportunities to meet and forge connections within the industry, and to share my music with people who might be able to help me out in the long run. 

The only problem is I was refused the travel grant I applied for (probably not good 'pop', or 'good looking' enough), and can't afford the flights/accomodation that will get me to my showcase gig, as well as to replenish my supply of music download cards to hand out to prospective fans.

That's where you come in! If you can help by donating a little to get me on my way, I would be forever grateful; I don't just play music, I teach it, I live it, and it is my passion... so I have to make the most of this chance. With some help from you, I can get there.

I wouldn't be anywhere if it wasn't for your support, the support of my fans, so mostly I just want to thank you for taking the time to even consider helping me out; you guys are simply the best. Better than all the rest. Better than anyone. Anyone I've ever met. Thank you Mrs Turner.

Anything past the funding goal will go towards my next album (I have tracks ready to go!) and if you donate, just email me and I'll hook you up with a free download of my current EP.

What I Need

  • Return flights to TO are currently about $640.
  • Excess baggage allowances in order to get my guitars and cajon there will be well over $100, more likely close to $200.
  • 200 download cards are $100 plus import tax because CDBaby sends them out of the US, its ends up being almost $150 (the Tax Man's taken all my dough).
  • I'm going to try and stay with someone to avoid paying accommodation costs, but if I have to, we're talking at least $30 a night for the four or five nights I will be there. And, you know... I'd rather not have to chain my guitar to myself for security whilst sleeping (but I will if I have to).

You could make it happen!

Your contribution is the only way I'm going to be able to make it to CMW (without maxing my credit card), just recently my car broke down and needed over $1300 of repair, my laptop needed to be replaced (and to run recording software, they don't come cheap), and to top it all off, I just got married so money is pretty tight.

  • Your donation could give me the chance to break into a new scene, get my music in front of industry cats who might dig it, and learn from the pros at the countless seminars.
  • I've been getting really good feedback about my music, and this might just be the traction I need to get my music out to a larger audience.
  • Boy does a CMW showcase look good on a performance CV!

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't donate, doesn't mean you can't help, and if you can donate... well then this would make you extra cool!

  • Spread the word around and let people know... tell them I'm cool (I'm not, but they don't know that)
  • Share on all your social media, and stuff that cool people use.

Thanks guys!!

story:
UPDATE: **WE MADE IT!! New goal announced!!**

Thank you so much to everyone who helped us cross the finish line! We've got FOUR MORE DAYS until this campaign is over, and we're gonna keep it rolling. The reason is simple: as it stands, our budget is meager and heavily reliant on favors, and whatever we raise between now and next Tuesday will help to offset the favors and increase the overall production value. It's the icing on the cake! And because we dream big and waste no time, we're aiming to DOUBLE OUR GOAL!! So keep telling your friends, and let's keep this thing moving! And again, THANK YOU ALL SO VERY MUCH!! -xoxo Belleville

Who are we?

We are songwriters Kate Vargas, Carley Baer and Andrea Wittgens.  On our own, we are Outlaw Americana from New Mexico; Jazzy Folk from the Midwest; Cinematic Pop from Nova Scotia; but when we first came together, we uncovered something entirely different. There was a collaborative chemistry between the three of us that inspired exploration beyond our individual sounds.  

We call ourselves Belleville.  Belleville is young but dreams big and wastes no time; WE ARE SHOOTING A MUSIC VIDEO IN NEW YORK CITY IN TWO WEEKS!

Why are we doing this?

Last month, at a week-long event called "Love On Holiday" which brings 40+ songwriters to the Holiday Music Motel in Sturgeon Bay, WI, we gathered together for an impromptu speed-writing session, and a song called “Superpowers” was born. Inspired by 12-yr-old Eleanor Knippel’s painting, it's our ode to girl power.  A sing-it-with-me sonic fist pump in soul song form.  

We had a blast writing together, but when we performed the song live, it was the crowd’s reaction that gave us the momentum to pursue it further. Currently, the only place “Superpowers” exists is in audience members’ iPhones. We have a unique opportunity, right now, to rendezvous in New York City with most of the resources we need to bring this song to life in the form of a music video.


All the pieces are in place.  This project is being super-powered by some pretty amazing humans who are generously contributing their talents.

Who’s involved?

  • The creative minds at Skytown Entertainment are producing and directing.

  • The Jalopy Theatre, a female-run Brooklyn venue, has offered their beautiful space to us at a very generous rate.

  • Dan O “Danimal” Stoffels, fellow Holiday Music Motel alum & engineer extraordinaire, is flying into town to record and mix our audio track and film additional ‘Belleville-takes-Manhattan’ footage.  

  • We have professional hair and makeup artists on board.

We need to raise $1500 to cover space rental, camera equipment and transportation costs.

If you like what you hear, if you believe in the song as much as we do-- get involved by choosing a reward and/or helping to spread the word.

In gratitude,

Kate, Carley & Andrea (aka BELLEVILLE)

story:
The time has FINALLY come!

It's time. We started writing this album many years ago, but now, it is extremely close to being released, and we want to make it amazing!

The five of us have been rather busy over the last few years, but making this epic, intense, full-length metal album a reality is one of the most important goals in our lives. And now, you can be a part of it!

From our interview with NoiseCreep in 2009 - Conceptually, ‘The City’ is a brainy, thinking man’s album, as it deals with a futuristic theme, featuring residents of a post-apocalyptic settlement in North America circa 2020 AD. “Times have changed dramatically, and a sort of martial law is inflicted upon this New World Order,” Walker revealed. “The city itself is separated into districts, much like modern-day New York City. The difference is each borough has its own ownership of a certain part of the things that allow us to live. For example, District 2: Oxygenopolis. The residents of this district have released a gas into the air which makes it impossible to breathe without the antidote. Don’t pay District 2? You die. This is only a small sample of the struggles the settlers of this city endure. It is this pre-determined, modern-day apartheid that causes the city to erupt in anger, triggering an even worse disaster.”

Read More: A Different Breed of Killer Says Yes to Death Metal in Dolby 5.1 | http://noisecreep.com/a-different-breed-of-killer-says-yes-to-death-metal-in-dolby-5-1/?trackback=tsmclip

'The City' is a story centered around the leader of this post-apocalyptic wasteland, a mysterious, tyrannical megalomaniac (known only as "The Watcher"), and the seven people who try to stop them (referred to as "The Seven").  It is a 12 song adventure through several intense aural and visual landscapes. The 5.1 Surround experience will be unlike anything you have ever heard. 

 

What You Get

You'll get hot perks like High-Quality .wav downloads, autographed physical CD copies, or even your name in the credits! 



 
 
 

 

 

Cheers \m/,

ADBOK

story:
Our Bus, Our Home & Our Life

Hi!  We're St. Cinder, a band of vagabond musicians who have been lucky enough to make our way from the street corner to the stage to the studio and now are hoping to embark on our first fully booked tour through the Southwest.

Now after a national road trip following our first studio album, sharing our music from Seattle to Tuscon to New Orleans to Portland, Maine and back again, the cornerstone of our livelih&ood--our bus Betsy--is on her way to bus heaven.  That's why we need your help!

Here's the Breakdown

Well, we're broke down. And broke.  Luckily for us some of us are mechanically minded enough to have kept us rolling by the skin of our hats, but it seems those days are over.  With only a few weeks before our first planned show in Flagstaff (on Dec. 3rd!) we have to buy a bus, register and insure it, do a little skeleton carpentry to keep dogs and banjos and sleeping bags from sliding around, make the 24 hour drive, and drink enough coffee to actually play our Show!

Plan B is to take Betsy on her final stretch of road, and hope she breaks down for good right next to a bus we can afford.

Either way it's gonna be a bumpy road, but with your help we can keep our band off the side of the Road!

Now, what's in it for you?  As hobos, we don't have all too much to offer other than our music, but we have plenty of that!  To boost our campaign we'll be recording a new live album on the 19th at La Baggett, including brand new originals never-before-heard by the world wide web, as well as a healthy dose of our classic renditions of traditional roots tunes, never before released!

Also rewards include our first studio album, Vagabond Dreams, in an actual CD sleeve with its sweet new artwork by Yamana Soto--quite a step up from the lunch bag if you bought our album on the street!

On top of all that we have ransacked our bus and thrown in a couple goodies for the lucky few.  But who knows what other surprises are on the horizon!

  • Our goal is us aiming low. We could use a lot more than $5,450.00,  but we can also probably work with less. A well-running bus could easily cost that much, not to mention registration, insurance, potential break downs, and the eternal gas bill.  However, we're good at making do.  Can of beans, junk bus, same thing to us.  That said, after all these years on the road, we're crossing our fingers on this one.

The Impact (Boom!)

Listen, we're all homeless.  With a bus, we are, in our eyes, non-quite-homeless.  With just our wits and our music we've gone all the way around the country and brought the soul food of sound to thousands of smiling faces.  With a little boost, we plan to up our capabilities to reach a larger audience, and make our full time career more sustainable with our growing demand.

What Could Possibly Go Wrong?

Everyone knows the risks involved in buying a used vehicle.  And with lives on a shoestring, nothing is guaranteed.  However, you have our assurance that our one and all are dedicated to making this dream a reality.  A bus is far more than a vehicle to us.  It' a (literal) step up from our feet on the highway.  We couldn't think of a better (or another, really) way to spend this money in a million years or a million miles.

If we don't raise enough to get a new vehicle by the end of our 15 day campaign, we are going to gamble on taking Betsy out on the road and hoping through a continued campaign to find a new bus while on tour.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends!  Tell your neighbors!  Tell your dog and your doctor!

Like us on the Facebook, and share our campaign with your friends.  Especially your millionaire friends!

Send us some well wishes.  You guys keep us going.

In this case, literally.

story:
Short Summary


Everyone has a dream. At MSDB, we all share the same: to become one of the new banners of metal music worldwide.

  • We are 5 young guys from Italy. We've never had the opportunity to really do anything to be proud of during our lifes. But we would love this to change.
  • You can make this possible, all of you and us toghether. We love being musicians, we love music and there's nothing that makes us happier to see other people enjoy our music.

What We Need & What You Get


  • We are asking a total amount of 10.000 € that are going to be divided between the realization of our first EP (that will include from 5 to 7 tracks) and moving with upgraded equipment in a new studio.
  • Perks: we would love to give back everything we can. For some people could be nothing, but it's everything we have at the moment and everything is done by hand by us.
  • If we will not reach our entire goal depending on how many funds we will rise we will choose what to do. If they will be enough we will try to make the EP and leave aside the equipment.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute we understand, but that doesn't mean that if you wish, you can't help:

  • Share this campaign with all your friends and family to let the world know about our dream
  • If you don't want to share the campaign, you can share our facebook page and hit the like button, you can find it here: https://www.facebook.com/My-Sins-Dont-Bother-1393407627648158/?fref=ts
  • You can even share the video of our first single "The Void" - the track will be also on the future EP: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c1tr1mAHwf0 

Thank you for reading and for helping us!

story:
Vancouver-based musicians Mark McGregor (flute) and Michael Murray (organ) want to make a CD of J.S. Bach's sonatas for flute and keyboard! McGregor and Murray began collaborating in 2009, and quickly realized that the music of Bach was a common passion. Bach's flute sonatas are some of the most beautiful, complex and rewarding music in the flute's repertoire. This CD will be the first of two discs of the complete flute sonatas, focusing on the sonatas for flute and obligato keyboard: A major, b minor, E-flat major and g minor.

Money raised will pay for the recording technician, producer fees and editing. Anything raised above and beyond our $3000 goal will go towards the pressing of 1000 digipak CDs. Please support us!

story:
Our Story

Take every aesthetic of an American rock band: beautifully loud, amplified sound; energetic, audience-engaging performances; light and video backgrounds; continuous, memorized, brilliant music.  Cross conservatory-trained precision with a love for electronics, experimentalism and math-metal, and you have futureCities.  We are Anne Rainwater and Jude Traxler, piano and percussion, New York City.  Distilling each work to its most essential elements, futureCities makes art both adventurous and accessible.  Bring your friends.

We met while completing our Masters degree in Contemporary Performance at the Manhattan School of Music.  We've played in a wide variety of genres and venues, performing in concert halls, small studio spaces, horrible pubs, and even on a paint-covered piano in the streets of downtown Manhattan.  Enriching the public perception of live music, futureCities comprises their repertoire of unique works that are flexible for an individual retelling of the composer's message.

"futureCities presents experimental new music that rocks your face off. Jazz and rock influenced sounds with a classical twist, like a fine blended scotch."  - Anne Rainwater, 2008

The first hearing of any piece of music is special.  The experience and surprise can never be recreated.  futureCities believes that without any previous knowledge of the piece's composer, the listener approaches the music with a blank canvas ripe for creative interpretation.  To enhance this experience, we do not release programs prior to a show.  All repertoire details will be available via our website at www.futureCitiesmusic.com

We love what we do.  Thank you for listening.


Anne and Jude, futureCities



The Impact

futureCities has been invited down to Louisiana State University at the end of February 2011 as Artists in Residence for a week of concerts, masterclasses and private lessons!  We are so honored to be part of this academic institution.  We need one more JBL 2-way stage monitor to complete our gear setup and be on our way.  Thank you so much for your support as we go on our Southern tour!

story:
DRUMS

TRAVEL

NATURAL REVERB

HIP-HOP

SOUND INSTALLATION


-raw essentials-


I am a drummer, music producer, and student at Emerson College.

As a student in the BFA Program, I am in charge of an independent project.

My pursuit is about the sound of drums in a variety of spaces,

with the goal of capturing their sounds and

the acoustic reactions to where they’re placed.


I began this project to create a sample pack of my recorded drums,

but I collected much unpredicted footage along the way.

Acquiring this extra material has involved analog manipulation of previously recorded sounds,

and raw recordings of whatever is percussive or rhythmic.


So far, I have done fifteen official recording sessions in Boston, Philadelphia, and some locations in between.

There are pictures posted in the gallery of a few of the spaces and scenarios. For many of the sessions I was lucky enough to have hard-working sound engineers to work with.  Others I did alone.


The resulting sound library from these recordings is entitled

raw essentials.


I have been creating beats with the raw essentials since I started the recordings using Reaper and ProTools as my digital audio workstations.


Like the great producers that I look up to, I am always searching for the perfect sample - the loop, the foundation of the beat, listened to repeatedly, endlessly. Producers like J. Dilla, Showbiz, and Kutmasta Kurt are my inspirations, as well as electronic music such as Venetian Snares and Telefon Tel Aviv, and drummers like Terry Bozzio, Zach Hill, Steve Reid, Max Roach, and Brian Chippendale.



-PERCUSSIONVIRONMENTS-


- a sound installation which represents the music made from the raw essentials recordings.

- an homage to the hip-hop producer and their mission to find the perfect sample,

and create their own style simultaneously.

- a beat tape mixed for four speakers, played from a cassette


The person who experiences Percussionvironments will be placed in an situation where the inherent action is listening.


Speakers projecting the music will be enclosed by the drums that were played to acquire the sounds, so that the listener experiences what I have with the drums in a way that is only possible if entered.  


The beats will be interrupted by recorded footage of live drum kit playing presented with processing by way of re-amplification through guitar amplifiers and pedals.


My goal is to color the beat tape as a whole with the cohesive palette of sounds I’ve recorded so that it is a unique sonic experience any way it is played back.


When the tape stops, it must be rewound by the participating listener.



The Impact


WHAT IS THE NEW STANDARD IN HIP-HOP PRODUCTION?


This is my view of a new standard for producers. The goal is to sample only what I’ve documented in order to interpret and share where I’ve traveled with my drums. This is not only an embrace, but an exploration of a standard I set for myself and others.


It’s about renewing, revising, and modernizing musical traditions.


The recorded sounds themselves are studies on aural architecture. They let the listener sense the spatial attributes of wherever it is placed by way of spatiality, which is the experience of space by way of listening  (see further).

The music will be mixed to show the magnitude of the sounds that were created within the spaces I chose.


In that sense, the installation will show listeners how drums (and cymbals, and many objects) react to an acoustic arena. I want the audience to consider what it might be like if they were in these spaces and the room had a sonic reaction to their own voice.


How would that make them feel? What kind of voice can we get from ourselves when we purposely travel with our own voice in mind? Where do we hear the best voice we have?

What is our voice saying, and how are we hearing it?



Locations:

April 29th - May 16th:

Emerson College, Boston, MA

Huret Gallery, 6th Floor, Tufte Building




PERKS

What you get if you donate 20 dollars:

a CD of the beats presented in the Percussionvironments installation.


What you get if you donate 25 dollars:

a cassette tape of the beats presented in the Percussionvironments installation.


What you get if you donate 120 dollars:  

a CD personalized for you of sounds from the raw essentials sound library 

as well as cassette tape and CD of beats 

presented in the Percussionvironments installation.

THANK YOU FOR READING.

STAY TUNED FOR UPDATES:

- PREVIEW OF BEATS

- MORE INFO ON ENGINEERING BEHIND PERCUSSIONVIRONMENTS

- BEHIND THE SCENES FOOTAGE



- dj

campaign_city: Boston, MA / Philadelphia, PA /, United States

story:
Hi! I'm Anna. 


I'm an outdoor educator, gardener, dancer and goofy person living in Berkeley, CA. Along with those descriptors, music adds color to all I do. My first composition was entitled "Bully Cars." I wrote that one at age 3 from my car seat. Inspiration hits when it hits.

Growing up on an apple orchard in Oregon, as a child I was intrinsically connected to the rhythms of the earth. Song writing has helped me reconnect to that healing heart beat. As a young adult on a journey filled with growing pains, being able to pray through music has held me through my darkest times. Sitting in silence with the earth and feeling a song coalesce has become a joyful medicine.

And there are infinite songs to be caught in this vibrating world! I am blessed to spend my days outside in the hills where my inner experiences are reflected back to me in puddles, trees, and the faces of the children I work with.

Through playing with some incredible Bay Area musicians, I have re-discovered my love of performing and sharing my songs. My next step towards doing this more is to record my music. This way I can...

1. Reach out to venues with something for them to listen to

2. Work towards my first ever album

3. And SHARE with you! If you make a donation, I will contact you directly with a thank you and your very own copy of my EP.

I am asking for $800 to simply and beautifully record a handful of my favorite songs I have written. Thank you for any support you have given me and might be able to give. If donating money isn't the best way to support me at this time, I encourage you to please share this campaign with others if you are so moved. :)

-Anna Banana

Song writing has helped me reconnect to that healing heart beat. As a young adult on a journey filled with growing pains, being able to pray through music has held me through my darkest times. Sitting in silence with the earth and feeling a song coalesce has become a joyful medicine.And there are infinite songs to be caught in this vibrating world! I am blessed to spend my days outside in the hills where my inner experiences are reflected back to me in puddles, trees, and the faces of the children I work with.Through playing with some incredible Bay Area musicians, I have re-discovered my love of performing and sharing my songs. My next step towards doing this more is to record my music. This way I can...1. Reach out to venues with something for them to listen to2. Work towards my first ever album3. And SHARE with you! If you make a donation, I will contact you directly with a thank you and your very own copy of my EP.I am asking for $800 to simply and beautifully record a handful of my favorite songs I have written. Thank you for any support you have given me and might be able to give. If donating money isn't the best way to support me at this time, I encourage you to please share this campaign with others if you are so moved. :)-Anna Banana

story:
Dan Mayo (Best New Drummer, 2017) | "The hottest new drum talent around: Our attention was first drawn to Israeli drummer Dan Mayo video showcasing his inventive approach to sound and grooving creativity. Delve deeper and it’s instrumental power-trio TATRAN that really shows off Dan’s quirky playing style." (MusicRadar)

 

Hi! I’m Dan. I’m a drummer, composer and producer from Tel Aviv.

I love instrumental music, avant-garde and free jazz. That's how I express myself best.
In my power-trio, TATRAN, I let these desires of mine freak out. I was thrilled to learn that my passion is also the passion of many others as you can see in this picture, taken at TATRAN’s recent show.

TATRAN Live at TEDER.FM, Tel Aviv (Photo by Ariel Efron)

With TATRAN, a band you can define somehow as a jazzy-experimental-psychedelic-thing, I’ve released three albums so far. But my heart and hands and legs aren't exclusively for the band, and over the years I've teamed up with many acts, singers, bands and producers.

I was born in 1990 and I've been doin’ this since 1993. Here, a cute picture of a future experimentalist.

Over the past years, I was fortunate to be followed by musicians and non-musicians who were inspired by solos and beats I share online, some of which went extremely viral (more than 5 million views that brought tens of thousands of new listeners to my music).
That led directly to my endorsement deals from A&F Drums, Meinl Cymbals and Vic Firth, and last year (2017), with the huge help of the people who love my craft, I won the first place at the "Best New Drummer" polls at MusicRadar and Rhythm Magazine.

 

So I thought to myself ‘well, maybe it’s my time to go solo, eh?’ - but why?

I love experimenting and free thinking. That’s why I couldn’t keep up with college and schools. I practice differently. I express myself and let the sounds and music lead me. For me, it was simple - I only play where I can be expressive enough. Luckily, I found amazing projects to be involved in. That’s the basic foundation of everything – am I getting my point of view across the way I want to?

As I mentioned, the way I practiced was unconventional. I would not practice to play ‘better’ (in the classic, performing musician interpretation of the term) but merely looking for new ways to come up with ideas and sounds.

When I play live, I feel an enormous sense of commitment to the audience and to communicating with the people who care enough to listen and take the journey with me. That’s why when I played alone, I pictured an audience sitting in the room with me - and played for them.

Music composition and improvisation is all about carving the air in such a way that the people who breathe it resonate with the frequencies and join the journey. It’s all about interaction and all the hours of practice eventually made me the drummer that I am, but moreover - made me the communicator that I am.

Now, it's time to engrave my language on an mp3 file and press it into vinyl.

 

So, what is this album anyway?

It's an independent album, produced by me, and mostly performed by me. An eclectic, intense fusion between electronic music, live drumming and sound experiments. It spans dance, techno, ambient, and big beats, and it's rich with evolving melodies and cinematic tunes with drums as its foundation. It expresses my most honest thoughts and feelings of the moment, and I'm truly excited about it.

With your support, I will be able to make it happen - produce, record, manufacture and eventually promote the album and turn it into a full live concert, while constantly sharing awesome content and videos. Thus the value of supporting this campaign goes way beyond the production of this album alone.

Among the perks you can find vinyl, CDs, signed drumsticks, my original sheet book, launch tickets, full digital discography and more.

 

My works so far:

I recorded albums with TATRAN - Shvat (2014), Soul Ghosts (2015), No Sides (2016), dema - love (2017), DY - Session 1 (2017), Zu (2018), CRuNCH 22 - Alice’s adventures in Wonderland (2016), Ester Rada - Ester Rada (2014), I wish (2015) and performed on some great stages like Montreal Jazz Festival, Atlanta Jazz Festival, Vancouver Jazz Festival, State-X New Forms, Oppikoppi Festival, Rochester Jazz Festival, Ottawa Jazz Festival, Elbphilharmonie and more.

Other Ways You Can Help

Weather you're able to contribute or not, I will definitely going to need your help get the word out and make some noise about it.

story:
Hello!

Welcome to the Skyfoot Indigogo page in support of our fourth studio album, Astronomy Man.

We began working on it last December and we're very excited to share this with everybody this fall!  

Pre-order now and get your own signed copy of Astonomy Man, enjoy special perks, and the opportunity to hear the whole album before the official release date.  Plus, you'll be helping out the band in these trying times!  Your much needed donations and support will help cover production and promotional costs.  Physical copies & digital copies will be available.  You can donate any amount you want PLUS you can choose a perk as our thanks for helping us create this new music! Donate today! You rock!

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We are Skyfoot, a four-piece jamband from Boston, MA.  We’re thrilled to announce our fourth full-length album, Astronomy Man.  It was recorded last winter and spring at The Rotary Records in western Massachusetts and features eleven original songs in a totally collaborative effort from start to finish.  It's all set to be released this fall, and we know it's our best work yet!

What We Need

We’re looking to raise $5,000 to recover recording costs, print CD's, and promote the release.  Every penny that we collect in this fundraising effort will be utilized to get our music out to as many listeners and potential fans as possible!  This is our second crowdfunding campaign in our ten year history and we're looking to YOU to help us out in this new and exciting way.  We're extremely lucky to have an amazing network of family, friends, and fans.  Here's hoping we reach our fundraising goal and bring more music to the world.

 

What You Get

Check out all of the various perks you can receive with your contribution:

Physical & digital copies of Astronomy Man (2020)

Physical copies of our first three albums, Blindly On Through (2018), Room For Space (2014), Eternal Bend (2012), and our first live release, a double disc, Live at the Myna Loy (2019).

Skyfoot logo T-Shirts of all sizes

Signed copies of Astronomy Man & poster (11X17)

Stickers & handwritten "thank you" letter!

 

ALL SHIPPING IN THE U.S.A. IS FREE!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help out by sharing this campaign with your friends, social networks, and email lists.  Check out and use the Indiegogo share tools to help us get the word out. Thank you for your generosity!

- Signed, Aaron, Eric, James, & Tyler

Looking for more information? Check the project FAQ

Select a perk
