story:
Help Fund Our Great Big Summer Trip!

Hello Freinds,

This summer, Daisy and I will be accompanying Curtis Eller to the UK  as he embarks on his longest and most ambitious tour yet. To make the most of this massive endeavor he'll need his wife and daughter by his side!

My husband Curtis and I have been working partners for 23  years. I am the official artist for all the band's album covers, tour posters and t-shirts, and I will be producing and managing all the merchandise for the tour.

Our 8 year-old daughter will be coming along for the opportunity of her lifetime! This will be Daisy's first trip outside the US and it will afford her an invaluable chance to get acquainted with a new culture.

For a banjo player, an illustrator and an aspiring gymnast, this promises to be a life changing summer abroad! We deeply appreciate your help.

Sincerely,

Jamie B. Wolcott


What do we need and what will you get?

Daisy and I are seeking funds to help cover our airfare and travel expenses. These transcontinental flights are pricey! We can use all the help we can get.

We've listed a few rewards that we hope you'll like. Above all, you'll have our eternal gratitude for helping us get to England this summer!


Other Ways You Can Help

Buy prints or commission original artwork from Jamie B. Wolcott:

 http://jamiebwolcott.com/ 

Buy Curtis Eller's albums and other merchandise:

 http://www.curtiseller.com/

https://curtiseller.bandcamp.com/ 

Share this page and help us spread the word. We can use all the help we can get!

Got any bright ideas? We're all ears!

story:
Short Summary

Manifested is something that has always been a central part of the three of our lives.  We all grew up together and played with each other and so many of our good friends every chance we had.  We played music during school, we played after school, we played at every party, coffee shop and gazebo within a 20 mile radius. Music has continued to be the most central aspect of our lives even as the venues became more legitimate. We went our separate ways and pursued music across the country in Vermont, Colorado, Massachusetts and California respectively.  When our paths realigned we had all become seasoned musicians. We gained an objective outlook on the challenges and heartbreak that can be a part of being in a band.  We learned how to operate both professionally and with artistic integrity. 

This campaign is going to allow us to take the material we have been developing over the last two years and document it with the help of the wonderful "Viking Sound" recording team in the beautiful Pocono Mountains of Eastern PA.  Not only will we be able to have an album to share, to sell and to present the best face of the band, but we will get a new line of merch to support our time on the road.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Wondering where exactly the funds are going? Here is the break down: We need $1200 in order to get the new album tracked ($600), mixed ($400) and mastered ($200). That is a SUPER good deal that we only got as a result of some friends/fans like yourselves giving us a huge break and returning some favors.  We will also be able to get a merch display case ($300), a new line of t-shirts ($500), a new line of pins ($300), our first line of hats ($400) and fund the physical production of the album ($300).

Every contribution comes with an advanced digital copy of the new album. You will have the opportunity to get the last of our old merch before it is gone forever, get first dibs on the new merch, get a signed album, choose songs for us to play at live shows, get an executive producer credit in the new album's liner notes, request a song for us to cover and even have the band play a show at your house or wash your car!  

If we do not reach our goal then all of your contributions will be returned.

 

The Impact

The three of us have put a tremendous amount of time and energy into Manifested and are in the fortunate position to put in even more.  This campaign is about allowing us to record and support this new material. Your investment in this band is going to get the album made and also get a new line of merch that will bring us funding for years to come.  The momentum we have built brought us to some of the best festivals and venues on the east coast.  This plan will allow us to increase our time and effort to the point that it needs to be in order to take this project to the next level.  We will be able to play more shows in more markets and foster the growth that we all want to see!  We would be happy to play music in any capacity, but want to see how far we can take Manifested while we have the chance.

Risks & Challenges

Playing in a band is something that brings a lot of joy to us, but it also comes with a lot of sacrifices.  The hours we have put in personally and together over the years are countless. We find ourselves with a set of skills that are truly unique.  Sharing them is what justifies it.   Playing music will always be a part of our lives, but we know the doors that are open for us now, are not going to be open forever.  To pass through them we need to do it together.  This funding will allow us to get the momentum we need to carry the project into the future and make bigger and more lasting strides. We truly appreciate playing music for you  and we hope that you can give us the opportunity to take Manifested to the next level.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to this monetarily we understand.  There is still so much you can do to help us out!  Sharing this with you friends and family via email, Facebook or in person not only helps us reach our goal of raising $3000 but also includes those wonderful people in the communal experience we are all crafting together. That is Manifested.

That is Manifested.

story:
Summary

The Midwest Chamber Ensemble is a Kansas City-based organization dedicated to the performance of chamber orchestra and chamber ensemble music of the classical tradition. Selected by audition, ensemble members are primarily young professional musicians and exceptional music students. The Midwest Chamber Ensemble prepares its members for future career opportunities by creating a professional environment and providing audiences with quality performances.

As a next stage in its evolution, the ensemble is recording a professional CD to bring their music to a larger audience. The newest album celebrates German composer Louis Spohr and his Nonet and Octet. By contributing, you are allowing this vision to take its final steps

What We Need & What You Get

Because of a great opportunity, a large portion of the cost to record has been taken care of. However, there is still plenty to to pay for; specifically towards physical production. $1,700 is what is required to meet our final goal to be prepared for production at the end of recording.

Your tax deductable donations won't go unrewarded. Below is a list of opportunities for your level of donation (more information on 'Perks' page)

  • $25: CD
  • $50: Limited Edition MCE Scarf and CD or Visit to an open rehearsal and CD
  • $150: Pair of Wine and Chocolate Fundraiser Tickets and CD
  • $500: All of the above and Liner Note Acknowledgments in the CD

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate? You can still help! Get the word out by sharing this page with others and sending people to Midwest Chamber Ensemble's webpage (http://www.midwestchamberensemble.org/).

story:
Short Summary

In October 2014 we began making a transition into discovering ourselves as a band. We had been playing music for awhile already, but we decided it was time to really think about what we wanted to accomplish and who we wanted to be. 

It took a lot of honesty and a couple major changes but we finally felt like we were on track to becoming exactly who we wanted to be. After writing a few new songs in our new style that we were very excited about, we made preparations to enter the studio, record the new songs and share them with the world! We could finally let everyone hear what we've been doing behind the scenes for so long! 

Unfortunately, along the way we ran into numerous obstacles. The thousands of dollars we had spent were seemingly going to waste and before we knew it we were out of money with NOTHING to show for it. 

Crowdfunding is not something we generally do. We believe that we exist to serve YOU; to give YOU what you want...quality music and entertainment without asking for anything in return. 

We love our fans. Every one of you. We have been incredibly blessed to gain such a fantastic following of people who love and support what we are doing. So the time has come to humbly ask for your help. Please help us FINALLY release our year of hard work to the world. 

We are working full-time jobs and putting everything we can spare into this new EP Album "We Can Pretend". We are playing shows and selling merch to help with costs, and we are asking for your help to make a dent in what we will need to make this happen! 

What We Need & What You Get

With our sob story out of the way, here is the breakdown of how this works: 

We are asking for $2000. That is about 1/2 of what we've already spent, and about 3/4 of what we need to finish. This is for the music alone and does not include physical distribution.
  • EVERYONE who donates any amount will get the album on its release. Consider it a pre-order. 
  • Take a look at the other perks depending on what you can spare! 
  • The money will go directly to recording/mixing/mastering the 5 song EP "We Can Pretend". It won't be used for anything else except to pay the pros for what they do best.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you absolutely can't spare even $1, please just share this campaign everywhere you can. You never know who might be ready to help! There are more important things going on in the world, even on INDIEGOGO. Just know that not only does your donation help make this album a reality, but it also allows us the opportunity to take our message of hope and implementing positive change into communities all around the world.
story_txt:
Short Summary In October 2014 we began making a transition into discovering ourselves as a band. We had been playing music for awhile already, but we decided it was time to really think about what we wanted to accomplish and who we wanted to be. 
It took a lot of honesty and a couple major changes but we finally felt like we were on track to becoming exactly who we wanted to be. After writing a few new songs in our new style that we were very excited about, we made preparations to enter the studio, record the new songs and share them with the world! We could finally let everyone hear what we've been doing behind the scenes for so long! Unfortunately, along the way we ran into numerous obstacles. The thousands of dollars we had spent were seemingly going to waste and before we knew it we were out of money with NOTHING to show for it. Crowdfunding is not something we generally do. We believe that we exist to serve YOU; to give YOU what you want...quality music and entertainment without asking for anything in return. We love our fans. Every one of you. We have been incredibly blessed to gain such a fantastic following of people who love and support what we are doing. So the time has come to humbly ask for your help. Please help us FINALLY release our year of hard work to the world. We are working full-time jobs and putting everything we can spare into this new EP Album "We Can Pretend". We are playing shows and selling merch to help with costs, and we are asking for your help to make a dent in what we will need to make this happen!    What We Need & What You Get With our sob story out of the way, here is the breakdown of how this works:  We are asking for $2000. That is about 1/2 of what we've already spent, and about 3/4 of what we need to finish. This is for the music alone and does not include physical distribution. 

 EVERYONE who donates any amount will get the album on its release. Consider it a pre-order.  Take a look at the other perks depending on what you can spare! 
The money will go directly to recording/mixing/mastering the 5 song EP "We Can Pretend". It won't be used for anything else except to pay the pros for what they do best.  


    Other Ways You Can Help If you absolutely can't spare even $1, please just share this campaign everywhere you can. You never know who might be ready to help! There are more important things going on in the world, even on INDIEGOGO. Just know that not only does your donation help make this album a reality, but it also allows us the opportunity to take our message of hope and implementing positive change into communities all around the world.

story:
Who Am I?

Jordy Jackson was born and raised in Jones Falls, a small rural area in Southeastern Ontario. He grew up with nothing more to occupy his time than his guitar and a passion for playing music. Throughout the years, Jordy has played countless shows as a solo artist and with his family band, which allows him to keep his roots close to his heart. His passion for music will continue to grow, so regardless of whether you see him playing to three fans or three thousand fans, his stories will entertain you and bring you to that magical place that only country music can get you to.


What Am I Trying to Do?

Jordy is attempting to raise funds for the release of his EP. Recording is wrapping up, which has been a huge accomplishment for the band. However, funds are still needed for the rest of the project. He is reaching out to you to help make this happen. 

             Approximate Cost Breakdown:
  • Mastering....................$600
  • CD Packaging.............$750
  • Vinyl Pressing.............$850
  • Distribution.................$500
  • Merchandise...............$300


How Else Can You Help?


Being a working man himself, Jordy understands if you cannot financially contribute to this campaign, but appreciates your support in any way that you can. Spread the word and keep listening to and sharing his music! It is the support of fans that has inspired to Jordy to do what he does.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Joren de Bruin, though I often go by my artist name Tensei. I am an independent composer/producer and am probably best known for my work on the soundtrack for the webcomic Homestuck. I've written music in a wide variety of styles and genres and many of my tracks have received high praise from fans of the comic.

Back in 2011, I released an album called Strife, which to this day remains one of the most "recommended listens" of the entire Homestuck discography. Strife was an album that combined a foundation of hard rock/heavy metal with eclectic influences from videogames and anime soundtracks, all based around the common theme of 'battle music'. 

I've had many fans request some kind of follow-up to Strife, but was never able to get something off the ground due to the significant investment required in terms of both money and time. With crowdfunding I'll be able to dedicate most my time to making a great album, and bring it to a higher level of quality than would otherwise be possible.

By backing this project you express your support and desire to see the continued release of more music in the style of the first Strife album. Your support also opens up possibilities such as releases on physical media and high quality album art.

What We Need

The main limiting factor in creating Strife 2 has always been opportunity cost: an album of this scope requires multiple months of work and only makes money over a longer term after its release. By turning to crowdfunding, this investment is essentially front-loaded, which means that I can put all my time in creating the album instead of having to worry about making money to support myself.

Another part of it is musical equipment. My bass guitar and wah pedal need to be sent in for repairs, some of my samples need to be upgraded and new strings for my guitars are pretty much a constant expenditure. The money from this campaign will be used to upgrade and maintain my musical equipment, as well as pay collaborators/guest spots, which ensures that the quality of the album releases will be as good as it can be.

 

What You Get + Stretch Goals

Music

Obviously! The Strife 2 album itself will have at least 12 tracks, making it twice as long as its predecessor. Perks for supporters also include other songs I've made previously. 

The following preview video should provide a decent impression of the kinds of songs you can expect on the album. Note that all of these are works in progress and are therefore subject to changes in the final release.

 

In addition to Strife 2, I have 2 more albums planned, details for which are listed below.

Commissions

To coincide with this campaign, will be offering a limited amount of special commissions at a significantly lower rate than usual, with a variety of options and pricing ranges available. More details on commissions are listed below.

$5750 - Track Art

With enough support I can afford to pay a professional artist to create track art and logo's for the album and give it a much higher level of polish and character. Marimo, the artist I have in mind is someone I've worked with multiple times in the past and whom I trust to deliver great quality. An example of her track art is shown below:

$6500 - The Noir Album

A few months ago I posted a playful little jazzy tune called "Long Night Ahead", inspired by film noir, 90s point and click adventure games, and a certain other webcomic. The reception was amazingly positive, so the idea of turning it into an album was a tempting one. The Noir Album is still very much in its conceptual phase, but I am positive that I can turn it into something great. I'll be aiming for a similar scope as the Strife 2 album (12+ songs) but in a very different style, an example of which can be found in the music preview video.

If this stretch goal is reached, I am looking at the 12th of June, 2017 as a potential release date. 

8000$ - Physical Release - CD

Even though physical media is on its way out, it's still nice to have something you can hold on to, right? Printed track art & commentary booklet included. On reaching this stretch goal, any backers on a perk tier that includes the Digital release of Strife 2 can upgrade to a physical CD version (with shipping costs).

14000$ - Heir of Grief Ultimate - Rework

Heir of Grief stands out as arguably my most popular song on the Homestuck soundtrack, though I never was entirely satisfied with it, which makes a potential rework of it a tantalizing but ambitious goal. On reaching this stretch goal, I will be able to rent studio time and contract session musicians to deliver a fully live version of Heir of Grief that will blow every other Homestuck song I've ever made away.

The initial funding goal is my estimate of the required amount of money to be able to deliver Strife 2 by the date of March 14th, 2017, as well as the Commission compilation album (date of release depends on the number of commissions). If the funding does not meet the initial goal, both albums will be delayed as I will have to split my time working on the album with other projects. The amount of time by which the albums will be delayed depends on how much the funding falls short of the initial goal.

16500$ - Physical Release - Vinyl

Vinyl has kind of been in vogue again recently, right? Vinyl production costs are fairly high, and will require a separate remaster, which is why this is quite a pricey stretch goal. Both Strife 2 and the Noir Album will have a vinyl release if this goal is reached and will be available as a free upgrade for all $45 and up perks (but with associated shipping costs). 

 

Risks & Challenges

Provided the funding is there, I foresee no risks that are likely to threaten the release of the albums, barring something happening to me personally. From experience, I am quite meticulous in keeping multiple backups of my projects nowadays, so even a simultaneous double hard drive failure shouldn't threaten the eventual release of the albums (though it might delay it).

Equipment failure is always a possibility as well, but the funding from this campaign should give me enough of a financial buffer to account for eventualities such as these.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Even if you can't afford to contribute, I know that a lot of people in the Homestuck fandom enjoy the music I've made, but might not necessarily connect it to my name. They might be eager to hear more and contribute to this campaign, so even getting the news out there helps.

FAQ

Q: Is this an official Homestuck album?

A: No. What Pumpkin is not involved in the production of any part of this album.

Q: What about the Noir album, that name is kind of similar to...

A: It's based on Film Noir, a genre of movies from the 1930s-50s known for its hardboiled detectives and private eyes that get caught up in all manner of seedy shenanigans at the behest of some distressed broad. That's the kind of vibe you should expect from the album.

Q: You teased a potential 16/2/2017 release date to make it exactly 6 years since the original release, what happened to that?

A: It's more important to me that the album is good than to release it on an anniversary, and it's still quite possible that the album will be done by February the 16th. The 14/3/2017 release date is there to set an upper limit: the album will very definitely be released by then at the latest, but possibly earlier.

Q: How are the prices for the commissions determined?

A: I usually do commissions in bulk/under contract for commercial projects (such as an entire soundtrack), which typically involves getting paid per minute of music delivered, as well as a percentage of sales (royalties). Commissions from the perks of this campaign are royalty-free and priced more attractively than my typical contract work, due to their limited nature. Additionally, you get all the albums and previous tier perk rewards as well.

 

 

Commission Terms and Details

Tier 1: Mini-Commissions, Non-Exclusive.

In addition to Strife 2, I'll be creating a free compilation album made up out of backer commissions. I will take 1 day (24 hours) to work on each of these mini-commissions, with no specific limits placed on the number of instrument tracks, the genre or the duration of the track. As a backer on this tier, I will follow your request and make the track fit your specifications as closely as possible*. Additionally, I might live stream some of the creation process and, if desired, can provide a MIDI, an .flp file, or render it as separate mixer tracks for remixing/learning purposes. Commissions on this tier can incorporate motifs from existing songs or even be outright remixes, high quality rips or mash-ups. You are freely able to use these tracks in any non-commercial project.

Highbloods of the High Seas is an example of a track I've made in one day, and therefore gives a decent impression of the length and quality you can expect from a mini-commission.

 
*Within reason. There will be no revisions after a song is finished (i.e. the 24 hours are up). Although I will do my absolute best to produce something that fits the specifications, more outrageous or ambitious requests are more likely to go unfulfilled. Just use common sense when coming up with a request.
 

Tier 2: Mini-Commissions, Exclusively Licensed.

Commissions on this tier follow the same specifications as Tier 1 (A song created in 24 hours), but will not be released on the compilation album (unless you so desire) and are instead exclusively for your own use (including commercial) without the need for royalty fees.

Tier 3: Full Commission

Unlike lower tiers, commissions from this tier aren't limited by what I can accomplish within 24 hours. This allows for a much greater level of polish and song complexity, though I am limiting myself to a maximum length of 2:30 per song. This is effectively the same kind of work I'd do under contract for soundtrack work, and that's the level of quality you can expect. These songs can also be used in your own commercial projects, with no royalty payments required!

IMPORTANT: If you intend to use a track from Tier 2 or 3 in a commercial capacity (i.e. in a game that you intend to sell), you take full responsibility for any copyright issues that might arise from requests to reuse/remix existing songs. That is to say, if you ask me to remix a Final Fantasy track, I can not be held accountable if you use this song in a game that you're selling and you get sued by Square-Enix. Generally, it is advisable to only request remixes of songs that you have legal ownership of, or are licensed to use.

In summary:

Commission Tier

Limitation

Use in commercial projects?

Possibility for a remix/cover of an existing track.

Tier 1

Made in 24 hours

No

Yes

Tier 2

Made in 24 hours

Yes

Yes (Read Terms)

Tier 3

2:30 minute max length

Yes

No

story:
We're so excited to involve you in the creation of our very first full-length album!

The songs are written, the demos recorded, and we're ready to push 'go' on our debut, but we need your help to make this a reality. 

So we are launching this campaign to

1) make it as easy as possible for you to support us in this effort

and

2) make sure you get something in return for your support (see the various perks)

For those of you who don't already know us, Lisa Ward is a singer-songwriter from the Shetland Isles in Scotland who appeared on BBC’s ‘The Voice UK’ as part of Sir Tom Jones’ team. 

She is known for her powerful rock-influenced vocals and electrifying stage presence. Previous achievements include a support slot with Biffy Clyro, and sharing a stage with The Undertones, as well as her well-publicised stint on national television.

The XYY is made up of guitarist and vocalist Sarah Thomson, bassist Craig Birnie, and drummer and virtual composer Eamonn Watt. Together, they produce original music that is unique and instantly recognisable, ranging from grunge to pop; singer-songwriter to electro; rock to riotgrrl.

Our goal is to raise £3000, which is the minimum we need to cover studio time, producer costs, mixing and mastering, artwork, photography, printing, and distribution.

Now to the fun part...

The Perks: This fundraising campaign is designed to give you the opportunity to support the making of our debut album at whatever level you are financially able. But it's also designed to reward you with the perks that you deserve for your contribution. Some supplies are limited, but we've tried to make most unlimited so you can all benefit no matter when you contribute.

How Else You Can Help: We do know, however, that not everyone can afford to donate, but your time can be even more valuable!

Help us spread the word about our campaign to your friends and anyone who you think would want to support local, independent artists.

You can use the built-in IndieGoGo share tools to let people know on Twitter and Facebook, or paste the link below anywhere and everywhere: 

http://igg.me/at/lisaward/x/9373816

Thank you very much!

Sincerely,

Lisa Ward & The XYY

story:
Wardrum 4th Album release

Hello dear friends and fans!
For those who do not know us, we' re a heavy metal band from Thessaloniki Greece, formed in 2010 and we've released 3 full length albums so far : "Spadework" (2011), "Desolation" (2012) and "Messenger" (2013). Until now we've done everything by ourselves for all our releases and the love we got in return made every single drop of sweat worth it. This is the first time we're doing a campaign because we've got in our hands the best material we've yet written, and we feel that we need to take things to the next level.

What We Need 

What this campaign is aiming to cover:

  • Professional Studio Recordings 
  • Mixing and Mastering the album
  • Physical CD's' manufacturing
  • Merchandise

To cover the above we need 8,000 euros. 

Your contribution will help us deliver the best possible music product we can give. Show us your love and we will give you all we got as a band and as a team.

We have prepared some awesome perks for you, check them out on the side of the page and decide which one (or ones) fit(s) you the most!

You Can Help Us

Even if you are not be able to contribute, you can definitely still help us! Spread the word about Wardrum and this campaign. Help us advertise this effort and don't forget, you can always use the Indiegogo share tools!

Mixing and Mastering the album
Physical CD's' manufacturing
Merchandise 



To cover the above we need 8,000 euros. 
Your contribution will help us deliver the best possible music product we can give. Show us your love and we will give you all we got as a band and as a team.

We have prepared some awesome perks for you, check them out on the side of the page and decide which one (or ones) fit(s) you the most!

You Can Help UsEven if you are not be able to contribute, you can definitely still help us! Spread the word about Wardrum and this campaign. Help us advertise this effort and don't forget, you can always use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

In 2016 we have a triple celebration:
- new album ZI released in September
- 20 years of Negura Bunget
- 10 years from the OM album release

Negura Bunget has been around since 1995. From a small underground band in Romania we managed to get to a respectable status, with 6 albums released worldwide, which got some amazing reviews in the media, several European and North American tours completed, and over 1000 gigs performed.
On this anniversary context we'd like to take things to a higher lever and plan some tour dates in areas of the world we've never been before to, like Asia, Australia, New Zealand...
But in order to get there we need you support.


ZI digipak cover:


What You Get

We're applying for 9000 $ for this project. Those money will help us cover things such as visas, flight costs, van rentals and hotel bookings. 

When supporting Negura Bunget, you can get your hands on some very unique items. Rare items from our private collections, signed products, special items for this campaign, interaction with the band  and many other interesting perks. 

The more funds we manage to raise, the more options we have with the tour planning. We'd love to extend it as much as possible and include some more countries in the area (like Singapore, Indonesia, Thailand, South Korea...).

Challanges

Negura Bunget has always been a live band. In our 20 years history we played more than 1000 gigs, with more than 500 performed over the last years. Most of our tours are self produced and self financed. That means we pretty much do all the work ourselves. We don't have a booking agent or manager, we do all the work ourselves. While this approach gives of a lot of freedom to do things the way we see them fit, it also comes with some limitations.

We have no problem driving thousand of miles by van, sleeping in motels and eating whatever we can find. We enjoy getting to new places and meeting new people.

Still, we are a underground band from Romania and there is just so much we can do on our own. But we are up to the challenge. We already have a European tour setup for Autumn 2016 and a North American on for spring 2017. With a bit of help our plan is to extend the tour in Australia, New Zealand, India, China and Japan. If things go well, maybe even more countries.

We have the connections to make this possible, we just need to face some high upfront costs (flights, visas, rentals, insurances), most of which we'll never recuperate.

ZI artbook cover:


Negura Bunget ZI album

ZI (in English "say" or "day" is the second part of the Transilvanian Trilogy, the most complex musical and visual project we've ever been working on as a band.
The album explores the human components, the traditions and practices, the connection with the nature, the way this relation shaped the spiritual horizon of the local inhabitants. The second stage of the trilogy is symbolized through WORD.



Negura Bunget ZI Anniversary World Tour

Negura Bunget Anniversary Tour 2016 – Europe

Negura Bunget is:

Gabriel Mafa / Negru - drums / percussion / dulcimer / xylophone / horns

Petrică Ionuţescu - pipes / horns / trumpet / traditional instruments
Ovidiu Corodan - bass
Daniel Dorobanţu - visual design


Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the possibility to help us financially, you can still help us by sharing the campaign on social medias such as Facebook, Twitter and Instagram or simply letting your friends know about the campaign. 

Thank you so much in advance, and we hope you can help us make this dream come true!

story:
Have Cello, Will Travel

My name is Juliana Soltis, and I am a Baroque cellist based in Seattle, Washington. Together with my colleagues Adaiha MacAdam-Somer (viola da gamba), Justin Murphy-Mancini (harpsichord), and Daniel Swenberg (theorbo & Baroque guitar), I have been selected to perform this August on the Fringe series at the 2016 BRQ Vantaa Festival in Vantaa, Finland.

As the opening act of the 2016 Fringe Series, we will be presenting a program of rarely-performed experimental 18th-century French cello sonatas: very exciting music, very virtuosic, and very fun both to listen to and to play!

For us as performers and artists, this is an incredible opportunity---not only to showcase our talents---but to share our love of this music with a whole new audience abroad.

Did you have to buy a seat for that Thing?

Well...yes! International travel can be financially challenging for anyone, but for musicians, the added expense of transporting our instruments takes matters from "challenging" to "really complicated" rather quickly! Large instruments such as Adaiha's viol and my cello (better known as "Gracie") require a seat on an airplane, necessitating the purchase of a second, full-price fare in addition to our individual tickets. Needless to say, things can get expensive quickly---and that without even factoring-in other essentials such as meals and lodging!

To that end, we are asking for your help in raising $5,000 to help offset our travel expenses. Your contribution will help pay for plane tickets for both performers and their instruments---and keep us happily fed and housed while we are on the road!

As a gesture of our gratitude for your donation, we are offering an assortment of perks ranging all the way from a handwritten postcard from Finland to the opportunity to have us record a special bonus track inspired by our BRQ Vantaa Festival program just for you. Also available is the opportunity to get your hands on one of the first copies of my upcoming debut album---Entrez le Diable!---which features several of the works we will be performing in Finland. For those of you who cannot join us in Vantaa, it's the next best thing to being in the audience!

It's more than just a concert.

Performing at the BRQ Vantaa Festival isn't just a chance for us to showcase our talents---it is also a wonderful opportunity to engage in a unique cross-cultural exchange with our colleagues abroad. Drawing performers not only from Finland but from across the European Union, the festival is a unique reminder that, in a world beset by turmoil, it is our calling to "make music more intensely, more beautifully, more devotedly than ever before" (Leonard Bernstein).

There are many ways to help!

There is nothing so valuable to us as community involvement: without the support of our audience members, there simply is no music! Getting the word out is often more than half the battle when fundraising, so please share our campaign and follow along with our preparations on Facebook---if at the moment a financial donation is beyond you, this is a great and meaningful way to participate. 

However you choose to be involved, please know that we are incredibly grateful for your support: it means the world to us, and we couldn't do this without you!

story:
Short Summary

da7  is a collaboration between dj duo Double Agent 7 (ODM collective) & producer Lazlo Legezer (My Toys like me) 

Dopamine Fiend is our first single and was made with a little bit of the old and a little bit of the new . It features the killer vocals of Annie Bea (Fjorka/The Rotten Hill Gang/The Hyptonic Eye). 

Lyrics and track constructed by DoubleAgent7,Lazlo Legezer  & Annie Bea 

Muso press speak: 

Side A: Dopamine Fiend by da7 (feat. Annie Bea) is a retro pop crossover dance track, chock full of beats and rockin rhythms. If you put do wop, drum and bass and a pint of adrenaline in a blender it might come out something like this. 

Side B: If I had a little love is a uplifting soul classic spun into the future by an out of control Delorean and reconstructed with the magical musical alchemy of Lazlo Legezer.

And don't just take our words for it. Here is a quote from Artrocker Magazine's review of our track: 

"hook laden ‘Dopamine Fiend’.....it’s pop in all the right places, a delicious chopped and screwed ‘hum’ sample for a bassline, echoing space horns and sultry bluesy vocals from Miss Bea."

What We Need & What You Get

We are doing a limited 300 vinyl press and are just looking for a £7 contribution (essentially a pre-order) which will get you 1 x 7 inch record (free delivery in u.k. additional costs incur for overseas) delivered to you after the release date June 17th. If you buy the vinyl we will also throw in the digital download for free!  

We aren't trying to take over the world. We don't want to make a gajillion pounds. We just want to get our record out there and give it a bit of a life. We don't really need to break the Internet or become number 1...although we did read The Manual (how to have a number 1 record the easy way) by The KLF so it does sound like a number 1 record!

The Impact

If any of the following 7 aspirations came true just once we would be beyond happy:

1) be someone's ear worm for an entire day

2) a teenager has a mad moment and listens to it 18 times in a row bouncing around their bedroom

3) a couple have their first ever smooch to it and it becomes "their song"

4) it makes an OAP dance who's feet haven't moved to the beat for 20 years. 

5) it becomes a dj's "break glass in case of emergency" track. 

6) It is played on a  radio show other than our own. 

7) It is found in 60 years time at a car boot sale (assuming they still have car boot sales in the future..or cars for that matter) and is 're-discovered'. 

And that's about it. Is that too much to ask? In terms of financial reward our very lofty goal is to break even. We produced the record for free in the home studio of Lazlo Legezer. We made the video for free with the help of Adobe Premiere, an iPad and youtube and now we would love to re-cooperate our costs on the vinyl production and have a little bit for pr.  
Your donation will not only get you a record that you will hopefully love but we will love you forever in return for helping us realise our not so grandiose ambitions...

da7 x

story:
Honeysuckle Mantra -"Monkey Mind"

Deep roots of primal power creates a crown of leaves connecting to endless amount of light to blossom and create from within our hearts.

Honeysuckle Mantra is a trio seeking to unite universal aspects of our existence with the use of raw rock power, heart and consciousness.

Recording at Tapetown Studio November 2015 with album release in early 2016.

Guitar & Vocal -Inuk Rosing

Bass -Pætur Joensen

Drums -Marcell Westergaard

How can you help?

Buy the CD and/or digital download
You can choose between CD and Digital Download. The album art is in process, but be sure to get a nice experience beholding this!
The CD is digipacked,

Concerts

A private Honesuckle Mantra concert! Preferably in Denmark or northern Germany. Contact us for more info and arrangements! 

Workshops
We teach music, and you can get a workshop for your school or band. Songwriting, instrumental teaching, tuning drums, rock history and more is what we offer. Location: Denmark, Jylland/Fyn. Get in contact for more info!

Unicum afficionado?
Order a handwritten book with lyrics, drawings, pictures etc. Truly unique!

Economy and transparancy

To help you as funding part get a closer insight in the process, here is the budget for you to see. If things change we will update this info. 
Recording, mix and mastering: 3400 €
250 digipacked cd's: 600€
Total: 4000 €

Recording

To capture the true spirit and energy, we aim to record live in the studio.  Focus will be on the synergy between the three of us, the bass, the drums, the guitar. Vocals will be added afterwards, soundwise roaring thunders and intimate vocals will be hard to achieve at once, in the same room. A compromise we have to accept in the studio.
5 days of recording is scheduled, 5 days which will mark a highlight in our lives, we will put all of our energy and soulpower in making a record that can be felt, appriciated and hopefully expand the universe a little. 

You can make a difference!

Yes, that's right. You have no idea how much we will appriciate your support, and we will try to the best of our abilities to return it to you.

Thank you! Peace to you all!

Vinyl! We want vinyl!

Step 1: recording (that's what this campaign is about).
Step 2: another crowdfunding to get a press of good old vinyls!

Thanks from the band, Marcell, Pætur & Inuk!

story:
July 11, 2015
Dear Romanians and supporters of Romanian culture!

Under the umbrella and with the support of the Romanian-American Society of Washington State, our own community organization, I am thrilled to announce the Benaroya Hall Chamber Concert in Romanian Character that will take place on September 12th, 2015 at 7:30 PM. I  will be joined by distinguished Seattle Symphony's Principal Second violinist, Elisa Barston and Seattle Opera's own soloist soprano, Marcy Stonikas who is also a soloist with the Folksoper in Vienna. 

If you love Romanian music and culture this concert is for you! Our concert is titled 'in Romanian Character' for a reason: we are bringing to you a musical program that transforms the musical soul of Romanians, our folk music, into classical masterworks. You will recognize Romanian dances and songs whose rhythms, fire or lyricism you will enjoy.

Elisa, Marcy and I are confident that you will appreciate the exquisitely elegant environment at Benaroya Hall, fantastic acoustics, pleasant seats, the whole experience of a September night that aims to make Romanian culture well known in Seattle and bring all of us closer together.

Our goal is to raise $6500 which will cover the artists fees, hall rental+ insurance+ ushers, piano tuning and the in-hall video recording. We hope you will enjoy the multitude of rewards that come with each donation level!

All of us at the Romanian-American Society of Washington State would like to send you our HUGE gratitude. We'd like to applaud you, the supporters, sponsors and founders of this first big scale Romanian concert at Benaroya Hall!

We'd like to ask you to please SHARE this kickstarter campaign with all your friends and relatives so we can reach as many Romanians and Romanian culture friends as possible.

Thank you for your generosity and I can't wait to see you at the concert!

Oana Rusu Tomai, pianist

If you love Romanian music and culture this concert is for you! Our concert is titled 'in Romanian Character' for a reason: we are bringing to you a musical program that transforms the musical soul of Romanians, our folk music, into classical masterworks. You will recognize Romanian dances and songs whose rhythms, fire or lyricism you will enjoy.



Elisa, Marcy and I are confident that you will appreciate the exquisitely elegant environment at Benaroya Hall, fantastic acoustics, pleasant seats, the whole experience of a September night that aims to make Romanian culture well known in Seattle and bring all of us closer together.



Our goal is to raise $6500 which will cover the artists fees, hall rental+ insurance+ ushers, piano tuning and the in-hall video recording. We hope you will enjoy the multitude of rewards that come with each donation level!


All of us at the Romanian-American Society of Washington State would like to send you our HUGE gratitude. We'd like to applaud you, the supporters, sponsors and founders of this first big scale Romanian concert at Benaroya Hall!


We'd like to ask you to please SHARE this kickstarter campaign with all your friends and relatives so we can reach as many Romanians and Romanian culture friends as possible.



Thank you for your generosity and I can't wait to see you at the concert!

Oana Rusu Tomai, pianist

story:
The SABRe Multi Sensor is for use with the entire family of clarinets and saxophones. The SABRe Multi Sensor opens up a completely new world of sounds. This technology offers the performer immediate interaction and coordination with electronics. 

This may be planned in advance, or manipulated live while on stage. Additionally, the Sabre Basic Sensor lets musicians access their acoustic sound whenever desired. The Basic Sensor also makes it possible for one performer to control a multi-media performance on stage—and even to improvise the triggering of video and sound in live performance. 

Your imagination and creativity are the only limits to what can be created with this new technology. Upon purchase you will receive the SABRe Multi Sensor, a receiver and the software. You can immediately use the Sensor in combination with your instrument, a laptop, and a microphone.

The Sabre Basic Sensor uses minimal software and hardware, which means it is easy to set up and transport. The sensor is fixed around the mouthpiece. It is simple to install and remove, and it effects only the exterior of the mouthpiece. 

You connect the receiver to your computer, and the sabre sensor communicates wirelessly with the software. The electronic sounds are triggered in three ways: by changing the air pressure into your mouthpiece; by moving the instrument in different directions; and by pressing two external switches.

Furthermore, it offers the opportunity for experienced programmers to design their own sounds and create their own compositions. However, the SABRe Sensor Software was designed to be accessible by musicians without special knowledge of programming. The Software is easy to use, and is formatted for both Mac and PC.

The Sabre Sensor can be used in any style of music: Contemporary Music, Jazz, Rock, etc. Audiences worldwide have consistently reacted with curiosity and excitement over the earlier prototypes of this new technology. By investing in the new Sabre Multi Sensor you will profit from the perks of this Indiegogo campaign.You will be at the cutting edge of an innovative new technology, and a member of the pioneering group of  SABRe users worldwide.

story:
We are a pop punk band from the New Haven area of CT. We all came together with the hopes of being in a band that we could be proud of. We are lucky enough to say that we made this come true. Over the past year we have recorded and released our first EP, been played on the radio, and released our music on all digital outlets. In addition to this we have had the privilege of sharing the stage with many amazing local and national acts such as Survay Says, Carousel Kings, and Hawthorne Heights.

We are excited to announce that we will be going on our first ever tour of New England this June! We are all so excited to make this happen and cannot wait to play in so many new places. We are now raising money for a van to safely get us from venue to venue (and taco bell). We have some fun incentives set up for you! We are very grateful for everything that has been done for us. The support of our friends, family, and fans means the world to us. Thank you all!

The support of our friends, family, and fans means the world to us. Thank you all!

story:
Howdy all :)

My name is Jamie-Lynn, otherwise, as a performer, known as Virginia Bee Hooker (a name derived from my late fathers side of the family - his musical mother, Virginia Bee, and his coal mining father "Hooker".)

 

I was blessed with a small town upbringing, in Farmington, West Virginia, on the same soil generations of my family have lived & loved. The common thread through my kin was and always has been: music. It has burned wildly in all of our blood, for generations, and I am no exception. It was the driving force behind my upbringing, and I feel deeply it is my purpose to create music that inspires and evokes emotion in others as much as it has always done for me. 

 

6 years ago I left my mountain roots & moved to Los Angeles to pursue songwriting. I've had the opportunity to immerse myself in a music scene that is home to some of the best musicians, singers, and songwriters this side of the Mississippi, and it has helped me explore & fine tune my sound, as well as challenged me to reach higher with my artistic ambitions. So this summer, I'm making my first album: Mountain Lion. 

 

It's been a long time coming, so I'm over the moon to be so close to sharing this music with you. These songs have lived in my head, my heart, and my journals over the years for far too long. It's time to give them a proper home and chance to be heard.

 

With studio rental, session musicians, mixing, mastering, and distribution, it takes a village (and a pretty penny), so I'm reaching out to friends, family, music lovers and fellow creatives to ask for your help in raising the remaining funds it will take to make my dream of releasing this music a reality. 

 

Every contribution is truly appreciated. There aren't words to encompass the gratitude I have for the kindness of those whom are helping me on this journey. 

 

With wild & wonderful love, 

Virginia Bee

story:
SEND OUR IRISH TRAD MUSIC forged in America BACK to... THAILAND!

The Short Story

As Boston-based Irish music duo Matt & Shannon Heaton, we perform updated and traditional music around the globe. We’ve got four duo CDs to date.

We’re raising money to help record our fifth duo album, “Tell You in Earnest” and then to do our first CD Release concert for the album in... Suphanburi, Thailand.

Wait… What? Thailand?

Before we spent our  time traveling to Ireland to play tunes and songs, there was Suphanburi, the Thai village where Shannon spent her first year in college. She was taken in by the Thai music crowd there and learned of the power of being part of a community dedicated to a tradition much bigger and older than any one person. (She also learned to speak Thai fluently. Go ahead: ask her to say something in Thai!)

In February we will bring things full circle round and launch our newest CD in Suphanburi: we’ll play a free concert for our generous community, since that's the Thai way. And to help other kids who are finding their voice through traditional music, we'll send 10% of funds raised to the Thai music and dance program at Bangkok’s Mercy Centre, a home for some of the poorest kids in Thailand.

With your help, we'll take our music back to where Shannon first got the trad music bug. (This time around, we’ll have plenty of mosquito repellent…).

What we need

We’re raising money to defray travel costs. If we reach that goal, we'll up our target amount to cover CD production/manufacture. 10% of the money we raise will go to the Mercy Centre.

What we’re offering

In exchange for your support to unite trad musicians and music lovers across the globe, we also have imaginative, exotic, exclusive gifts of gratitude, including:

MUSIC: CDs, exclusive collections, songbooks, lessons, compositions

KID STUFF: coloring posters, songbooks, CDs, toys from Thailand

EXOTIC THAI TREATS: secret family recipes, Shannon's "Guide to Ordering in Thai Restaurants," Thai textiles, postcards from the Kingdom, field trip to a Thai restaurant with Shannon

More on the new CD:

This Fall, we will record our fifth duo CD, “Tell You in Earnest.” We are calling this a collection of "Dialog Ballads." Basically, each song isa 2-character short play, and the action is driven along by conversation. Some of these conversations are juicy, some are heartbreaking, some are just weird.

When the album comes out in February, we will perform a free CD Release show in Suphanburi for Shannon's beloved mentors and our dear friends. We will talk about the stories in the songs and compare them to favorite Thai stories, demonstrating universal song themes, celebrating cultural differences. Matt will play beautifully and say hello and thank you. Shannon will do the rest of the talking in Thai.

Why we are asking for money:

The tour in Thailand and making the album are considerable expenses; and the special concert in Suphanburi will be a free concert for the community there. Therefore the album and travel costs will not be covered by this gig, or the other gigs we have lined up in Thailand.

So, we need help with recording and travel costs. And while we’re at it, we’ll send 10% of the money to the kids at Bangkok's Mercy Centre. They’ve got a growing Thai traditional music and dance program that Irish music’s own Mick Moloney has helped to build. We believe in the transcendent power of traditional music to unite and empower participants of all levels and ages. And it will be our honor and privilege to offer financial support to the Mercy Centre.

A side benefit of asking for money is that we get to share our story and our process with you. It takes a village… in this case, several! We hope you will be excited to invest in this album—and the CD launch in Suphanburi. With your support, we will build a bridge between three distinct traditional music communities: America, Ireland, and Thailand.

Traditional music really is an international language. This is community-based music, and we are grateful to have the support of such beautiful, diverse communities. Thank you for your support.

Money will help... so will spreading the word!

If this is a lean time for you, we are grateful for any word-of-mouth support! PLEASE SHARE THIS WITH YOUR FRIENDS AND FAMILY. Spread the word about Matt & Shannon Heaton and our fabulous funding campaign, which will also help the kids at The Mercy Centre!

story:
About the Chaos Orchestra

Already making waves in London and the UK, the Chaos Orchestra consists of some of London’s most high-calibre creative young performers. Highly committed to creating a spectacle, this 20-piece big band plays contemporary music by some of the UK’s finest young composers and improvisers including Laura Jurd, Elliot Galvin, Alex Roth and Simon Marsh amongst others. With a passion for new music this hard hitting, cross-genre ensemble is reminiscent of the eighties powerhouse ‘Loose Tubes’, whilst developing a truly unique, ever-evolving identity of its own.

The Album

This July we'll be recording our debut album. This is hugely exciting for us as it will enable us to capture some fantastic new music written by young composers in the UK. 

  • Whilst we've managed to raise some funds ourselves, we need an additional £3000 to help make the project happen.
  • We're giving you the chance to pre-order the album today, as well as providing additional perks depending on your donation.
  • This will go towards recording, mixing and mastering, as well as artwork and manufacturing.
  • Whilst we are super keen to reach our target every little bit helps, so please don't hesitate to make a donation.

The Impact

Today in the UK, it is extremely challenging to make large-scale projects take-off. In the current financial climate the likes of recording a large ensemble album is no walk in the park! By making a donation you could help bring an exciting, refreshing new large-ensemble sound to people's attention. 

  • Whilst there are many fantastic big bands in the UK, we believe that no other sounds quite like this one.
  • Anyone who has heard The Chaos Orchestra before will tell you just how exciting the band is performing live and in terms of its original, engaging repertoire of new music.
  • A great album can change the world!! Let's make it happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially, don't worry. There are a number of other ways in which you can help the cause.

  • Why not share this webpage with your friends, via facebook, twitter, email etc.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools to do this!

In the immortal words of Stevie Wonder -

'Music is a world within itself, with a language we all understand.'

story:
Here's The Deal

The Wandering Monks are set to play at this years NXNE in Toronto on June 14th. Now all they need are the funds to make it happen!!

What We Need to Fund Specifically

It's simple:

We need to raise enough money for round trip airfare for 2 with passports

We'll need a hotel room for two nights and a couple meals per day

We will need to get a cab ride to and from the show, and to the Airpot.

The Impact

As you know, we are passionate about spreading the message of Peace through intelligent and focused global transformation. By creatively using funky musical melodies to inspire a feeling of jubilation, we can hip a whole new Canadien audience to the global movement towards this Love Revolution. Traveling to Toronto will be one more important step towards the Monks continued journey in Musical success, but more importantly in connecting even more like minded Freedom loving individuals to the message of the Jubilee:

  • As usual, we will spread the concept of a Usury free currency plan
  • We will educate and network around community building and localization
  • We will expose a whole new community to our unique positive Hip Hop vibe

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have extra money in this Babylon system, that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Ask people you know to get the word out and make some noise about our Group, and our campaign.
  • Share this link with anyone who might have an extra dollar to support a good cause!

As always, we are eternally grateful for our blessings and opportunities in this world. We are honored every time we get to share our craft with the world, and we know our community is essential to our dreams, passions and overall happiness in this life. We Give Thanks for all your positive support!

Peace,

The Wandering Monks!

story:
Who are we?

Two people in the Netherlands and five in Indonesia. We are ready and the music is ready.Now these seven people need to be brought together to create the song Hot&Spicy.



MANNEQUIN.
They are five girls: Dearly, Nathalie, Gina, Keyla and Dayna. The band started in 2012 and currently have three songs available at iTunes: MATA LELAKI, JANGAN BILANG SIAPA SIAPA and KEMBALI. Mannequin is often found on stage throughout Indonesia.

They started out as models but were then drafted for the Mannequin project. Now, we hope for a new sound with Hot&Spicy.



JOSSCY AARTSEN
Director and initiator of the Hot&Spicy project. During his first crowd funded project PERJALANAN he met the girls in Indonesia. He wrote the lyrics and thought it would be a good idea to combine L5 Records and Mannequin and let them work together.
The film director hopes he can accomplish the goal and eventually create the music video for the project. He will be supported by his Art director: Suleigha Winkel. More info about Josscy can be found here.

ALEX SITANIA.
Don Alca as he is called is owner of L5 Records. He has a unique style and favors many genres, such as R&B and dance. He has collaborated with a lot of artists and loves to help and give advice to beginning artists and producers. Last year he managed to enter the Dutch Top 40 with the song CHICO LOCO by Davito. Now he wants follow his roots and work together with the Indonesian band Mannequin, with a song he exclusively wrote for them.

Now what is the song about?

The song will be Indonesian/English. It is influenced by Dubstep, Dance and K-Pop and together with the beats from Don Alca, it creates a unique song.

Heat, sweat, red are we talking about passion, chilies or the passion for chilies?
This is what the song is about. Without revealing too much, it is about these similarities between passion and chilies that created hot&spicy. Not your basic love or party song, but a unique song with a twist.

The funding is used for these main things

   •   Travel: Two people will fly to Indonesia to meet up with Mannequin and its team.
   •   After rehearsals, we will almost immediately get into the Studio to finalize Hot&Spicy.
   •   The song will be recorded, mixed and mastered.
  •   The proces will be documented with behind the scene footage.
  •   The music video will be shot.

The management team of Mannequin is also investing in the project we just need a small push to make it all happen. For your support you can get a special CD, signed by Mannequin an exclusive preview to the music video before it is even released and you even can record your own song at the L5 Records studio in the Netherlands.

Help us!

Help us realize the Hot & Spicy Project and we hope we can do a lot more in the future. We already completed a short film through crowd funding let us now prove ourselves again in the field of Music.

Even if you cannot help us financially, you can also help us just by supporting us. Spread the word! Let's make the world a little bit more Hot & Spicy.

Not your basic love or party song, but a unique song with a twist.The funding is used for these main things   •   Travel: Two people will fly to Indonesia to meet up with Mannequin and its team.    •   After rehearsals, we will almost immediately get into the Studio to finalize Hot&Spicy.    •   The song will be recorded, mixed and mastered.  •   The proces will be documented with behind the scene footage.  •   The music video will be shot.The management team of Mannequin is also investing in the project we just need a small push to make it all happen. For your support you can get a special CD, signed by Mannequin an exclusive preview to the music video before it is even released and you even can record your own song at the L5 Records studio in the Netherlands.Help us!Help us realize the Hot & Spicy Project and we hope we can do a lot more in the future. We already completed a short film through crowd funding let us now prove ourselves again in the field of Music.Even if you cannot help us financially, you can also help us just by supporting us. Spread the word! Let's make the world a little bit more Hot & Spicy.

story:
Who is Skylar Kaylyn?

Hi!  I am a 17-year old Christian singer/songwriter from a small town in Wyoming.  I have sung, danced and acted my whole life, but in 2012, I released my first album of original music and have been traveling as a "musicianary" ever since.  I have had some incredible experiences as I have traveled, and God has blessed me with an awesome family support system and new artist and music industry friends who have encouraged me in my dreams...to continue writing, singing and traveling to share the songs He has placed on my heart and to bring them to a city near YOU!

A New Album In The Works:

The experiences that I have singing and being in ministry over the last 4 years have really helped me to figure out who I am, what my "style" is musically and the things about which I am passionate and want to write.   My new songs are a good representation of this, and we decided it was about time to put these onto a new album.  Some of the 11 songs on this album were written about friend or family situations...like one is a song that I wrote to sing at a friend's wedding.  Another song is one I wrote when good friends of ours on the mission field tragically lost a family member.  Some are songs I have written when I was struggling in relationships, or just down right struggling about life in general.  Some songs are simply worshiping my Lord, and I hope they ALL bring Him glory and honor.  He is the reason that I sing!  Everything in my life - love, sorrow, trials, joy, celebrations - everything is an opportunity to worship Him through my music.  That's just the way He wired me, and I hope I use it to bring Him joy and enjoyment to all of YOU.

Through the blessing of technology, we have been able to stay here in Wyoming while we record in Nashville - how cool is THAT?  Financially, we have gotten my album to the point of having almost all of the songs started in the studio with various producers, engineers and session players.  I am privileged to work with some of the most amazing people in Nashville:  Eric Copeland, Producer and President of Creative Soul Records; Producer/Engineer Steve Dady of Sunset Blvd Studios has done all my tracking sessions, and Jonathan Crone - Musician/Producer/Engineer - is putting his touch on many of them and more to come.  Session musicians include the greats in Nashville such as guitarist Dave Cleveland, drummer Steve Brewster, bassists Gary Lunn and Danny O'Lannerty, pianist Blair Masters...I am beyond in awe of their talents and cannot WAIT to officially meet them!

How YOU Can Help Me:

I am putting my fundraiser limit at $10,000, and praying for God to bless this project with even more as He sees fit and if it be in His will, in Jesus' Name.  Here is the breakdown of what I actually need financially to continue, to go out to Nashville in July to record my vocals, and to hopefully get this album out by the fall when I will start to travel even more to share my music:

-Production expenses: approximately $8,900
-Photos/Design for album: $1,650
-Hair & Makeup for album photo session: $250
-CD Duplication, 1,000 CDs, 6-panel: $1,500
-Travel expenses to Nashville and back: approximately $700

BUT it's not just about the money!  I really need your prayer support and your encouragement, so besides donating, please join my team by:

-FOLLOWING ME on Facebook, Instagram & Twitter
-Praying for WISDOM and DIRECTION as we complete this project, for SAFETY in our travels and for GUIDANCE in our bookings, and for ME as I write new songs, that I would listen to the words HE speaks to me
-CONTACTING ME at my booking tab on my website if you have an event or venue where I can come help you in ministry
-SPREADING THE WORD about this project

Places you can connect with me on social media so that you can share this project:
www.facebook.com/skylarkaylyn
www.skylarkaylyn.com
www.twitter.com/SkylarKaylyn
www.instagram.com/skylarkmuzic

What You Get In Return:

My eternal gratitude, for one thing!  But also, here are just a few of the special things I'd like to give you once our project is funded and completed. 

My new poster:


My  new bracelet:


My "La La La" album:


(Produced by Corey Cofield for I60 Studios)


Take Control tee shirt:

'


My NEW Hebrews tee shirt:


A special "Just For You" shirt and/or hoodie:


And more!

One more thing:

I wanted to tell you about a ministry that I am very happy to be working with to fight against child trafficking.  Zoe International fights against trafficking by engaging in prevention, intervention and aftercare, and and I am so privileged to be joining them in ministry.  Most importantly, I hope to help people be aware of this growing evil industry, that it even affects us here in the United States...it DOES affect us, because every child's life is precious, and we are called to defend the innocent and needy.  In Isaiah 1:17, God says, "Learn to do right; seek justice.  Defend the oppressed.  Take up the cause of the fatherless..."  That is what I want to do...to fight against the wickedness of child trafficking.  I pray that I can impact those around me to do the same.


And That's All She Wrote:

Thank you SO MUCH for listening and reading about this project, and for your support!  I pray this for each of you reading this:

“The Lord bless you and keep you;
The Lord make His face shine upon you,
And be gracious to you;
The Lord lift up His countenance upon you,
And give you peace.”’ Numbers 6:24-26

(Video editing done by Jeahn Laffitte, Subsidized Sounds.  Special thanks to Peter Soby for consulting done on the creation of this fundraiser.)

story:
Short Summary

Weak Willed is a two piece electronic band from Austin, TX.

  • The band was started in 2014 by two best friends. 
  • This campaign will help raise funds for Weak Willed to create a full length album which will be released in the summer of 2014. 
  • Contributors will help make this aspiration and goal possible. 

What We Need & What You Get

It's simple:

  • We're looking to raise $ 1,000 USD to help create, record, and distribute our album. This means iTunes, Spotify, Pandora Radio, and possible physical (CD & Vinyl) releases in select record stores. 
  • If you contribute you will appear on our record as an "executive producer" 
  • Any extra funds raised from this project will be put back into the band to help fund extra recording time, equipment, or a CD release party which every contributor will be invited as a VIP guest.

story:
Who We Are

Hi. My name is Julie Wagner and I am the co-founder of Muse Academy of Music. My husband, Steven, and I started Muse Academy with the goal of providing exceptional music education in a creative, inspiring, and motivational atmosphere.  With over a decade of teaching experience and advanced degrees in music from prestigious schools such as the Peabody Conservatory and Yale University, Steven and I are committed to bringing our expertise to the San Diego community.

Muse Academy of Music has been operating in San Diego for the past 6 months; and in that short time, we have had some great experiences. Now, we are ready to grow and reach even more students.  To do so, we need to raise money for a number of supplies and for marketing.  Having high quality new instruments to play and teach would mean so much to our Academy and to our students. It would be so beneficial for our students of all ages to have exposure to fine instruments and other necessary supplies. 

We are currently teaching out of church classroom space, using the church's piano. While we immensely appreciate the generosity of the church, we feel that having our own high quality instrument and eventually our own space will help us to expand and help our students grow as musicians at the same time. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise $3000 to help expand and reach even more students in our community.  This amount will be a great help, as it will help us add to our library of instruments, music books, music stands and other supplies. It will also help us to get the word out to the greater community through marketing and eventually retaining our own studio space for teaching.

We are offering some exciting perks, such as Muse Academy of Music t-shirts, tote bags, and even private music lessons (in-person in San Diego or via Skype if not local).

The Impact

Music is such an important part of life and more and more prevalent are the studies that show the countless benefits of studying music. From helping develop motor skills, social skills, and focus to boosting brain development and even test scores, music can be therapeutic, educational, and most importantly fun. Muse Academy strives to convey all of these properties by not only providing exceptional music education but by also engaging, motivating, and inspiring students in study. We help students learn their own way: by listening, playing games, even composing their own music. Our campaign will help us to further this goal and will help us to be able to bring this progressive attitude to even more students.

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate any and all help and contributions. If you are not able to contribute financially at this point, we ask that you consider helping us get the word out about our campaign and about Muse Academy of Music in general. Please help us by sharing on Facebook, Twitter, etc. Don't forget to use Indiegogo's sharing tool as well.

story:
Bonjour, Guten Tag, Hello

My name is Karine Champagne, I am a globe trotter singer, songwriter. I spent my childhood in Québec, Canada and my adulthood around the world. My singing passion was born in the USA, I trained my voice  in Canada and composed my first album in the Netherlands. Germany allowed me to tour, create my second album and put up an amazing show. I am now in Finland, wondering how it can go on...


Living and learning, crying and hoping that it will be O.K.  is what I write about. A little freshness in a challenging world.  My duo with the talented bass player Guido Käpernick has toured for the last 4 years. We have pleased big crowds and small audiences by performing intimate and energetic concerts. 


We have 4 new songs. They are already recorded and have been performed many times. The comments are great...those are our best songs so far...(says the crowd)! I want to give them to you...for your car rides, your coffee breaks and your walks in the park... But, the tracks are stuck in our hard drives... We are missing half the funds to reach our goal...reaching your ears! 


So far, we have paid: 

3 very creative musicians (Guitars, Trombones, Drums)

2 studio technicians

2 days of studio (Magdeburg & Berlin)

1 photographer

Total: 887.00 euro



We still need to pay: 

Mixing of the EP

Mastering of the EP

Pressing of the EP (hard copies)

Digital distribution of the EP 

Total: 853.00 euro


With your help and support, we will pay 2 studio engineers for the mixing and the mastering of our new songs, press 100 copies and pay the fees for the digital distribution. With your help we will set those beautiful songs free! 


What is in it for you? Check out our great perk list... you win by giving! 


You are also broke? Making noise about our campaign is worth gold to us! You can still can get your tracks later...when everything is better again!
