story:
My name is Wendy Darling

I have worked in the business of music and dance since I was 3. At the age of 14 I met my first Love and late husband David Carron. He played at Woodstock on the Free stage, made an album on Columbia Records and wrote a top 40 hit song for Alice Cooper. He and my father built the stage on the shore of the lake for as a platform. Music and Mermaids began to bubble up in 1967 and music became a wonderful part of our life. I have been promoting concert events in the summer since that time. Music, food, family fun, kids of all ages and magical unions are made. Last year was a rough year for many and although we have created these events without charge, it has become increasingly more difficult to do so. We are asking for assistance to continue to gather and connect. Some of the music we have promoted has helped bands further their musical careers and meet other musicians, creating an opportunity to make more amazing music. It has been a very important venue to many. With your kindness and generosity we hope to continue for years to come.


What We Need & What You Get

$5.~$10.~$20.~$30.~$40. any size donation is humbly accepted with deep gratitude.
There are perks for some contributions of $50. or more. A $50. donation, you may choose to receive. There is a (rare CD of music by Shenandoah) which is not easily attainable. With a $100. donation you may choose a (compilation CD from 1969-85 David Carron Quarry, Shenandoah, Blindate) and with a $200. you may choose a (handcrafted crown) from Faiery Crown Cottage. With a $300. donation the perk is an original piece from Wendy Darling designs (sterling silver earrings), a $500. donation you may choose a (sterling silver bracelet) and with a $1000. the option is a (gemstone sterling necklace) by Wendy Darling Designs. With many Blessings.

The Impact

The people who attend these events leave changed in a very positive way and meet like minded people, other musicians and create new contacts. The children share with other children in new connected ways. The music lifts and transforms the soul. Many have experienced great value in these gatherings, either making music on a level they had not before, or meeting and connecting with other musicians to create new music. The Love people share and leave with is carried into the world heart to heart, one person at a time, making a big difference in all of our lives.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our campaign with your friends, it is a great way to spend a summer day! We thank you with deep, deep, appreciation for your kindness and care, with Blessings.

story:
CONNOR CHRISTIAN & SOUTHERN GOTHIC

We have always been and will always be a touring band.  There’s nothing we love more than traveling all over the country, playing our music to fans with whom we’ve connected through songs, and experiencing and sharing life through music, from town to town, state to state.  Unfortunately, with that come the hazards and challenges of hard travel.  Blown tires, broken AC, busted belts, bad transmissions, and most recently, the worst of ‘em all, a dead engine.  Not a valve or a seal, a hose or a sensor – the whole damn thing.  And so we’re here to ask for your help, to keep us on the road, taking our music where it matters most – to the stage, in front of people like you, who connect with it and connect with us. 

We don’t view you guys as a bank.  We don’t take this request lightly or do it without serious thought and consideration of every possible solution.   But we’re asking you to help keep us on the road so we can keep bringing our music to you, the way we’ve done for the better part of a decade.

Although we need your help, we also realize that times are tight, so we've kept almost all the donations levels as low as possible, AND we're not going to spend the money we raise on giving out rewards.  You'll notice that all the 'incentives' are things that are handmade by the band or donated by friends of the band, keeping the total that we need to stay on the road to an absolute minimum.  

We're fortunate enough to have had some good folks already step up and help us bridge the gap so we can get to & through Texas next week, but if we're going to get to any dates after that, we're gonna need a hand.      

Thanks for all you’ve done and all you can do.  We wouldn’t be here without you.

Cheers.

Connor, Spirko, Elena, Shawn and Rashad
Connor Christian & Southern Gothic
